column27: The application will serve as a virtual travel assistant, powered by AI-driven natural language processing (NLP). Users can interact with the application via text or voice to request services such as visa support, ticket booking, hotel reservations, and itinerary planning. The solution will ensure seamless automation, real-time integration with external systems, and personalized recommendations.
column28:
1. All-in-One Travel Concierge
•	Most apps handle only one aspect (e.g., ticket booking, hotel booking, or visa services).
•	This app uniquely combines Visa + Flights + Hotels + Itinerary into one conversational platform.
•	The user doesn’t need to jump between apps like Booking.com, Skyscanner, or embassy portals.
2. AI-Driven Conversational Experience
•	Unlike traditional travel apps with forms and filters, users simply talk or chat with the app.
•	Example: “I need a 7-day trip to Paris in November under $2000” → AI instantly creates a full plan (visa steps, flight, hotel, itinerary).
3. Visa Processing Integration
•	Most travel apps avoid visa support since it’s complex.
•	This solution offers AI-guided visa application:
o	Auto-filling forms from user data.
o	Document scanning (OCR).
o	Country-specific guidance.
o	Status tracking.
•	Makes it the first end-to-end solution for international travelers.
4. Dynamic & Personalized Itinerary
•	Traditional itineraries are static templates.
•	Here, the AI creates real-time adaptive itineraries:
o	If a flight is delayed, hotel check-in & activities get rescheduled.
o	Suggestions adjust to weather, local events, and personal preferences.
5. Smart Recommendations
•	Instead of just showing lists of hotels/flights, AI understands intent and context:
o	“I want a quiet hotel near a beach with vegan food” → Provides curated options.
o	Uses machine learning to refine recommendations based on past trips.
6. Seamless Integrations
•	Unified API connections with airlines, hotels, visa agencies, and payment systems.
•	Most apps specialize in one (e.g., Expedia = hotels, Amadeus = flights).
•	This app bridges multiple providers into one experience.
7. Localized & Multilingual Support
•	Converses in multiple languages (English, Bengali, Hindi, Spanish, etc.).
•	Provides country-specific visa rules dynamically — a feature missing in global apps.
8. Proactive AI Notifications
•	Beyond simple booking reminders, the AI acts like a personal agent:
o	Alerts on price drops for flights/hotels.
o	Reminds you of visa expiry.
o	Suggests nearby events or attractions in your itinerary.
9. Scalable Beyond Travel
•	The same AI agent framework can later expand into:
o	Insurance recommendations.
o	Local transport booking (Uber, rental cars).
o	Event ticketing.
o	Business travel compliance (for corporates).

column8: Technology - AI Technology of the Year (CT-AI)
column25:
Company Name: Rectify Learn
Institutional Affiliation: Bangladesh University of Professionals
Industry: EdTech (Educational Technology, SaaS)
Founded: 2025

About Us

Rectify Learn is an AI-driven learning platform designed to address one of the biggest challenges in education, the forgetting curve. Studies show that learners forget up to 90% of newly acquired knowledge within a week without reinforcement. Rectify Learn combines cognitive science principles (active recall and spaced repetition) with artificial intelligence to help students transform short-term memorization into durable, long-term knowledge.

Unlike traditional EdTech tools that overload learners with content, Rectify Learn acts as a personalized study companion. It adapts to each learner’s progress, identifies weak areas, and provides targeted reinforcement; ensuring deeper understanding, better exam performance, and lasting mastery.

Core Features
Adaptive Learning Engine – Tracks mastery scores and dynamically adjusts study paths.
Personal Study Planner – Creates and adapts individualized study schedules.
AI Mnemonic Generator – Generates creative acrostics, stories, and memory aids.

Automated Feedback – Provides instant corrections to prevent reinforcement of errors.
Analytics Dashboard – Offers a mastery heatmap, forgetting curve projections, and progress tracking.
RAG chatbot, Flashcards, Adaptive Quizzer with AI tutorbot.

Target Market

Rectify Learn is positioned to serve key cohorts in Bangladesh and beyond:

SSC & HSC Candidates (13–18 years): For exam preparation and retention.

University Students (18–25 years): For admissions and coursework mastery.

BCS & Government Job Aspirants (25–30 years): For competitive exam preparation.

Business Model
Rectify Learn follows a freemium subscription model:

Free Tier: Limited access (10 documents, 20 questions/flashcards per week).

Basic Tier (৳99/month): Progress tracking, weakness analysis, and enhanced features.
Premium Tier (৳250/month): Unlimited resources, personalized AI model, and advanced analytics.

column27:
Rectify Learn is an AI-powered learning platform designed to solve the problem of knowledge loss caused by the forgetting curve. It transforms traditional rote memorization into durable knowledge retention by combining cognitive science principles (active recall, spaced repetition) with a custom fine-tuned academic LLM and Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG).

Learners can upload their own study materials (PDFs, DOCX, images), and Rectify Learn automatically generates adaptive quizzes, flashcards, mnemonics, and personalized study plans. A built-in analytics dashboard continuously monitors progress, identifies weak areas, and schedules reviews at optimal times to maximize long-term mastery.
column28:
Neuroscience-Driven Learning: Unlike generic EdTech platforms that focus on content delivery, Rectify Learn is built on proven brain-science techniques that actively strengthen memory.

Personalized Academic LLM: A fine-tuned proprietary model designed specifically for education ensures higher accuracy and reliability than generic AI tools.

Content-Agnostic Design: Learners are not locked into preloaded libraries; they can use their own textbooks, notes, or guides for tailored practice.

Integrated RAG Pipeline: Merges user content with advanced AI for precise and context-aware quizzes, flashcards, and explanations.

Mastery Score & Feedback Loop: Tracks knowledge levels dynamically and provides targeted reinforcement, preventing repeated errors and wasted study time.
column29:
Adaptive Learning Engine
Calculates a Mastery Score (0–100) for each concept.
Prioritizes weaker areas while reinforcing stronger topics at spaced intervals.

Personal Study Planner
Breaks down syllabi into structured topics.
Uses backward planning to align with deadlines (e.g., exams).
Adjusts dynamically as learners progress.

AI Mnemonic Generator
Creates acrostics, stories, and memory hooks for complex terms, formulas, and lists.

Automated Feedback System
Instantly explains errors and provides corrected concepts.
Prevents reinforcement of wrong knowledge.

Smart Analytics Dashboard
Mastery Heatmap for quick visualization of progress.
Forgetting Curve Projection to predict memory decay.
Progress Tracking to measure growth over time.

Scalable & Accessible Platform
Supports PDFs, DOCX, and images with OCR for handwritten/printed notes.
Cloud-native architecture for efficient scaling and reliable performance.
column30:
Rectify Learn is built on a strong technical foundation that ensures both accuracy and scalability. At its core, the platform uses a Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) architecture combined with a fine-tuned Large Language Model (LLM) specialized in academic content. This hybrid design guarantees context-aware outputs that are more reliable than generic AI systems.

Key Technological Applications

Fine-Tuned Academic LLM – Trained on curated academic datasets to deliver accurate quizzes, explanations, and summaries tailored for education.

Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) – Allows learners to upload study materials (PDFs, DOCX, images). The system ingests, indexes, and retrieves relevant content to generate precise, context-based learning resources.

Document Processing Pipeline – Supports OCR for image-based notes, recursive text chunking, and semantic embedding generation for efficient similarity search.

Vector Database (pgvector + PostgreSQL) – Enables fast, scalable retrieval across millions of data chunks with HNSW indexing.

Adaptive Learning Algorithms – Uses a modified SM-2 spaced repetition model and mastery scoring system to dynamically adjust learning schedules.

Cloud-Native Microservices Architecture – Built for scalability and resilience using modern infrastructure (Supabase + cloud providers like AWS/Google Cloud).

column25: BRACU Mongol Tori is a student-led Mars rover research project from BRAC University, Bangladesh, developed by undergraduate students with a vision to design a versatile Mars rover. The primary goal of the project is to build a rover capable of analyzing Martian soil for exploration and potential habitability. Designed as a multi-purpose vehicle, the rover is engineered to support rescue missions, enable communication, and perform autonomous traversal in challenging environments. A long-term objective of the project is to make the rover fully independent in its operations. BRACU Mongol Tori has earned multiple accolades for its innovative approach and performance in prestigious competitions, including the Mars Society's University Rover Challenge (URC) and the Mars Society South Asia's International Rover Challenge (IRC), and is currently preparing for the European Rover Challenge (ERC).
column26: Team BRACU Mongol-Tori consists of 50 undergraduate students from interdisciplinary fields of engineering
column27: The primary goal of the project is to build a rover capable of analyzing Martian soil for exploration and potential habitability. Designed as a multi-purpose vehicle, the rover is engineered to support rescue missions, enable communication, and perform autonomous traversal in challenging environments. A long-term objective of the project is to make the rover fully independent in its operations.
column28: BRACU Mongol-Tori is Bangladesh’s pioneering university rover team, representing BRAC University in international competitions. What sets the team apart is its holistic approach to rover design, combining mechanical engineering, electronics, AI-driven software, and field-tested innovation. Unlike conventional projects, Mongol-Tori integrates local resources with cutting-edge global technologies, while fostering a student-driven research ecosystem that directly contributes to space robotics and exploration.
column29: The rover is designed to perform diverse mission tasks, including terrain navigation, autonomous path planning, sample collection, and real-time encrypted communication. It features an articulated robotic arm for precise manipulation, an advanced vision system for object detection, localization, and mapping, and modular subsystems that allow quick reconfiguration for different missions. The rover also emphasizes rugged durability, enabling it to operate in challenging environments similar to Martian or lunar terrain. The capability of the rover has been tested by scientists from NASA, NISSAN, and Mars Society in Mars Desert Research Station (MDRS), Utah, USA.
column30: Mongol-Tori leverages advanced technologies such as AI-powered image recognition, sensor fusion for navigation, and Mission-Critical Radio integration for long-range communication. The team utilizes industry-standard tools, Altium for PCB design and Ansys & SolidWorks for mechanical CAD, reflecting a professional-level workflow. This integration of modern engineering tools and innovative design inspired by the culture and tradition of Bangladesh not just ensures the rover’s reliability but also upholds the beauty of Bangladesh in international grounds.

column6: Peer-to-peer Rental and Resale Marketplace solution (Sharing economy platform).
column7: Cross Categories - Start- Up of the Year (CC-SU)
column8: Technology - AI Technology of the Year (CT-AI)
column10: Brittoo.xyz-Smart Sharing and Circular Economy platform
column25: Brittoo.xyz is a peer-to-peer rental and resale marketplace that empowers people to “Own Less, Access More.” We help individuals, students, and organizations unlock the hidden value of their idle assets by renting or reselling them with full security and transparency. Our platform uses AI-powered price negotiation, fraud detection, and credit-based access system to ensure trust and fairness. Brittoo promotes the circular economy in Bangladesh by reducing waste, making products more accessible, and enabling users to earn from unused items while others save costs through rentals.
column26:
Brittoo.xyz is driven by a passionate student-founded team from RUET (Rajshahi University of Engineering & Technology) with expertise in software engineering, AI, and IoT solutions.

Founder & CEO – Durjoy Saha: Entrepreneur with strong passion in startup building, business modeling, and leading innovation in the sharing economy.

Co-Founder & CTO:  Asadullah Al Galib ,Focused on building secure, scalable technology with AI integration and marketplace infrastructure.
IOT Head : Rifat Al Eman Shoron .Focuses on Building smart locks and IOT infrastructure .
CPO-Nabila Ferdous Prapty, working to make the product best market fit.
CFO-Ananya Halder ,manages the financial sectors.
CMO-Anika Tahasin,leads the marketing team.
column27: Brittoo.xyz is a peer-to-peer rental and resale marketplace that enables people to rent, resell, or access items without the hassle of traditional buying. Users can list idle items, which are verified by the Brittoo team, and earn security credits or cash that can be used to rent or buy other items. With AI-powered price bidding, damage protection, and installment-based buying, Brittoo makes it simple, safe, and smart for students, individuals, and businesses to participate in the circular economy.
column28: Brittoo’s uniqueness lies in its credit-based collateral system,like people need to keep a security money as a  security deposit or a equivalent product list on the platform as security deposit which also can be a source of income , and AI-driven agentic price bidder,AI based rental or selling price calculation. Instead of waiting to sell items on platforms like bikroy.com or Facebook, users instantly gain security credits to access other products. Unlike global models  Brittoo.xyz is localized for Bangladesh, focusing on student affordability, campus ecosystems, and community trust. The platform also introduces damage protection, fraud detection, and IoT smart locks, making rentals safer and more scalable.
column29:
Peer-to-Peer Rentals & Resale – List idle items and earn credits or cash.

Security Credit System – Access other products instantly without waiting for sales.

AI Price Bidder – Automates price negotiation for fair market value.

Damage Protection Insurance – 100% repair/replacement guarantee for listed items.

Installment Buying – Users can buy items in easy installments after resale credits.

Fraud Detection & Verification – AI + manual checks ensure trust and safety.

IoT Smart Locks (Future) – QR-based locks for cycles/equipment to simplify rentals.
column30:
Brittoo.xyz applies technology not just as a support tool, but as the core enabler of its marketplace. The platform integrates:

AI-Powered Systems→ Our agentic price bidder negotiates optimal market rates, while fraud detection algorithms evaluate user credibility and transaction safety.
Credit-Based Collateral System → A unique digital credit mechanism allows users to instantly access equivalent-value rentals without cash deposits, ensuring liquidity and trust.
Damage Protection Automation → Claims and item condition checks are streamlined with photo/video verification, supported by AI-based anomaly detection.
Scalable Web Platform → Built with modern full-stack architecture, ensuring smooth transactions, secure payments, and data transparency.
IoT Integration (Roadmap) → QR-based smart locks and lockers will extend the system into physical asset control, making cycle/equipment rentals seamless and trackable.

This ensures Brittoo is not only a business service but also a tech-driven, scalable, and secure ecosystem, setting new standards for peer-to-peer rentals in Bangladesh.

column10: Smart Eyes on Cloth – AI-Driven Fabric QC for Knit Finishing
column25: Our initiative focuses on transforming Bangladesh’s textile sector through ICT-driven automation. With a vision to digitize quality control in knit finishing, we are building the country’s first AI-powered QC system for stenter and compactor finishing machines. Our goal is to minimize defects, reduce wastage, and enhance buyer confidence, thereby positioning Bangladesh as a leader in smart textile manufacturing.
column26:
Md. Abdun Nur (Project Lead): Textile technology background, work experience in knit finishing QC, chemist officer, currently leading project development.
MD YASIN ZIHAD: AI/ML Engineer – responsible for model training & deployment.
Md Sajedul Islam: coordinator – dashboard & visualization module.
Shablu khan: Faculty/Industry expert providing guidance.
column27: Smart Eyes on Cloth is an AI-driven Fabric Inspection and QC Automation solution for knit finishing machines (stenter & compactor). The system integrates high-resolution cameras and AI defect detection models to identify flaws such as holes, creases, oil stains, and shade variations in real-time. It generates automated roll-wise QC reports using 4-point/10-point grading systems and provides managers with real-time dashboards, downloadable reports, and SMS alerts. The prototype aims to replace manual, error-prone QC with intelligent, scalable, and export-ready automation.
column28:
First in Bangladesh: No existing AI-driven QC for knit finishing.
Integration of Textile + AI: Bridges RMG industry needs with computer vision technology.
Scalable Design: Retrofit kit can be deployed in multiple factories.
Dual Impact: Industry benefit (efficiency & cost saving) + Academic research opportunity.
column29:
High-definition camera module for fabric capture.
AI defect detection software (holes, creases, stains, shade variation etc).
Automated QC reports (roll-wise, 4-point/10-point).
Dashboard & visualization (real-time defect alerts, PDF/Excel reports, SMS notifications).
Cloud-based analytics for managers and buyers (future expansion).
column30:
Uses state-of-the-art computer vision (YOLO/EfficientDet).
Target ≥80% detection accuracy in pilot testing.
Data-driven reporting ensures consistency, transparency, and reliability.
Fully aligned with Industry 4.0 & Smart Textile 4.0 vision.

column7: Cross Categories - Start- Up of the Year (CC-SU)
column8: Technology - AI Technology of the Year (CT-AI)
column25: SilentVoice BD is an open-source, full-stack innovation that bridges the communication gap for the Bangladeshi deaf community by recognizing Bangla Sign Language (BdSL) from videos. Established in 2025, the project is developed by a small, agile team of engineers and researchers passionate about inclusive technology. Our mission is to make sign language recognition accessible for education, research, and daily communication. The solution is built with a modular design combining a robust Java Spring Boot backend, Python AI pipeline, and a modern React frontend.
column26:
Sayad Ibna Azad – Independent Developer & Researcher (AI, Backend, Frontend, Integration)

SilentVoice BD is a one-person innovation project. Sayad independently designed, developed, and integrated the full stack — including the AI pipeline (MediaPipe + Bi-LSTM), Java Spring Boot backend, React frontend, and PostgreSQL database. While developed independently, the project is open-source and welcomes future community contributions.
column27:
SilentVoice BD enables users to upload sign language videos, which are then automatically processed into frames. Using MediaPipe for pose and hand landmark extraction and a Bi-LSTM model trained on the BDSL W60 dataset, the system translates Bangla sign language into Bangla text and speech. The platform provides:

Video upload & management

Automatic frame extraction

Real-time AI-based sign recognition

REST APIs for seamless integration

A web-based frontend for accessibility

Accuracy ranges from 90–98% on benchmark datasets, and the system is designed to handle large datasets with asynchronous processing.
column28: SilentVoice BD is the first Bangla sign language recognition platform combining AI, pose estimation, and a full-stack modular design for real-world use. Unlike global sign recognition systems that ignore regional languages, SilentVoice BD is trained specifically on Bangla datasets, ensuring cultural and linguistic accuracy. Its open-source MIT license allows researchers, developers, and institutions to build upon it freely.
column29:
Upload, manage, and analyze sign language videos

Automatic frame extraction & pose landmark detection

LSTM-based sign recognition with high accuracy

Real-time inference support

RESTful APIs for third-party apps

Extensible for new signs, datasets, or AI models

React-based frontend for ease of use

Future roadmap includes live translation, mobile apps, multi-language sign support, and cloud deployment
column30: SilentVoice BD integrates state-of-the-art AI/ML techniques (MediaPipe, TensorFlow/Keras Bi-LSTM) with scalable backend infrastructure (Spring Boot + PostgreSQL). It demonstrates robust performance in varying lighting, orientations, and video conditions. With 90–98% accuracy on the BDSL W60 dataset, it has been validated on real Bangla sign videos. Its modular architecture makes it extensible and future-ready for integration into education platforms, government services, and accessibility tools.

column7: Cross Categories - Start- Up of the Year (CC-SU)
column8: Technology - AI Technology of the Year (CT-AI)
column25:
SilentVoice BD is a full-stack, AI-powered Bangla sign language recognition platform designed and developed solely by me, Sayad Ibna Azad, as an undergraduate student at the Islamic University of Technology (IUT). The project addresses the communication challenges faced by the deaf and mute community in Bangladesh by translating Bangla sign language into text and speech in real time.

Built using a modular architecture, the solution combines a Java Spring Boot backend, Python AI pipeline (MediaPipe + Bi-LSTM), and a React frontend with PostgreSQL as the database. The platform is fully open-source (MIT License) to encourage research, innovation, and community contributions, reflecting a mission to make sign language accessible for education, communication, and digital inclusion.
column26:
Sayad Ibna Azad – Solo Developer & Researcher

Responsible for all aspects of the project: backend, frontend, AI model development, integration, database design, and deployment.

Designed and trained the Bi-LSTM AI model using the BDSL W60 dataset.

Developed the video processing pipeline, pose estimation integration, RESTful APIs, and the user interface.

Note: SilentVoice BD is a one-person innovation project, demonstrating the ability to deliver a high-quality, end-to-end ICT solution independently. Future contributions from the community are welcomed via the open-source platform.
column27:
SilentVoice BD is an AI-enabled Bangla sign language recognition platform that allows users to upload videos, automatically extract frames, and analyze gestures using MediaPipe for pose estimation and a Bi-LSTM neural network for gesture recognition. The system translates signs into Bangla text and speech, enabling real-time communication for the deaf and mute community.

Key capabilities:

Video upload and management with support for multiple formats (MP4, AVI, MOV, WebM)

Automatic frame extraction for efficient processing

Pose and hand landmark extraction using MediaPipe

High-accuracy gesture recognition with the Bi-LSTM model (90–98% on BDSL W60)

RESTful APIs for seamless integration into other applications

Modular and asynchronous design for scalable video processing
column28:
SilentVoice BD stands out as the first comprehensive Bangla sign language recognition platform designed specifically for the Bangladeshi community. Unlike generic sign recognition systems, it is:

Culturally and linguistically tailored to Bangla signs

Fully end-to-end developed by a student, showcasing independent innovation

Open-source, promoting accessibility, research, and community collaboration

Designed to work with low-resource environments, enabling real-world deployment in schools, NGOs, and remote areas

This combination of AI accuracy, social impact, and solo development effort makes SilentVoice BD unique and highly relevant for awards focused on innovation and inclusivity.
column29:
Video Upload & Management: Upload, stream, and organize sign language videos

Frame Extraction: Efficiently converts videos into frames for AI analysis

Pose Estimation: Hand and body landmarks extracted via MediaPipe

AI Sign Recognition: Bi-LSTM model translates 60+ Bangla sign gestures into text and speech

Real-Time Processing: Asynchronous design enables near real-time inference

RESTful APIs: Integration-ready endpoints for AI predictions and video management

Extensible: Easy addition of new sign classes, datasets, and AI models

Frontend UI: Interactive React interface designed for accessibility and ease of use

Future Roadmap: Real-time live translation, multi-language support, mobile deployment, cloud integration
column30:
AI/ML Excellence: Bi-LSTM model trained with the BDSL W60 dataset, achieving 90–98% accuracy across diverse lighting and hand orientations.

Robust Backend: Java Spring Boot with PostgreSQL ensures scalable, secure, and efficient data handling.

Advanced Video Processing: MediaPipe integration provides high-quality pose and hand landmark detection.

Open-Source & Modular: Python AI pipeline is loosely coupled with backend, allowing easy upgrades and model swaps.

Community & Educational Impact: Designed to aid schools, NGOs, and individuals, enabling digital accessibility for the Bangladeshi deaf and mute community.

Performance & Scalability: Optimized for asynchronous processing of large video datasets, with low memory footprint and cross-platform support.

column27:
Bloomy – Within You is an AI-powered mental wellness ecosystem built to tackle one of Bangladesh’s most urgent youth crises: alarming rates of depression, anxiety, and suicide. Bloomy redefines mental health support by placing the power to heal directly in the hands of students and young changemakers, providing a vital lifeline where conventional care is often inaccessible.

Powered by cutting-edge natural language processing and machine learning, Bloomy offers daily mood tracking, guided journaling, habit-building guidance, 24/7 CBT-based AI support, and mindfulness exercises—all in one integrated platform. It not only understands each user's emotional state and life patterns, but can proactively identify signals of distress, instantly recommending professional help and alerting trusted mentors or friends for fast, life-saving intervention.

Bloomy is lightweight, scalable, and purposefully designed for universal access, reaching youth in both urban and underserved communities. By fighting stigma and democratizing care, Bloomy aims to transform the future of mental health in Bangladesh—empowering young people to “Know Thyself” and thrive with renewed hope and resilience.
column28:
Bloomy – Within You stands apart as Bangladesh’s first holistic, youth-centered AI mental health ecosystem, purpose-built for the realities of students and young changemakers. Unlike existing platforms—including Monotorongo, Relaxy, and Hello-02—which focus mainly on resource access, basic chatbots, or appointment booking, Bloomy seamlessly integrates daily mood tracking, guided journaling, AI-driven CBT support, mindfulness, and instant habit-building support.

What truly distinguishes Bloomy is its advanced machine learning, which proactively analyzes real-time emotional patterns and instantly enables intervention by notifying mentors or counselors—not just relying on user-initiated help. Bloomy’s features merge deep personalized self-care with a community safety net, making crisis prevention and emotional resilience accessible even in underserved communities.

By embodying the philosophy of “Know Thyself” and combining emotional intelligence, proactive prevention, and Bangladesh-specific cultural sensitivity, Bloomy is the first solution to offer a truly empowering, preventative, and scalable mental wellness ecosystem for the next generation.
column29:
Guided Mood Tracking: Users check in daily using intuitive, culturally-relevant mood selectors, enabling personal emotional awareness and early detection of emotional shifts.

Reflective Journaling: Private, secure journaling prompts support self-reflection and help capture thoughts, experiences, or triggers connected to each mood state.

24/7 AI-Powered CBT Support: An empathetic chatbot, powered by advanced natural language processing, offers cognitive behavioral therapy–based support, problem-solving strategies, and motivational guidance anytime it’s needed.

Mindfulness and Habit-Building Exercises: Interactive, skill-building activities and mindfulness practices are available for stress reduction, improved focus, and the formation of healthy daily habits.

Real-Time Pattern Recognition: Machine learning analyzes user entries and interactions to identify changes in behavior, mood, or mental health risks.

Proactive Safety Net: When the AI detects early warning signs or emotional distress, it proactively recommends seeking help and can instantly alert a trusted mentor, friend, or counselor to ensure rapid intervention.

Community and Professional Integration: Users can opt to connect with mental health professionals or a support network, enhancing care options and result tracking.

User-Centered Design: Lightweight, intuitive interface designed for accessibility on low-end devices; possible future local language support.

Privacy and Security: All personal data and journal entries are encrypted and user-controlled, ensuring strict privacy and confidentiality.
column30:
Bloomy – Within You sets a new benchmark for mental health technology in Bangladesh by integrating state-of-the-art artificial intelligence, natural language processing, and machine learning to deliver high-impact wellness solutions. Its AI-powered chatbot utilizes advanced NLP to offer empathetic, culturally-sensitive CBT support tailored to each user's emotional state, enabling more meaningful and adaptive guidance than traditional scripted bots.

Machine learning algorithms continuously analyze user interactions and mood data to identify subtle patterns, allowing Bloomy to proactively detect early signs of emotional distress and suggest actionable interventions. The system’s robust architecture ensures privacy and responsiveness even on low-end devices with intermittent connectivity, making high-quality care universally accessible.

Bloomy’s real innovation lies in combining continuous self-care tools with an automatic safety net, powered by real-time data analysis and instant notification features. This proactive technology addresses prevention, personalization, and crisis intervention—bridging the gap between self-help and professional care in a truly scalable, context-aware platform.

This fusion of advanced AI and practical user experience guarantees that Bloomy delivers reliable, effective, and lifesaving mental health support to Bangladesh’s youth, wherever and whenever it’s needed most.

column8: Technology - IOT of the Year (CT-IOT)
column10: UrbanLink: Smart Urban Mobility and Emergency Response Platform for Bangladesh
column14: Department of Computer Science and Engineering, University of Dhaka
column25: DU_paanpata is a student-led innovation team passionate about leveraging technology and creative thinking to develop solutions that can address real-world challenges. We focus on innovation, adaptability, and impact, aiming to make a difference wherever our ideas can be applied.
column26:
Team Name : DU_paanpata
Members:
1. Tanzeem Maliat - Team Leader
2. Asfin Jannat Shamsi – Member
column27:
Urban centers in Bangladesh, particularly Dhaka and Chattogram, face significant challenges due to traffic congestion and delayed emergency response. Peak-hour traffic frequently reduces vehicle speeds below 5 km/h, resulting in substantial economic losses, increased fuel consumption, and logistical inefficiencies. Road accidents and other emergency situations
often experience delayed detection and response, negatively impacting public safety.

The proposed platform addresses both challenges through an integrated system of low-cost IoT traffic sensors, existing CCTV cameras, and edge computing nodes. Traffic data is compressed to optimize network usage, while critical events, such as accidents or emergency vehicle movements, are prioritized for immediate processing. This dual approach facilitates improved traffic flow, expedited emergency response, and the generation of actionable data for city traffic management, logistics, ride-sharing, and municipal planning.
column28:
The platform differentiates itself by addressing traffic congestion and public safety concurrently within a single industrial-grade system:
• Integrated Solution: Combines urban mobility optimization with emergency response management.
• Locally Tailored: Designed specifically for Bangladesh’s low-bandwidth networks, intermittent power supply, and budget-sensitive contexts.
• Scalable and Industrial-Ready: Capable of incremental deployment, starting from high-priority junctions or hospital zones and expanding to cover entire cities.
• Economic and Social Value: Supports commercial operations such as fleet management and ride-sharing, while simultaneously enhancing public safety.
column29:
The platform provides the following capabilities:
• Real-Time Traffic Monitoring: IoT sensors and cameras continuously monitor
vehicle movement and congestion.
• Dynamic Traffic Signal Control: AI algorithms adjust traffic lights dynamically,
reducing congestion by an estimated 15–20% during peak hours.
• Emergency Vehicle Prioritization: Ambulances and first responders are provided with priority routing, reducing response times by up to 30%.
• Incident Detection: Accidents, traffic violations, and anomalous events are detected and flagged in real time for rapid intervention.
• Data Analytics Dashboards: Actionable insights for traffic authorities, logistics operators, and emergency coordinators.
• Bandwidth and Energy Efficiency: Data compression reduces network load and storage requirements by approximately 70–80%, extending sensor lifetime and reducing operational costs.
• Modular Deployment: Can be deployed in phases, starting in critical areas and scaling to cover entire cities, with potential integration of additional services such as flood alerts or public transport scheduling.
column30:
The platform is designed for industrial robustness and practical deployment:
• Compressed Sensing: Minimizes redundant data, conserving bandwidth and extending sensor life.
• Edge Computing (MEC): Processes critical events locally for near-instant response, ensuring scalability and reliability.
• Artificial Intelligence: Detects congestion patterns, accidents, and anomalous events, enabling proactive management.
• Resilient Design: Low-power, durable sensors operate in extreme weather, with optional solar support for uninterrupted service.
• Congestion Reduction: 15–20% improvement in average traffic speeds during peak hours.
• Emergency Response: Up to 30% reduction in ambulance and first responder travel times

column6: Eco-friendly health and environmental safety solution for sustainable mosquito control.
column7: Cross Categories - Start- Up of the Year (CC-SU)
column25: Buzz Shield is an innovative, sustainable, eco-friendly mosquito control solution addressing mosquito borne diseases as each year thousands of people suffer various disease such as Dengue, Malaria and chikungunya. Unlike chemical repellents that pollute air and harm lungs, our trap uses safe, non-toxic technology to attract and eliminate mosquitoes. Designed by young innovators, it combines public health, climate resilience and sustainability, aiming to reduce mosquito-borne diseases, protect vulnerable communities, and create healthier living environments.
column26:
The team consists of students and youth innovators from Khulna University, with expertise in environmental research, IoT solutions and sustainable innovation. Our members include:
1.Nishat Jahan Nadira – CEO 
2.Md. Mokkarum Hossain – Technical Development
3.Mefaduzzaman Ratul – Finance Manager
4.Md. Showrov Hossain – Operational Head
5.Mithila Akter – Community Engagement & Communication
column27: Buzz Shield is a smart mosquito control trap that have a bucket made from paper pulp, has attractants that mimics human scent and body heat to lure and capture mosquitoes. Then it has killing powder that is actually a type of bacteria that forms protein crystal in the digestive system of the mosquito that kills both the mosquito and larvae. This product is used like first the bucket is kept in a room of any apartment as it covers 2-3 rooms then pour 1 liter water in it add attractants and killing powder the product is ready to for 25-30 days no need to worry. It is eco-friendly, safe for children and pets and eliminates the need for chemical repellents that cause indoor air pollution. The device supports IoT integration for monitoring and is built with recyclable materials for sustainability. It aims to disrupt mosquito breeding cycles, reduce disease incidence and support climate adaptation in vulnerable regions.
column28: Buzz Shield is unique because it combines bacterial activity with eco-friendly design, unlike existing repellents that only repel temporarily. It is toxic chemical-free, energy-efficient and scalable for both urban and rural communities. One Buzz shield can cover 2-3 rooms plus stay for 25-30days. Hence one doesn't need to buy and light up coil, good night or spray as they make the air unbreathable. Also, it just repels where ours eliminates thus it reduces the productive system rate of Ades mosquito. no other mosquito controlling system has this capacity to last this long and to cover this vast area.
column29: It is Non-toxic and has lure-and-capture mechanism. It is safe for children, elderly and pets. The bucket is made from recyclable and sustainable materials. Not like other repellents that uses plastic or aluminum that is harming the environment. It disrupts mosquito breeding cycles for long-term impact.
column30: Buzz Shield applies IoT and sensor technology to monitor usage and optimize effectiveness. Its design focuses on low energy consumption, sustainability, and safety. Prototypes use recyclable materials and are adaptable to different environments. By merging smart technology with eco-friendly practices, Buzz Shield bridges the gap between health innovation and climate resilience.

column7: Cross Categories - R & D Project of the Year (CC-RD)
column8: Technology - IOT of the Year (CT-IOT)
column25: Jatiya Kabi Kazi Nazrul Islam University (JKKNIU) is a public university focused on research and innovation. The Department of Computer Science and Engineering encourages students to develop practical solutions addressing community challenges. This project, SPISFM, is developed by a student research group under faculty supervision to promote sustainable farming, renewable energy use, and digital agriculture technologies.
column26:
Team Leader: Md Mehedi Hasan Naeem
Team Members:
Md Ashraful Islam,
Mst Kamrunnahar Ruma,
Moumita Barua,
Nafiza Anjum,
Shakila Sultana
column27:
The Solar-Powered IoT-Based Smart Farming Model (SPISFM) is a comprehensive smart farming solution designed to optimize water usage, reduce carbon emissions, and increase agricultural efficiency.

The system uses solar energy to power deep well irrigation pumps and field-level valves. IoT sensors monitor soil moisture, water levels, temperature, and humidity, automatically controlling water flow to different plots. Farmers can also manually control irrigation via a mobile application.

An AI-powered CCTV monitoring system detects crop diseases and sends instant notifications to farmers, enabling timely interventions. Surplus solar energy generated is exported to the national grid via net metering, providing an additional revenue stream and promoting clean energy use.

This integrated solution reduces dependence on fossil fuel-powered irrigation, improves crop health monitoring, and supports sustainable, carbon-free agriculture for rural communities.
column28:
Combines renewable energy, IoT automation, and AI-based crop monitoring in a single, integrated platform.

Dual-use solar panels: Power both irrigation systems and provide clean energy to the grid.

Farmer-friendly mobile app for real-time monitoring and manual control in local languages.

Low-cost, scalable design suitable for smallholder farmers and community-level implementation.

Net-zero emission farming model - eliminates irrigation-related CO₂ emissions.
column29:
Automated irrigation: Sensors control water flow to each plot based on soil moisture.

Mobile manual override: Farmers can turn pumps or valves on/off remotely using the app.

Central pump automation: Water flow is managed automatically depending on pipeline levels.

Surplus energy export: Extra solar power is sold back to the grid using net metering.

AI crop health detection: CCTV cameras identify plant diseases and send notifications.

Data analytics: Provides historical irrigation and energy data for optimization.

Offline fallback operation: Ensures system continues functioning during network outages.
column30:
Hardware Components:
ESP32 microcontrollers, soil moisture sensors, water level sensors, DHT11/22 sensors, solenoid/motorized valves, relays, contactors, monocrystalline solar panels, CCTV cameras.

Software Stack:
Django backend with REST APIs
Mobile app (React Native)
AI/ML models using PyTorch for crop disease detection
MQTT for IoT communication

Design Considerations:
Surge protection and opto-isolated relays for safe hardware operation
TLS for secure communications
Modular architecture for future scaling

column7: Cross Categories - R & D Project of the Year (CC-RD)
column8: Technology - Business Data Analytics of the Year (CT-BDA)
column14: IT Business Incubator, CUET Campus, Pahartoli, Raozan
column25: CUET Mongolchari is a newly grown tech-savvy team that aims to build innovation, technology, and solutions for different problems facing worldwide. With strong backing from the CUET administration, Mongolchari aims to elevate Bangladesh's ICT sector to the next level.
column26: A team consisting of 6 members from diverse backgrounds, such as Computer Science and Engineering, Electrical and Electronics Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, Civil Engineering and Mechatronics And Industrial Engineering are currently working on this application.
column27:
Solution Description: Space2Soil
Agricultural Education and Precision Farming Through Satellite Data Gaming
Problem Statement
Bangladesh faces critical agricultural challenges that threaten food security and economic stability:

Knowledge Gap: 16+ million farmers lack access to modern precision agriculture techniques and climate-smart farming practices
Climate Vulnerability: Agricultural productivity is declining by 2-3% annually due to climate change impacts (droughts, floods, unpredictable weather)
Data Literacy Deficit: Farmers cannot interpret or access satellite-based agricultural information despite the free availability of NASA data
Educational Barriers: Traditional agricultural extension services reach only 30% of farmers, with limited engagement and retention
Youth Disengagement: Rural youth abandoning agriculture due to the perception of it being outdated and non-technological

Critical Statistics:

70% of Bangladesh's population depends on agriculture
Only 12% of farmers use any form of digital agricultural tools
Climate change causes $1.2 billion annual agricultural losses
85% of agricultural students have never interacted with satellite data

Our Innovative Solution
NASA Farm Navigators is a revolutionary gamified educational platform that transforms complex NASA satellite data into accessible, actionable farming intelligence. Our solution bridges the critical gap between advanced space technology and grassroots agricultural education.
column28:
For Individual Farmers:

Immediate Insights: Real-time crop health assessment using NASA satellite data
Cost Reduction: Optimize irrigation, fertilizer, and pesticide usage
Risk Mitigation: Early warning systems for weather-related disasters
Yield Improvement: Data-driven farming decisions leading to 15-20% productivity gains

For Educational Institutions:

Modern Curriculum: Integration of space technology in agricultural education
Practical Learning: Hands-on experience with real satellite data interpretation
Student Engagement: Gamified approach increases learning retention by 60%
Research Capabilities: Access to processed NASA datasets for academic projects

For Bangladesh's Development:

Food Security: Enhanced agricultural productivity through precision farming
Climate Resilience: Better adaptation to climate change impacts
Digital Literacy: Widespread exposure to advanced data interpretation skills
Technology Transfer: Bringing NASA-level technology to the grassroots level
column29:
Gamified Learning Engine:

Sandbox Mode: Instant feedback farming simulation with NASA data
Interactive Tutorials: Learn satellite data interpretation through guided gameplay
Real-World Scenarios: Historical climate events recreated for learning experiences
Achievement System: Progress tracking for agricultural knowledge mastery
Collaborative Challenges: Community-based problem-solving using actual farming conditions

Key Components:

Satellite Data Aggregator: Real-time collection from 10+ NASA datasets.
Localization Engine: Adapts global satellite data to Bangladesh's specific crops, soil types, and climate patterns.
Educational Content Generator: Converts raw satellite data into understandable learning modules.
Gamification Framework: Achievement systems, progress tracking, and social features
Offline Capability: Critical for rural areas with limited internet connectivity.
column30:
Real-Time NASA Data Integration:

MODIS NDVI: Converts vegetation health satellite data into visual crop health indicators
SMAP Soil Moisture: Translates soil conditions into irrigation recommendations
GPM Precipitation: Integrates rainfall data for planting and harvesting decisions
EONET Disasters: Real-time natural event alerts for disaster preparedness
Landsat Imagery: High-resolution field mapping for precision agriculture

Technical Architecture
Data Processing Pipeline
NASA APIs → Local Processing → Bangladesh Context → Game Engine → User Interface.

AI-Powered Crop Recommendations: Machine learning analysis of satellite conditions.
Climate Prediction Modeling: Historical NASA data used for weather pattern education.
Multi-Language Support: Bengali and English interfaces for broader accessibility.
Progressive Learning: Complexity increases as users master basic satellite data concepts.
Community Features: Farmers can share strategies and compare results

column25: Individual innovator and student . Founder of Ojogor, the first Bangla syntax programming language (open-source, started 2025). Focus on accessibility in coding for Bengali speakers."
column26:
Team Lead: Ratul Hasan Ruhan – Founder & Core Developer
Planned Roles:

Developer Team (VS Code extension, Mobile IDE)

Community Contributors (open-source ecosystem)
column27:
Ojogor is the first Bengali programming language designed to break the language barrier in learning to code. Most programming languages use English-based syntax, which creates difficulty for beginners in Bangladesh and other Bengali-speaking regions. Many students, especially from rural areas, lose interest in programming because they cannot relate to the English keywords.

Ojogor solves this problem by introducing Bangla syntax for Python-like programming, allowing learners to write code in their mother tongue. With simple, intuitive commands such as “দেখাও” (print), “যদি” (if), and “যতক্ষণ” (while loop), programming becomes more natural and beginner-friendly.

The project includes an independent interpreter, ongoing development of a mobile IDE, and a VS Code extension (under testing). This ensures accessibility across devices and platforms.

By making programming available in Bengali, Ojogor lowers the entry barrier for students, helps educational institutions teach coding in the native language, and inspires a new generation of innovators.
column28:
Ojogor is unique because it is the first full-fledged programming language with Bangla syntax, not just a translation layer or tutorial in Bengali. Unlike traditional programming environments that only allow comments or variable names in Bangla, Ojogor introduces core keywords, control structures, and functions entirely in Bangla.

This makes programming intuitive for beginners, as they can directly relate coding concepts with their natural language. Ojogor also maintains simplicity through dynamic typing, no semicolons, and easy-to-read structure, ensuring quick adoption for new learners.

Additionally, Ojogor is built as an independent interpreter with extensions under development (mobile IDE and VS Code support), making it scalable for both educational and professional use. Its open-source nature ensures continuous innovation and community-driven growth — something not found in similar localized attempts.
column29:
Core Functionality:

Independent interpreter that executes Bangla syntax code.

Supports variable declaration, user input, output display, conditionals, loops, and functions in Bangla.

Dynamic typing for simplicity (no need to define variable types).


Key Features:

Bangla Syntax Keywords → e.g., “দেখাও” (print), “যদি” (if), “যতক্ষণ” (while loop).

Beginner-Friendly → clean syntax, no semicolons, simple structure.

Cross-Platform Potential → works on PC, mobile IDE under development, VS Code extension under testing.

Open Source → available on GitHub for contributions, transparency, and growth.

Educational Focus → designed to help students and beginners learn programming concepts in their mother tongue.
column30:
Ojogor applies technology in a simple yet powerful way to break the language barrier in programming. It is built with an independent interpreter, ensuring that Bangla syntax is not just symbolic but actually executable. The interpreter is lightweight, making it accessible on low-spec devices that are common among students in Bangladesh.

The project follows modern software practices:

Open-source development on GitHub, ensuring transparency and collaboration.

Extensibility through a planned mobile IDE and a VS Code extension (currently under testing).

Dynamic typing and clean syntax for faster execution and ease of learning.


By leveraging Python’s flexibility and mapping it with Bangla syntax, Ojogor bridges global technology with local accessibility. This ensures both technical reliability and practical usability for educational purposes.

column25:
MnM Studios — Company Profile
Overview

MnM Studios is a creative electronics and maker-studio dedicated to transforming imaginative ideas into tangible gadgets and learning tools. We specialize in the design, prototyping, and small-batch production of inventive hobby electronics projects, sharing our process and offering unique devices for makers, learners, and tech enthusiasts.

Mission

To inspire innovation through hands-on creativity — bridging the gap between concept and creation. We aim to empower others to learn electronics, coding, and hardware design by providing original, high-quality devices and educational insights.

Vision

To be a go-to hub for makers, hobbyists, and educators who want to explore technology with curiosity, craftsmanship, and community.

Core Focus & Offerings
Category	Description
Hobby Projects & Prototypes	MnM Studios develops novel electronics projects — from concept to working prototype — and documents them to share with the community.
Premium Gadgets & Products	Some of the studio’s creations are refined and offered for sale, such as the MnM Pomodoro Timer and the MnM Dino Game Keychain.
Custom Builds & Commissions	We accept custom project requests — collaborating with clients to deliver tailored electronics/embedded solutions.
Education & Sharing	Through our platforms, we share build stories, code, and design insights so that others can learn and replicate projects.
Flagship Products (Examples)

MnM Pomodoro Timer – A hand-assembled device built for productivity and focus, designed with precision hardware control.

MnM Dino Game Keychain – A miniaturized game gadget that combines fun and portability, ideal for casual play or novelty use.

Target Markets & Users

Makers & Hobbyists: Individuals who tinker with electronics, microcontrollers, and DIY hardware.

Students & Educators: Learners or teachers looking for tangible projects for classes or workshops.

Enthusiasts & Collectors: People interested in unique, hand-crafted gadgets.

Custom & Small-scale Clients: Businesses or individuals seeking bespoke small electronics solutions.

Brand Values & Strengths

Craftsmanship & Quality: Attention to detail in design, hardware layout, casing, and assembly.

Transparency & Learning: Sharing the journey — from schematics to code — to foster a community of learning.

Innovation & Originality: Projects are conceptual and distinctive rather than off-the-shelf clones.

Community & Collaboration: Open to feedback, custom requests, and collaborations with like-minded makers.
column26: We are currently a two member team building and innovating makers and luxury products. I, Mahir Daiyan Safwaan is the CEO and CTO of the team and my Co Founder Samiya Mehedi Kazi is the CFO and head of organization.
column27:
The Big Problem: Imagine trying to study, but your phone keeps buzzing with TikTok videos or WhatsApp messages! That's what happens to many Bangladeshi kids trying to learn a new language. Regular apps get lost in all the distractions, making it really hard to focus and learn properly.

Our Smart Solution (Meet Luna!): We've created Luna, a special little learning friend just for your child. Think of Luna not as another app on a phone, but as a dedicated, friendly robot that only focuses on teaching English. Luna talks to your child, gives fun voice challenges, and instantly tells them if they're saying words correctly or using grammar right. Because it's a separate device, there are no distractions – just pure learning! This makes learning a new language fun and easy, helping Bangladeshi students build strong language habits.

What Makes Luna Special? (Hardware Uniqueness!): Luna isn't just a program; it's a cute, friendly physical bot that sits on your child's desk. This is super unique, especially for Bangladesh, because it:

Stops Distractions: No more getting sidetracked by games or social media. Luna's only job is to teach.

Builds Habits: Having a physical bot makes it easier for kids to remember to practice daily, turning learning into a fun routine.

Feels Personal: It's like having a dedicated tutor, making learning feel more engaging and less like a chore. This tangible, interactive approach is designed specifically to help Bangladeshi K-12 students truly master a new language.
column28: What makes **Luna** truly special is its **hardware**: it's a dedicated, friendly physical bot, not just another distracting app that gets buried on a phone. This unique, tangible design is crucial for Bangladeshi students because it completely blocks social media and games, creating a focused, distraction-free study zone. Its physical presence helps children build strong, daily learning habits, making Luna the most reliable and effective companion for the K-12 market here.
column29:
Luna's Core Functionality: Learning Made Fun & Effective

Personalized AI Challenges: The bot greets the K-12 student by name and immediately launches into an interactive vocabulary challenge, requiring a voice response.

Grammar & Pronunciation Practice: Luna adapts to the child's needs by offering follow-up exercises that target specific grammar points and providing repeated pronunciation practice.

Instant Feedback & Context: It delivers immediate, constructive feedback on both pronunciation and vocabulary usage, along with clear usage examples to solidify understanding.

Progress Tracking & Motivation: Luna keeps a record of learning streaks and celebrates achievements, successfully fostering a positive learning habit and encouraging continuous engagement.
column30:
Core AI Engine: Luna’s intelligence is powered by a combination of sophisticated AI models:

1. Advanced Speech Recognition (ASR):

Application: This is the foundation of Luna's voice-based interaction. It instantly converts the child's spoken language into text for analysis.

Quality & Uniqueness: Unlike generic speech recognition, Luna’s ASR is trained on diverse accent and speech patterns, ensuring highly accurate real-time feedback for Bangladeshi learners. This focus on non-native English speakers is key to its effectiveness.

2. Natural Language Processing (NLP):

Application: NLP is the "brain" that provides grammar and vocabulary correction. It analyzes the student's response to assess fluency, intonation, and usage, going beyond just correcting single words.

Quality & Uniqueness: This enables contextual feedback—explaining why an expression is awkward or suggesting a better phrase, just like a real tutor.

3. Adaptive Learning Algorithms:

Application: This ensures genuine personalization. The system tracks the student's performance data, engagement patterns, and comprehension levels.

Quality & Uniqueness: Luna uses this data to adjust the difficulty, recommend content that targets the student's specific weaknesses, and automatically generates the next personalized challenge. This moves beyond "one-size-fits-all" learning to create a tailored journey for every K-12 learner.

Overall Quality Assurance:

By integrating these technologies into a dedicated hardware device, we ensure the audio input quality is higher (less background noise interference) than a typical mobile app, leading to superior AI accuracy and a more reliable learning experience.

column27:
Shebar Janala (সেবার জানালা), translated as “The Window of Services,” is a digital transparency platform designed to reimagine how social safety nets reach vulnerable citizens in Bangladesh. Every year, billions of taka are allocated to allowances such as widow support, disability stipends, and old-age pensions. Yet leakages, ghost beneficiaries, and exclusion errors undermine the system. According to HIES-based studies, nearly 71% of poor and vulnerable households remain excluded, while 46.5% of beneficiaries are ineligible. This dual crisis of under-coverage and mistargeting highlights the urgent need for a trust-driven, citizen-centric system.

Our innovation combines citizen voice with institutional accountability. Citizens can log complaints, share issues, and endorse community needs through mobile apps, SMS, or USSD — ensuring accessibility for low-tech users. Verified beneficiaries receive a “Digital Transparency Passport”, linked with NID verification, which logs entitlements and disbursements on an immutable blockchain ledger. This creates a tamper-proof trail visible to citizens, officials, and donors. An integrated AI engine automatically flags anomalies — ghost IDs, duplicate claims, diversion of goods — and routes complaints to the appropriate ward, union, or upazila offices.

By merging civic participation with advanced technology, Shebar Janala empowers citizens to see, know, and act. It transforms opacity into transparency, making corruption visible and accountability unavoidable. As a prototype developed and tested through civic-tech competitions like the UNDP Civic Tech Challenge, the system is already aligned with national ambitions for Smart Bangladesh 2041. Its modular design ensures scalability across 4,571 Union Parishads and 40M+ beneficiaries, while also adapting to disaster relief, subsidies, and climate resilience schemes.

Ultimately, Shebar Janala closes the gap between citizens and state, building trust through transparent processes and equitable service delivery.
column28:
The uniqueness of Shebar Janala lies in its fusion of grassroots citizen empowerment with cutting-edge digital tools. While Bangladesh has pioneered G2P digital payments, most existing systems are transactional rather than participatory. They digitize money flow but leave citizens without voice or visibility. Our approach bridges this gap by integrating bottom-up problem reporting with top-down transparency dashboards.

1. Citizen Voice at Scale – Unlike most safety-net systems that operate unilaterally, Shebar Janala allows citizens to report problems, attach geotagged photos, and endorse neighbors’ issues. This participatory design turns citizens into real-time auditors.


2. Blockchain Transparency – While blockchain has been piloted in financial inclusion, its application in social protection ledgering is new. Every allowance payment, relief package, or rice disbursement is logged immutably, preventing tampering by local intermediaries.


3. AI Routing & Fraud Detection – The platform uses AI for natural language processing (Bangla) and anomaly detection. Complaints are automatically tagged (e.g., infrastructure vs. welfare distribution), reducing administrative bottlenecks. Fraud signals such as duplicate NIDs or unusual distributions are flagged proactively.


4. Inclusion via USSD/SMS – Recognizing the 41% urban vs. 26% rural smartphone penetration, Shebar Janala ensures access through low-tech channels. This inclusivity is a differentiator that makes it viable for both urban poor and rural communities.


5. Multi-stakeholder Dashboards – Separate dashboards for Union Parishads, Upazila officials, and donors ensure layered accountability. Local leaders see KPIs, donors track fund utilization, and citizens verify entitlements.



In short, Shebar Janala is not just a digital payment tracker — it is a holistic ecosystem where transparency, citizen engagement, and institutional oversight converge.
column29:
Shebar Janala’s features are designed to be simple for citizens yet powerful for administrators:

Citizen Portal (Amar Sheba) – Citizens report problems using text, voice, or photos. Issues are geo-tagged and verified through NID. Neighbors can “endorse” issues, creating community prioritization.

Beneficiary Passport (Protiva) – Every eligible citizen receives a digital ID that tracks entitlements and payments. Accessible via app, SMS, or USSD, this passport ensures transparency at the individual level.

Leader Dashboard – Union/Upazila officials track disbursement rates, unresolved complaints, and fraud alerts. Tools allow merging duplicate complaints and generating ward-wise heatmaps.

Donor Dashboard – NGOs and multilateral agencies track impact, monitor anomalies, and verify that funds reach intended recipients.

AI Engine – Automates classification of complaints (e.g., social security, relief, infrastructure), filters spam/abuse, and flags fraud.

Blockchain Ledger – Anchors every transaction, creating a shared source of truth across government and citizens.

USSD/SMS Access – Ensures that even without smartphones, citizens can check eligibility or log complaints.


Together, these modules deliver a full transparency cycle: reporting → verification → logging → oversight → resolution.
column30:
At its core, Shebar Janala is a civic-tech innovation powered by AI, blockchain, and mobile accessibility.

Artificial Intelligence:

Natural Language Processing (NLP) for Bangla enables citizens to report issues in plain text or voice.

Computer Vision validates photo evidence (e.g., diverted rice sacks).

Anomaly Detection identifies ghost beneficiaries, duplicate payments, or suspicious clusters.

AI Telephony enables interactive voice response (IVR) in Bangla, ensuring accessibility for low-literacy users.


Blockchain:

A permissioned blockchain (Hyperledger/Ethereum hybrid) ensures tamper-proof disbursement logs.

Every allowance or relief payment is immutably recorded, visible to both government and citizens.

Enhances trust by preventing retroactive manipulation.


Geospatial Tech:

H3 geospatial indexing + PostGIS enables ward-wise dashboards and anomaly mapping.

Ensures precise targeting during disasters or localized fraud events.


Accessibility Features:

USSD/SMS fallback ensures participation from feature-phone users.

Bangla-first UI/UX lowers barriers for elderly and rural citizens.



The unique integration of these technologies ensures Shebar Janala is not just a digital system, but a resilient accountability infrastructure.

column27: AKI is a no-code AutoML system that enables users to build predictive models from spreadsheets within minutes. It provides step-by-step workflows that guide users through data upload, preprocessing, Data analysis, ML model training, and deployment. By delivering a complete end-to-end machine learning pipeline without the need for programming expertise, AKI removes the traditional barriers of complexity. This makes AI adoption simple, accessible and cost-effective for educators, SMEs and government organizations alike.
column28:
•	First homegrown no-code AutoML platform developed in Bangladesh for local and global use.
•	Eliminates 95% of technical barriers, making ML accessible to non-programmers.
•	Integrates Explainable AI (XAI) for model clarity and decision transparency.
•	Supports diverse data types and spreadsheets.
•	Shortens project timeframes from a month to under an hour and reduces costs by 65%.
column29:
•	Preprocessing tools: Data cleaning, missing value handling, encoding, normalization, outlier correction and feature engineering.
•	Visualization suite: Scatter plots, heatmaps, pie charts, histograms, box/violin plots for data insights.
•	Modeling engine: One-click training across multiple ML algorithms with tunable parameters.
•	Performance dashboard: Accuracy, recall, precision, F1-score, confusion matrix and cross-model comparisons.
•	Deployment support: Cloud integration with versioning, monitoring and instant model rollout.
column30:
•	Employs cutting-edge ML techniques such as Random Forest, SVM, Neural Networks and Gradient Boosting.
•	Built on a cloud-ready infrastructure ensuring scalability and smooth performance.
•	Incorporates modern preprocessing methods like SMOTE, feature engineering and normalization.
•	Designed with a user-friendly interface for accessibility by both technical and non-technical users.
•	Strengthens trust with Explainable AI, ensuring models are transparent and reliable.

column25:
Company Profile – MediGuide AI

MediGuide AI is an early-stage health technology initiative founded by Md Naimul Hossain, an undergraduate student passionate about applying artificial intelligence to solve real-world healthcare challenges. Although currently at the prototype stage, MediGuide AI is being developed with the vision of becoming a health-tech startup that bridges the gap between patients and accessible healthcare services in Bangladesh.

The project focuses on:

AI-driven health guidance for early diagnosis and safe self-care.

Prescription reading technology to help patients understand doctors’ handwritten prescriptions.

Voice and image recognition (planned) to improve inclusivity and accuracy.

Integration with local pharmacies and clinics to connect patients with trusted providers.

Mission: To make reliable healthcare guidance accessible, affordable, and inclusive for every Bangladeshi, especially in rural and underserved communities.

MediGuide AI aims to scale as a formal startup in the near future, contributing to both Bangladesh’s digital health ecosystem and global healthcare innovation.
column26:
Team Information – MediGuide AI

Team Size: 1 (Solo Founder)

Team Member:
Md. Naimul Hossain – Founder & Project Lead

1st year Undergraduate student, B.Sc. in Mathematics at Tejgaon College (National University).

Founder of MediGuide AI, responsible for ideation, design, prototyping, and development.

Former Vice President of Organizing, Khilgaon Government College Science Club – hosted 2 intra-fests.

Achievements:

1st Runner-up – Bangladesh Council of Science and Industrial Research Science & Technology Fair 2023.

Extraordinary Excellent Award – Khilgaon Government High School Science Club Intra Science Carnival 2023.

Passionate about AI, healthcare innovation, and entrepreneurship, aiming to build inclusive, AI-driven healthcare solutions for Bangladesh and beyond.
column27:
Solution Description – MediGuide AI

Problem
In Bangladesh, millions of people, especially in rural and underserved areas, lack immediate access to qualified doctors. As a result, patients often rely on unverified advice, self-medication, or struggle to read handwritten prescriptions. These challenges delay proper treatment and can even worsen health outcomes. There is a critical need for an accessible, affordable, and intelligent platform that bridges this gap.

Solution
MediGuide AI is an AI-powered health assistant designed to provide first-line medical guidance to patients anytime, anywhere. By asking structured questions, similar to how doctors gather patient history, it suggests possible conditions, offers safe home treatment guidance, and recommends when professional consultation is necessary.

The prototype is currently available as a web app built on Bubble.io, ensuring early testing and accessibility. MediGuide AI is designed to support both Bangla and English users, making it inclusive for diverse communities.

Technology & Innovation
MediGuide AI combines multiple technologies into one platform:

AI Symptom Checker – Conversational AI to analyze patient symptoms.

Prescription Reader (OCR) – Reads handwritten prescriptions and extracts medicine names for patients who cannot interpret doctors’ handwriting.

Planned Features: Voice recognition for verbal symptom input and image recognition to identify visible health conditions.

Ecosystem Integration: Partnerships with nearby clinics and online pharmacies for referrals and medicine access.

This integration of AI, OCR, and multilingual design makes MediGuide AI one of the first locally developed, inclusive health-tech solutions in Bangladesh.

Impact
MediGuide AI empowers communities by:

Reducing dependency on unsafe self-medication.

Giving rural populations immediate access to basic healthcare guidance.

Saving time and money by directing patients to the right care.

Increasing health literacy through understandable medical information.

Sustainability & Roadmap
The platform will sustain itself through partnerships with pharmacies and clinics, affiliate commissions on medicine purchases, and a freemium model that offers free basic guidance with advanced premium features.

Short term: Integrate AI models for symptom checking.

Midterm: Add voice and image recognition.

Long term: Scale regionally and integrate with wearable health devices.

Conclusion
MediGuide AI is not just a tool; it is a vision to make healthcare accessible, intelligent, and inclusive. By addressing real challenges with locally relevant innovation, it has the potential to transform how people in Bangladesh and beyond access medical guidance.
column28:
Uniqueness – MediGuide AI

MediGuide AI is unique because it is built specifically for the Bangladeshi context, combining advanced AI with local healthcare challenges. Unlike generic global health apps, MediGuide AI is multilingual (Bangla & English) and designed for patients who may have low digital literacy.

Key differentiators include:

Prescription Reader: One of the first AI-based tools in Bangladesh to decode doctors’ handwritten prescriptions, solving a practical problem faced by millions.

Integrated AI Guidance: Goes beyond static symptom checkers by using conversational AI to mimic a doctor’s questioning process.

Voice & Image Recognition (planned): Enables healthcare guidance to be accessible to individuals who struggle with typing or require visual diagnosis support.

Community Inclusion: Built with affordability in mind, offering free basic services and low-cost advanced features, making it inclusive for rural and underserved populations.

Local Healthcare Ecosystem: Designed to integrate with nearby clinics and online pharmacies, connecting patients with trusted local providers instead of just giving generic advice.

By combining AI-powered health guidance, prescription reading, voice/image recognition, and localized services in one platform, MediGuide AI offers a solution that is not only innovative but also deeply relevant to Bangladesh’s healthcare reality.
column29:
Functionality & Features – MediGuide AI

Symptom Checker: Asks patients structured questions (like a doctor would) and suggests possible conditions.

Health Guidance: Provides safe home treatment advice and recommends when to consult a doctor.

Basic Medicine Suggestions: Offers general information on over-the-counter medicines (non-prescription) for common issues.

Prescription Reader (Planned): Uses AI + OCR technology to read doctors’ handwritten prescriptions and extract medicine names, making them understandable for patients.

Multilingual Support: Designed for both Bangla and English users to ensure inclusivity.

Prototype Web App: Currently available on Bubble.io with a user-friendly interface.

Planned Features:

AI Integration (ChatGPT or similar) for more accurate symptom analysis.

Voice Recognition to allow patients to describe symptoms verbally.

Image Recognition for analyzing visible symptoms (e.g., skin rashes, eye conditions).

Nearby Clinic & Pharmacy Suggestions through partnerships.

Freemium Model – free guidance with premium AI-driven features.
column30:
Quality / Application of Technology – MediGuide AI

MediGuide AI applies modern artificial intelligence and no-code development to create an accessible, scalable health platform. The current prototype is built with Bubble.io, allowing rapid development and user testing without heavy coding. Planned integration of advanced AI models (NLP and LLMs) will enable accurate symptom analysis through conversational interaction, mimicking the way doctors collect patient history.

The solution also leverages OCR (Optical Character Recognition) and computer vision for two future features:

Prescription Reader: Extracts medicine names from handwritten prescriptions, solving a common real-world challenge where patients cannot read doctors’ handwriting.

Image Recognition: Identifies visible health issues (e.g., rashes, eye infections) from user-uploaded photos.

Voice recognition will further enhance usability for patients with low literacy or disabilities, making the platform more inclusive.

To ensure trust, MediGuide AI will follow strict data privacy and security standards. User health data will be encrypted, anonymized where possible, and never shared without consent. Future development will aim to align with HIPAA/GDPR-style compliance, ensuring that sensitive health information remains protected.

The design emphasizes cloud scalability, multilingual support (Bangla & English), and API integration with pharmacies and clinics. This ensures that MediGuide AI is not just a static tool, but a growing ecosystem that applies technology responsibly to healthcare challenges.
