column25:
Hard work and talent are the forces that can lead people to success, and so is a hardworking, talented young entrepreneur and innovator named Md. Abul Mia. Young entrepreneur and innovator Md. Abul Mia, owner of M/s. Abul Industries, Silam Char Mohammadpur village, Dhin Surma upazila, Sylhet district, has received the President’s Industrial Development Award 2016 for developing modern agricultural machinery with minimal capital by utilizing his innovative power, talent, and tireless work. The government said that this award is to recognize the contribution of the industrial sector to the national economy, create incentives, and encourage creativity. The certificate of recognition and award for this meritorious contribution under the supervision of the Ministry of Industries of the Government of the People’s Republic of Bangladesh was presented by His Excellency President Md. Abdul Hamid at the Osmani Memorial Auditorium on 22/05/2018. Inspired by this recognition and honor, M/s. Abul Industries will make more contributions to the economy of Bangladesh in the future. Will prosper further.

How was the reality of success? Thoughts:

Bangladesh is an agricultural country. In order to achieve a sustainable economy through agriculture-based industries, the means of mechanizing farms, developing modern agricultural technology, and motivating farmers in mechanical farming, the name of a young man who is always busy inventing and producing agricultural machinery is Abul Mia. He is the son of the late Md. Matsir Ali of Char Muhammadpur village of Silam union of South Surma upazila. After completing his education, he started working as a mechanic in an engineering workshop in the city in 1987. From there, he got the addiction to discovery, and as a successful, self-reliant young man, he devoted himself to discovery. Even though he went abroad during his career, he did not give up the addiction to discovery. He used to go to the mechanical workshop in between the scheduled work in his home. He used to devote himself to mechanical work. He used to accumulate various activities of foreign mechanical workshops. In order to utilize his experience and foreign technical education, he set up an institution named Messrs. Abul Engineering Works in 1999 on Bangbir Road, South Surma, and in 2004 he set up another institution named Messrs. Abul Industries in Char Mohammadpur, Po Biraimpur, Upazila-South Surma, District-Sylhet. From those two institutions, he is engaged in researching and manufacturing alternative modern agricultural machinery to import using domestic raw materials for farm mechanization using domestic technology. He appointed several dedicated young men in his institution. Md. Abul Mia worked single-mindedly. So far, he has processed agricultural products suitable for mechanical cultivation in agriculture. He has been able to invent and produce various machinery and equipment in the field, and the agricultural machinery he invented and produced has been marketed locally and has won praise. The machinery he invented and produced for agricultural work and the processing industry are the Abul Power Tiller, Abul Paddy Threshing Mill, Abul Food Processing Mixer Machine, Abul Blinder Machine, Abul Sugar Threshing Mill, and Abul Spice Processing Machine. This machinery has been exhibited at various times in the District Agricultural Machinery Fair, and Md. Abul Mia has been successful in motivating the farmers’ processing industry institutions. The institution has been visited by many high-ranking government and private officials at various times. They have given special praise to the agricultural machinery he invented, and reports of his innovative machinery have been published in national daily newspapers.

Utilizing his innovative power during his lifetime, Md. Abul Mia started his journey in 1999 with a capital of just 300 taka. He has been working successfully by inventing the latest technology in mechanized farming, researching the country’s environment and people-friendly machinery and processing machinery for the production of agricultural products, and creating employment for several people in his institution and establishing agro-based industries. He is making a special contribution to poverty alleviation and socio-economic development. Now, only if he gets government support will he be able to invent more new technologies and bring about an agricultural revolution.

As a result of his success, the People’s Democratic Government of Bangladesh awarded him the 1417 Bangla ‘Bangabandhu’ National Agricultural Award in recognition of his contribution to agricultural research in the effort to build a prosperous Bangladesh. The award was presented by the Honorable Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina on 29/04/2012 in English. Abul Mia was awarded the National Medal and National Recognition Certificate, and on 19/12/2015, Hotel Pan Pacific Sonargaon was awarded the Entrepreneur of the Year by Banik Barta and BIDS as a visionary entrepreneur for his pioneering efforts in mechanized farming and agricultural machinery production. The award was presented by Mr. Mashiur Rahman, Financial Advisor to the Prime Minister. Abul Mia received the award from him.

column27: DAZBoard is a screen-free, affordable learning toy for ages 2 to 5 that builds early literacy through multisensory play. Children place colorful magnetic letters into shaped slots; each correct placement triggers instant audio like letter name, phonics sound, and an example word - reinforcing sound-symbol mapping and vocabulary. Learn, Quiz, and Spelling modes ramp difficulty to build confidence while keeping play child-led. Designed for homes and low-resource classrooms or daycare centers, DAZBoard is durable, low-cost, and works fully offline. Children progress naturally from recognizing alphabet shapes to pronunciation, word formation, and simple spelling -gaining independence with minimal supervision.
column28: Unlike apps, flashcards, or generic plastic blocks, DAZBoard pairs hands-on motor play with immediate audio feedback, no screens, subscriptions, or internet. Self-aligning magnetic slots prevent misplacement and frustration, sustaining engagement. Built from low-cost, rugged components, it suits Bangladeshi homes, day cares, and kindergartens where devices and power can be unreliable. The design is modular: swappable faceplates and audio packs let the same base unit support English today and Bangla, Arabic, and early math next, so families upgrade content, not hardware.
column29:
●	Magnetic letters (BPA-free) with shaped slots for a self-correcting fit
●	Instant audio feedback: letter name, phonics sound, example word, cheerful praise, and “try again” prompts
●	Modes: Learning, Quiz, and Spelling
●	Modular design: English alphabet board ready; swappable faceplates for Bangla, Arabic, Sanskrit, and numeric are under development, grows with the child from pre- kindergarten skills without screens
●	Child-friendly build: BPA-free plastics, rounded edges, tamper-resistant fasteners, status LEDs/icons, and physical volume/mode toggles
●	Power & connectivity: Battery or USB power; fully offline (no pairing, no apps)
●	Classroom-ready: Durable, wipe-clean enclosure; affordable and simple to use; safe for group settings
column30:
●	Electronics: Arduino-class MCU (e.g., Mega-2560 family) scans a reed-switch matrix beneath each slot for reliable letter detection; hardware pull-ups and firmware debouncing eliminate false triggers
●	Audio pipeline: DFPlayer-style module with microSD delivers low-latency playback of studio-recorded phonemes and words for clear articulation in noisy rooms; onboard amplifier and front-firing speaker for intelligibility
●	Firmware architecture: slot-to-track mapping is data-driven; updating languages or curricula is as simple as swapping the SD card, no reflash needed
●	Modularity: shared base unit with swappable faceplates (English, Bangla, Arabic, Math, etc.) and bilingual audio packs, minimizing total cost of ownership
●	Power & safety: low power draw supports AA/USB power banks; volume-limited prompts and LED indicators for user feedback; enclosure designed toward CPSIA/EN71 compliance expectations
●	Serviceability & durability: screw-assembled, glue-free chassis for field repairs; wipe-clean, impact-resistant plastics; magnets and sensors are isolated from children’s reach
●	Reliability: DAZBoard uses clear, rule-based file names so the right audio always plays, checks key files on the SD card at start-up to catch corruption, and has a watchdog that auto-restarts if the system ever freezes, always booting with safe settings. It works fully offline (no apps or Wi-Fi), so power cuts, network drops, or account issues will not stop it. Even if a file is missing or mislabeled, the device warns and falls back gracefully, keeping behavior predictable in homes, day cares, and classrooms.

column27: RoboRPS is a hands-on teaching robot for computer vision, embedded ML, and robotics. A camera reads your hand while on-device models classify gestures; a servo “hand” responds in real time. Rock-Paper-Scissors is just one mode; students can also mirror their hand live or type text that the robot spells as poses. A 7″ touch display shows latency, FPS, confidence, and errors, so learners see the full loop: capture then preprocess then infer then actuate then evaluate. Everything runs offline (via USB-C power), is classroom-safe, and is plug-and-play. For learning, a one-tap Dataset Capture mode records frames with labels to CSV and images for homework and retraining, and a built-in Model Zoo ships accurate, fast, quantized, and low-light variants for trade-off comparisons. It is both a fun demo and a reusable lab platform for HRI, TinyML, and control.
column28: Most kits stop at code or screens. This device unites vision and ML and motion with no apps, no Wi-Fi, and live metrics. Swap models, datasets, or motion profiles without rewiring; compare quantized vs. full and low-light variants via the Model Zoo. Dataset Capture turns it into a data lab, not just a toy. Modes span game, gesture mirroring, and text-to-pose, so one rig covers many lessons. A separated vision/actuation stack keeps upgrades cheap and bottlenecks teachable - built to survive repeated demos and lab classes.
column29:
●	Modes: RPS, Gesture Mirror, Text to Gesture, custom gesture models
●	Dataset Capture mode: One-tap frames and labels to CSV and images
●	Model Zoo: Accurate, fast, quantized, and low-light variants
●	On-device inference; offline, no pairing or accounts required
●	7″ touch HUD: FPS, latency, confidence, misclassifications; simple game UI
●	Difficulty: Fair or random, adaptive, predictive counter play
●	Calibration: Camera exposure or flip; servo home and soft limits
●	USB-C power; Desk-safe footprint; quick reset and watchdog
●	Audio and LED feedback; speaker and mic for voice-model experiments
●	API ports for extra sensors and classroom scripting
column30: A Raspberry Pi 4 runs a quantized TinyML gesture model; a PCA9685 drives a metal-gear servo with eased motion profiles for smooth, repeatable poses. Frame debouncing and exposure control reduce false reads; the pipeline stamps frames for latency profiling. On boot, self-tests verify camera, servo range, and asset integrity (structured filenames and quick checksums). Any failure triggers a safe demo and practice with on-screen guidance. A lean serial SDK swaps models, streams metrics, and scripts experiments; logs export to CSV for confusion matrices and accuracy-vs-latency labs. Brownout protection, current and temperature limits, and a watchdog keep sessions stable.

column25: RoboLife Technologies is an innovative robotics research organization that has been improving the quality of life for amputees since 2018 by developing and fitting artificial robotic hands. To date, the company has provided robotic hands to over 100 individuals. Notably, during the 2024 student movement, RoboLife gained international recognition by providing prosthetic hands to five individuals who lost their hands. Its research products have been exported as demo units to countries including India, Malaysia, Turkey, and Saudi Arabia. Initially started with support from the Government of Bangladesh, the company is now the Bangladesh Champion of Startup World Cup 2025, invited to the grand finale in the USA. This work has been featured on international media such as Voice of America and France 24.

column27: RoboLife Technologies’ EMG-controlled robotic hand is an advanced prosthetic device that detects muscle signals from the user and enables precise, natural hand movements. It assists amputees in performing daily tasks such as grasping, holding, writing, and transferring objects. The hands are cost-effective, user-friendly, and adaptable for people of different ages and abilities. Additionally, the device can be customized with different features and functionalities according to the user’s needs. This innovation not only restores physical capability but also boosts confidence and social inclusion for its users.
column28:
1. User-Specific EMG Control: Detects muscle signals to enable natural, precise hand movements.
2. Affordable & User-Friendly: Cost-effective design that is accessible for most underserved individuals.
3. Customizable: Functionalities and features can be adapted to meet individual user needs.
4. Daily Life Utility: Supports essential daily activities like grasping, writing, and object manipulation.
5. Social Impact: Enhances confidence, independence, and social inclusion alongside physical rehabilitation.
6. International Recognition: The first low-cost EMG prosthetic hand from Bangladesh, featured in global media.
column29:
1. EMG Muscle Signal Detection: Detects user’s muscle signals for natural hand movement.
2. Grasping & Holding: Capable of holding objects of various sizes and shapes.
3. Precision Control: Supports fine motor tasks such as writing or manipulating small objects.
4. Customizable Grip Patterns: Multiple grip modes selectable according to user needs.
5. Lightweight & Comfortable: Designed for ease of wear and user comfort.
6. Adjustable Strength & Speed: Strength and movement speed can be tailored to the user.
7. Durable & Low Maintenance: Long-lasting design with minimal upkeep.
8. Portable & Rechargeable: Easy to carry with a rechargeable battery.
column30: RoboLife Technologies’ robotic hands are made with good-quality sensors and lightweight, durable materials. They detect muscle signals to move naturally like a real hand. The hands are easy to use, safe, and helpful for daily activities like writing, holding objects, and social tasks. So far, they have been successfully used by over 100 people, and some products have been exported internationally as demo units.

column25:
SoftBD is a Global leading ICT Consultancy and Software/Hardware solution provider in Bangladesh. Established in 2006, the company has been promoted by highly experienced professionals dedicated to providing complete collaborative solutions under one roof. Renowned for managing systems that serve millions of users daily, SoftBD has successfully delivered hundreds of projects for government bodies, development partners, and multinational agencies.

The company's commitment to excellence is demonstrated through international certifications including ISO 9001:2015 for quality management and ISO/IEC 27001:2022 for information security. Specializing in Fourth Industrial Revolution technologies such as Blockchain, AI, ML, BI, and Big Data, SoftBD offers comprehensive services spanning e-Governance, enterprise solutions, and cutting-edge innovations. This combination of technical expertise, certified processes, and award-winning performance establishes SoftBD as a trusted partner for transformative digital solutions across diverse sectors including government, telecommunications, finance, and healthcare.
column26:
SoftBD Ltd. is powered by a robust and multifaceted team of over 180 professionals, strategically structured to deliver comprehensive ICT solutions. The technical backbone of the company consists of a 50-member Software Development Team and a 10-member App Development Team, supported by specialized units including a 12-person Server, DBA, Architecture, and Security Team and a 9-person Quality Assurance Team to ensure robust and secure deliverables.

Innovation is driven by a 16-strong team of Emerging Technology Experts specializing in AI, NLP, Big Data, ML, and Blockchain. Project execution is managed by a 10-member Project Management Team, while a 14-person Documentation Team ensures meticulous record-keeping. Creative needs are handled by a 6-person Design Team focused on UI/UX and graphics.

Leadership is provided by 3 Top-Level Executives (CEO, COO, CTO), guided by 5 Consultants and supported by 4 Senior Managers. Business growth is managed by a 10-person Business Development Team, and a 30-member Support Team offers ongoing maintenance. Additionally, a 5-person Admin Team ensures smooth operational support, making SoftBD a well-rounded organization capable of handling diverse and complex technological challenges.
column27:
The Digital Land Records Management System (DLRMS), developed for the Ministry of Land, Bangladesh, is a state-of-the-art, AI-driven platform that has revolutionized the country's land administration. Accessible via eporcha.gov.bd, the system serves as a centralized, intelligent service hub for managing land records (Khatians) and Mouja maps.

Key features include comprehensive Khatian lifecycle management, a correction workflow across 520 access points, and integration with GIS for spatial visualization. An AI-powered chatbot provides citizen assistance, while sentiment analysis tools monitor user feedback. The platform ensures seamless interoperability with other government systems through a Land Service Gateway and offers multiple payment gateways for fee collection.

Built with a modern tech stack including NextJS, NodeJS, and Oracle, DLRMS is a secure, scalable solution available on web and mobile platforms. SoftBD Ltd. was responsible for the end-to-end design, development, data migration, and deployment, and provides ongoing maintenance and support, ensuring a transparent, efficient, and citizen-friendly land record management system for millions of users.
column28:
The uniqueness of the Digital Land Records Management System (DLRMS) stems from its transformative, AI-integrated architecture that moves beyond simple digitization. Its foremost distinction is the AI-powered service layer, featuring an intelligent chatbot and sentiment analysis engine that proactively guides citizens and monitors feedback to continuously improve service delivery—a rare capability in public sector projects.

A key differentiator is its role as a centralized integration hub. Unlike isolated systems, the DLRMS seamlessly interoperates with diverse government databases and financial gateways through its dedicated Land Service Gateway (LSG), creating a unified ecosystem that breaks down traditional information silos.

Furthermore, the solution offers comprehensive lifecycle management of land records. It uniquely maintains a historical chain for each plot, integrates spatial data with GIS-enabled Mouja maps, and administers a standardized correction workflow across 520 national access points. This end-to-end automation, combined with multi-platform accessibility, establishes a new benchmark for transparency, efficiency, and citizen-centric service in e-governance, setting it apart from conventional record-keeping systems.
column29:
The Digital Land Records Management System (DLRMS) delivers comprehensive functionality through a suite of advanced features designed for efficiency, transparency, and user-friendliness.

Core functionalities include end-to-end Khatian Management, enabling the creation, editing, and historical tracking of land records. The system provides a structured Workflow Management for correction requests, processed via a BPM system across 520 national access points. Its GIS Integration allows for the storage and linking of Khatians with Mouja Maps, enabling spatial visualization and plot-based searches.

Key features that enhance the user experience are the AI-Driven Service Assistance, including a chatbot for guided navigation and a sentiment analysis tool to monitor citizen feedback. An Intelligent Dashboard offers role-based, data-driven insights through interactive visualizations. For seamless operation, the system includes Multi-Channel Access (web, mobile, kiosk), Payment Gateway Integration for various transaction methods, and robust API Management for secure interoperability with other government systems like e-Mutation and the NID database. Security and compliance are ensured through Single Sign-On (SSO) and detailed audit trails.

This combination of robust core functions and innovative features creates a powerful, all-in-one platform for modern land administration.
column30:
The Digital Land Records Management System (DLRMS) demonstrates exceptional quality and sophisticated application of modern technology, ensuring robustness, security, and scalability. The solution is built on a carefully selected, cutting-edge tech stack including Next.js and React for a responsive front-end, Node.js for server-side operations, and Oracle Database for secure, high-performance data management. This ensures optimal performance and reliability under high user loads.

Quality is enforced through adherence to international standards, including ISO/IEC 27001:2022 for information security. The system's architecture employs an Enterprise Service Bus and API Manager (WSO2) to guarantee seamless, secure, and well-governed integration with external systems like payment gateways, NID verification, and other land services, ensuring data consistency and integrity.

The application of Artificial Intelligence is a standout feature, powering an intelligent chatbot for citizen assistance and sentiment analysis tools to monitor feedback. Furthermore, the use of GIS technology for Mouja Map integration and spatial data visualization provides an advanced analytical layer uncommon in typical record-keeping systems. The Progressive Web App (PWA) technology ensures a native app-like experience across all devices without requiring separate installations.

Rigorous testing, a structured 36-month maintenance plan, and a comprehensive audit trail mechanism further underscore the project's commitment to delivering a high-quality, sustainable, and technologically superior mission-critical application.

column10: Project Pani : Oscillating Water Column Wave Energy Converter
column25: Project Pani is an project pioneering renewable wave energy solutions for Bangladesh's coastal regions. Our OWC technology converts ocean wave motion into clean electricity using a dynamic water column, Wells Turbine, and cluster configurations, reducing costs by 80% compared to diesel generators. Targeting remote islands like Saint Martin's, we aim to deliver 960 kWh/day per cluster, supporting sustainable tourism and household power. Established in 2025, we're focused on scalable, eco-friendly energy access.
column26:
- Technical Lead: Munem Shahriar Islam Shamonto, Department of Architecture, BUET. Expertise in renewable energy engineering (OWC design, turbine integration).
- Business Developer: Abdullah Al Junaed, Handles market analysis and partnerships with resorts/hotels.
- Operations Specialist: MD Rifat Ahmed, Focuses on coastal deployment and grid integration.
- Total Team: 5-10 members, including engineers from Bangladesh universities.
column27: Project Pani is an innovative Oscillating Water Column (OWC) device that harnesses wave energy to generate electricity. Key components include a Wave Repeller, Dynamic Column, Wells Turbine, and Buoyancy Ring. Waves cause water levels to rise/fall, compressing/expanding air to drive the turbine for 3-phase power output. Clusters of 10 units occupy 6.6 sqm and produce 960 kWh/day. Distributed via overhead lines to households, resorts, and industries. Addresses Bangladesh's 13,500 MW power demand with 8 MW renewable capacity by 2030. No GHG emissions, 80% cheaper than diesel ($0.40-$0.69/unit). Similar to global projects like LIMPET (Scotland) but localized for 2m average waves in non-tourist areas.
column28: Based on your project, Project Pani's uniqueness lies in its innovative use of an Oscillating Water Column (OWC) tailored for Bangladesh's coastal regions. Unlike traditional solar or wind solutions, it harnesses wave energy with a dynamic design featuring a Wells Turbine and modular cluster system, producing 960 kWh/day per 10-unit setup. This offers an 80% cost reduction compared to diesel generators ($0.40-$0.69/unit) while eliminating greenhouse gas emissions. Its strategic placement in non-tourist areas like Saint Martin's Island preserves scenic beauty, and the scalable 40 kW capacity addresses the specific challenge of remote grid access, setting it apart from global projects like LIMPET by adapting to local 2m wave heights and coastal needs.
column29:
- Converts wave energy to electricity via air compression in OWC chamber.
- Wells Turbine for bidirectional airflow efficiency.
- Modular cluster design: 10 units for scalable output (40 kW per site).
- 24/7 availability (unlike solar intermittency).
- Low maintenance: Buoyancy Ring for stability, minimal marine impact.
- Integration with 3-phase bus for grid-compatible distribution.
- Cost: $77k launch for 40 kW plant, $42k yearly revenue.
(Original content, not pasted from elsewhere)
column30:
- Core: Oscillating Water Column with Wells Turbine (patent-pending design).
- Materials: Corrosion-resistant composites for marine environment.
- Power Conversion: 3-Phase Generator and Line Duct for efficient transmission.
- ICT Integration: Potential IoT sensors for remote monitoring (future phase).
- Quality: 80% cost reduction, zero emissions, high reliability in 2m waves.

column25: We are a pioneering healthcare technology company dedicated to transforming medical diagnostics through advanced artificial intelligence (AI). Our solutions empower healthcare professionals to interpret medical images with greater accuracy, speed, and reliability, reducing human error and optimizing clinical workflows. Supporting multiple imaging modalities such as MRI, CT, and X-ray, our AI-powered tools provide automated, fast, and clinically validated analysis of diverse anatomical structures. Designed for seamless integration with hospital systems and PACS, our technology ensures enterprise-grade security, flexible deployment options, and ease of use across healthcare settings. Committed to innovation, excellence, and collaboration, we strive to improve patient outcomes, assist clinicians in decision-making, and make advanced diagnostics accessible and efficient worldwide, helping hospitals and medical professionals deliver the highest standard of care.
column26: Our team is composed of highly motivated and talented individuals with diverse academic backgrounds and expertise in healthcare technology and artificial intelligence. The team includes two undergraduate students from North South University, who bring fresh perspectives, innovative ideas, and strong technical skills in AI and software development. Complementing them is a master’s graduate from a German university, who contributes advanced knowledge in AI, data analysis, and research-driven solutions. Together, the team combines practical experience, academic excellence, and international exposure to develop cutting-edge AI-powered solutions for medical imaging and diagnostics, ensuring both innovation and quality in every project.
column27: Our solution is an AI-powered medical imaging platform designed to assist healthcare professionals in the accurate and efficient analysis of medical images. Leveraging state-of-the-art deep learning algorithms, the platform provides automated segmentation, classification, and analysis of various imaging modalities, including MRI, CT, and X-ray. The solution is fast, delivering results within seconds, and fully automated, integrating seamlessly into existing clinical workflows. It supports multiple anatomical structures, ensuring comprehensive diagnostic coverage, while maintaining enterprise-grade security for patient data. Flexible deployment options allow implementation either on-premise or in the cloud, making it adaptable for hospitals of all sizes. By reducing manual workload, improving diagnostic precision, and enabling timely decision-making, this solution enhances patient outcomes and optimizes clinical efficiency.
column28: Our solution stands out due to its combination of speed, accuracy, and seamless integration in medical imaging workflows. Unlike traditional tools, it leverages clinically validated deep learning algorithms to provide precise segmentation and analysis across multiple imaging modalities and anatomical structures. The platform is fully automated, reducing human error and radiologist workload while delivering results in seconds. Its flexibility allows deployment on-premise or in the cloud, with enterprise-grade security to protect sensitive patient data. Additionally, the solution bridges academic research and practical application, combining innovative AI technology with real-world clinical usability. This unique blend of efficiency, adaptability, and reliability ensures better diagnostic outcomes and sets it apart from conventional imaging software.
column29: The solution provides a comprehensive AI-powered medical imaging platform that automates the analysis of MRI, CT, and X-ray images, performing segmentation, classification, and detection with minimal human intervention to reduce clinician workload and improve diagnostic accuracy. It supports a wide range of anatomical structures, delivering fast results within seconds, and features an interactive viewer for real-time navigation and visualization of image slices. Seamlessly integrating with hospital systems such as PACS and electronic health records, it fits effortlessly into existing workflows while ensuring enterprise-grade security and regulatory compliance for patient data. Additionally, the platform generates detailed automated reports, enabling informed clinical decision-making and improving patient outcomes, combining automation, precision, versatility, and reliability in a single solution.
column30: The technology is built on clinically validated, state-of-the-art AI algorithms that ensure high accuracy, reliability, and consistency in medical imaging analysis. By applying deep learning techniques to MRI, CT, and X-ray images, it delivers precise segmentation, classification, and detection across multiple anatomical structures. The platform is designed for real-world clinical use, integrating seamlessly with hospital systems, PACS, and electronic health records, while maintaining enterprise-grade security and compliance with regulatory standards. Its rapid, automated analysis reduces diagnostic time, minimizes human error, and enhances patient outcomes, making it a versatile and high-quality solution applicable to hospitals, diagnostic centers, and research institutions seeking efficient, reliable, and advanced imaging technology.

column25: DaktarAI is a startup pioneering AI-driven healthcare in Bangladesh, focusing on skin disease detection with the DaktarAI app. Leveraging a custom dataset of 8,892 augmented and 1,482 original images from Dhaka, Sirajganj, Chapainawabganj, Khulna, & Rangpur we achieved 100% accuracy using EfficientNet, MobileNet v3, and SimCLR models. Launched in 2025, it targets rural populations with limited dermatologist access, offering free diagnostics, health tracking, and education, with plans for scalability and NGO collaboration.
column26:
- AI Lead: Ihsanul Haque Asif, AI researcher, North South University, Specializes in deep learning for medical imaging (EfficientNet optimization).
- App Developer: Abtahi Noor, Backend Developer, Builds lightweight, offline-capable mobile app.
- Health Expert: Dr Md Wali Ullah Redoy, Shaheed M. Monsur Ali Medical College, Ensures localized health guidance and NGO collaboration.
- Total Team: 5-8 members, including researchers from Bangladesh universities.
column27: DaktarAI is a mobile app using deep learning (EfficientNet, MobileNet v3, SimCLR) with 100% accuracy to detect arsenicosis-affected skin, based on a dataset of 8,892 augmented and 1,482 original images from various regions of Bangladesh. Users upload photos for classification (healthy vs. affected), with GradCAM for explainability. Features include offline analysis, multi-language support (Bengali/English), health tracking, and education on arsenic exposure. Scalable to other skin diseases, it empowers rural communities, reducing healthcare costs through early detection.
column28: Your uniqueness with DaktarAI lies in being the first AI-based skin disease detection app tailored to the diverse skin tones and patterns of the Bangladeshi population, achieving 100% accuracy with models like EfficientNet, MobileNet v3, and SimCLR. It leverages a custom dataset of 8,892 augmented and 1,482 original images from various regions of Bangladesh, addressing arsenicosis—a critical local health issue. Offering free, offline-capable diagnostics, health tracking, and education, it empowers rural communities with limited healthcare access, integrating GradCAM for explainable AI and planning scalability to other diseases, setting it apart globally.
column29:
- AI classification of arsenicosis with 100% accuracy (EfficientNet, SimCLR).
- Offline photo analysis with cloud sync option.
- Health diary for tracking skin conditions.
- GradCAM visualization for model transparency.
- Personalized guidance (home care, clinic referrals).
- Educational content on arsenicosis prevention.
- Multi-language support (Bengali, English).
column30:
- Core: EfficientNet, MobileNet v3, SimCLR models trained on 10,374 images.
- Platform: Lightweight Android/iOS app for low-end devices.
- Security: Local data storage, optional anonymized cloud sync.
- ICT Integration: GradCAM for explainability, potential telemedicine links.
- Quality: 100% accuracy, robust dataset, scalable framework.

column25: Smart ICU Monitoring is a researcher and student developed health-tech product of Bangladesh that produces high-quality ICU-grade patient monitoring available at home or hospital at an affordable price using Care Pi, an IoT-based device. It integrates Raspberry Pi and medical sensors to measure vital signs and room conditions with real-time data accessible on a secure web platform. Our system, which has been developed by a team of 5–8 Bangladeshi researchers based in Bangladeshi universities, aims to reduce hospital burden, improve patient treatment, and make monitoring inexpensive and accessible to all.

column27: Care Pi is an affordable IoT-based system that uses Raspberry Pi and sensors to track vital signs with I96% accuracy of an ICU devise. It allows doctors to monitor patients remotely, 24/7, through a simple web interface. Along with health data, it also records room conditions, helping doctors make better decisions. The health data is stroed in a data base so that the doctors can access teh patients history and analize to make a better decision By reducing hospital pressure and making continuous care possible at home, Care Pi brings advanced ICU-level monitoring within everyone’s reach at a fraction of the cost.
column28: Care Pi is incredibly inexpensive, modular, and simple to set up without specific training, in contrast to conventional ICU equipment. It displays data in an intuitive manner and combines several vital sign measurements (blood pressure, heart rate, SpO₂, respiration rate, etc.) into a single portable device. Doctors may oversee several patients at once from any location because of its Internet of Things-based remote monitoring function, which is something that traditional hospital equipment cannot do at a reasonable price.

Alerts & Notifications: Automated alarm signals for unusual readings. Modular Design: Sensors can be added or replaced as a function of patient needs. Live Visuals & Patient Info: Complete medical histories on-demand.
column30: Care Pi combines Raspberry Pi, medical-grade sensors, and IoT technology to offer precise, ongoing monitoring of health at 96% accuracy.The system taps cloud based data transmission and visualization to enable physicians to see organized patient data anywhere and at any time. Its modular and scalable design demonstrates high embedded  systems, IoT, and real-time analysis deployment as well as being adaptable for employment in emergency care and also far-off management of long-term care.

column25:
Riseup Labs is a global technology solutions provider headquartered in Bangladesh, with offices in the USA and a strong presence across Asia. We deliver innovative digital products and services across software, gaming, enterprise IT, and BPO operations, backed by over a decade of proven success in serving North American and European clients.
Our client portfolio spans Japan, Australia, Singapore, China, and Taiwan, reflecting the trust of global enterprises in our solutions. To support this international footprint, we harness a diverse talent network across Bangladesh, Pakistan, India, and the Philippines, combining world-class technical expertise with operational agility.
Our mission is to drive digital transformation through intelligent automation, AI-driven solutions, and customer-centric platforms that redefine efficiency and experience. Commplify, our flagship AI-based customer experience (CX) automation platform, is already deployed within Riseup Labs’ own international BPO services for EU and NA markets and is now scaled for enterprise use worldwide. This unique synergy of in-house deployment, engineering depth, and global delivery capability positions Riseup Labs as a leader in enterprise-ready AI innovation.
column26:
Commplify is developed and driven by a dedicated team at Riseup Labs, combining expertise in AI engineering, enterprise software, and customer experience operations. The product team includes:

AI & Engineering Division – Specialists in conversational AI, LLM orchestration, and multi-channel integration.

CX & BPO Operations Unit – Actively deploying Commplify in Riseup Labs’ own international contact center services, ensuring real-world validation.

Business Development & Product Strategy – Focused on scaling Commplify across BFSI, Healthcare, Retail, and Telecom enterprises globally.

This mix of technical depth, operational experience, and market focus enables the team to continuously innovate and deliver Commplify as an enterprise-ready, globally scalable solution.
column27:
Commplify is an AI-agnostic customer experience orchestration platform that empowers enterprises to design, deploy, and scale intelligent customer interactions across voice, non-voice (Chat, Email) and other digital channels from a single platform.

Built as a modular architecture, Commplify allows organizations to streamline customer service, sales, and support workflows with unmatched adaptability and control. It serves as an intelligent orchestration layer, enabling predictive, personalized, and omnichannel conversations while optimizing operational costs and improving customer satisfaction.

Already in use within our own BPO services for NA clients, Commplify has proven its scalability and measurable impact, including reduced handling times, automated service resolution, and improved customer retention.
column28:
1.	AI-Agnostic Architecture – Enterprises can integrate their preferred LLMs, voice engines, or CRM systems, ensuring vendor independence and future-proofing.
2.	Voice + Non-Voice Unification – A single platform for voice, chat, email, and social channels, with seamless context handover across touchpoints.
3.	Orbit Suite of Add-Ons – Unique tools like Co-Mail (email automation), Co-QA (100% QA coverage), Co-Pilot (real-time assist), and Co-Emotion (sentiment routing) go far beyond traditional chatbot or IVR systems.
4.	Hybrid Intelligence (AIL) – “AI in the loop” ensures automation efficiency with human fallback for complex queries, striking the right balance of trust, compliance, and empathy.
5.	Streamlined Knowledge Store Integration – Unified data management that empowers both AI agents and human agents to deliver accurate, context-rich support.
6.	Field-Proven – Unlike many experimental AI tools, Commplify is already deployed in production environments, including in our BPO contact centers serving international customers.
column29:
•	Omnichannel CX: Integrated support for inbound/outbound calls, chat, email, and messaging platforms.
•	Orbit Add-Ons: Co-Mail, Co-QA, Co-Pilot, Co-Emotion, Co-Build (no-code workflow builder).
•	Vertical Depth: Pre-built workflows for BPO/CC, Retail, Healthsp and have an expansion plan to other verticals.
•	Scalability: Designed for high-volume enterprise use cases; modular expansion allows rapid adaptation.
•	Security & Control: Built-in audit logging, redaction, and role-based access.
•	Self-Deployment in BPO: Validated with real-world call centers, demonstrating cost savings and quality improvements.
column30:
Commplify applies advanced AI and orchestration technology to transform how enterprises deliver customer service. By combining modular AI engines, multi-channel orchestration, and agent-assist tools, it addresses/promises three critical enterprise needs:
1.	Efficiency – Automates 60–70% of Tier-1 interactions, reducing operational costs and agent workload.
2.	Experience – Predicts intent, personalizes interactions, and provides seamless transitions across channels, boosting CSAT and retention.
3.	Scalability – Modular, AI-agnostic design allows global deployment, integration with enterprise systems, and rapid scaling to new industries.
In pilot deployments and case studies, Commplify has demonstrated:
•	40% call deflection in BPO/Retail CC,
•	70% email automation in retail CS,
•	200% + outbound sales productivity gain for retail CC,
•	100% QA coverage in healthcare & retail QA analysis

column27:
Barta Prohori is a community-driven deep learning solution designed to protect digital citizens of Bangladesh from smishing (SMS phishing) attacks. The system base on advanced natural language processing (NLP) and AI models to detect and classify suspicious messages in Bangla, English, and Banglish. What makes Barta Prohori unique is its localization: unlike generic spam filters, it is trained on real-world, community-contributed datasets that reflect the communication patterns of Bangladeshi users. 
This solution also incorporates a community reporting mechanism. This feature allows users to submit new scam messages, enabling the model to learn continuously and stay ahead of evolving threats.Barta Prohori aims to become a trusted communication safety net for millions of mobile users. Its scalable design allows future integration with mobile banking, telecom services, and national digital security initiatives, making it a sustainable and impactful solution for both Bangladesh and beyond.
column28:
Barta Prohori is the first community-driven AI framework in Bangladesh focused on localized smishing detection. Unlike global spam filters built mainly for English, it understands Bangla and Banglish SMS patterns that scammers exploit.

1. Localized Solution: Specifically built for Bangla, English, and Banglish, addressing the linguistic patterns of Bangladeshi users.
2. Community-Driven Dataset: Trained on real-world, user-contributed messages instead of generic or foreign datasets
3. Continuous Learning: Community reporting feature ensures the system adapts to new and evolving smishing threats
4.  Scalable Design: Future-ready integration with mobile banking, telecom services, and national security platforms.
column29:
1.Multilingual Detection: Classifies suspicious SMS in Bangla, English, and Banglish.
2. AI-Powered Classification: Uses advanced NLP and machine learning models for accurate smishing detection.
3. Community Reporting: Users can submit new scam messages, enabling continuous improvement.
4. Web & App Integration: Accessible through a web platform with potential mobile deployment.
5.  User Roles & Dashboard: Includes visitor, user, and admin roles for reporting, managing, and monitoring.
6.  Blog Section: A dedicated space where users can share experiences, awareness posts, and security tips to build community knowledge.
7. Extended Capabilities: Supports URL scanning (VirusTotal), OCR for image-based text, and Whisper for voice message analysis.
column30:
1. Uses advanced NLP/AI models (XLM-RoBERTa + classical baselines) for multilingual smishing detection.
2. Dataset curated with strict evaluation (Accuracy, F1, ROC-AUC) and balancing techniques.
3. Flask-based AI integrated with PHP-MySQL platform for secure and scalable deployment.
4. Extensible with VirusTotal, OCR, and Whisper for multimodal analysis.
5. Combines deep learning with interpretable rules for transparency.

column30:
Automation: Technology automates repetitive and labor-intensive tasks. This frees up human workers to focus on more complex, creative, and value-added activities. For instance, in a manufacturing setup, a robotic arm can handle precision welding, while a human supervisor monitors the process and performs quality checks.

Data Analysis: Modern technology allows for the collection, processing, and analysis of vast amounts of data. This data provides insights into everything from customer behavior and market trends to operational efficiency and resource consumption. Businesses can use this information to make informed decisions, optimize processes, and identify new opportunities.

Connectivity and Communication: The Internet, mobile networks, and cloud computing have fundamentally changed how businesses operate. They enable seamless communication, collaboration, and data sharing across different locations. This connectivity expands market reach, facilitates remote work, and allows small businesses to compete on a global scale.

Material and Process Innovation: Technology is constantly pushing the boundaries of what is possible. In the context of the Plastic Recycling Unit, the technology of the extruder and the 3D printer allows for the transformation of waste materials into new, functional products. This not only creates a new business model but also addresses a significant environmental problem.

Productivity and Quality Control: Technology provides tools for greater precision and consistency, leading to higher-quality products and services. In a recycling context, sensors and automated systems can ensure that the recycled plastic is of a uniform grade, making the final product more reliable and valuable.

column27: Project Poribesh Bondhu is a comprehensive, multi-phase environmental restoration system engineered to reclaim the ecological vitality of Dhaka's urban waterways, which, as of September 2025, are critically stressed from post-monsoon runoff and years of accumulated pollutants. We address the systemic collapse of these aquatic ecosystems—suffering from chronic hypoxia, industrial and sewage-based chemical imbalances, and overwhelming solid waste—through an integrated fleet of intelligent, autonomous, solar-assisted marine drones. These units are far more than autonomous janitors; they are robotic field ecologists that perform a continuous cycle of diagnosis, treatment, and maintenance. Methodically patrolling designated zones, each drone executes three synergistic functions: it restores breath to suffocating "dead zones" by infusing the water column with dissolved oxygen using advanced nanobubble technology; it detoxifies the environment by filtering invisible killers like microplastics and chemical pollutants through a high-efficiency, chemical-free system; and it cleans the visible surface by collecting, compressing, and depositing floating debris for efficient shoreside disposal in direct coordination with municipal partners. This entire operation is orchestrated by a powerful AI that not only monitors the water's vital signs in real-time but also learns the unique rhythm of each waterway, allowing it to predict and preemptively address potential issues. All this invaluable data is synthesized on our public-facing Eco-Wellness Dashboard, transforming complex environmental metrics into a simple, understandable "health score" that empowers citizens and informs policy. Our mission is to actively transition our city's waterways from stagnant liabilities into vibrant, self-sustaining ecosystems that enhance public health, biodiversity, and civic pride.
column28: Our solution's uniqueness is rooted in a guiding philosophy of Active Ecological Restoration, a profound shift from simple intervention to empowering nature's own healing processes. We fundamentally operate as an aquatic doctor, not a janitor; our success is therefore not measured in tons of garbage collected, but in the sustained, measurable improvement of the water’s core vital signs, such as achieving stable Dissolved Oxygen (DO) levels above 5 mg/L, balancing pH, and increasing Secchi depth (clarity). This philosophy translates directly into a strategy of targeted healing over general cleaning. For instance, our AI prioritizes resource allocation with ecological intelligence, choosing to expend its energy healing a nascent algal bloom by oxygenating the water column rather than simply collecting a patch of harmless organic debris. Furthermore, our system is distinguished by its inherently modular and scalable design. The drone is a versatile platform with interchangeable sensing, collection, and treatment modules, which future-proofs the system for new technologies and makes field maintenance incredibly efficient and cost-effective. Finally, our commitment to sustainability is absolute and holistic. The drones' hybrid solar-assisted power system is supplemented by shore-based fast charging, minimizing their carbon footprint. They are constructed from corrosion-resistant, recycled composite materials—addressing the city's plastic waste problem in their very fabrication—and utilize silent, energy-efficient thrusters to ensure they are a peaceful, regenerative presence, not an industrial disturbance, in the very environment they are built to save.
column29: Poribesh Bondhu is equipped with a sophisticated suite of features, each designed for gentle, effective, and intelligent environmental care. The brain of the operation is the Eco-Vision AI, a computer vision system that goes beyond simple object detection to observe and understand the ecosystem's state, identifying subtle signs of distress like the discoloration from harmful algal blooms alongside floating garbage. At its heart is the Water Healing System, a dual-function module that forms the core of its restorative capabilities. The Vitality Infusion component uses an efficient venturi aeration system to gently bubble dissolved oxygen into the water, replenishing this critical element for fish and beneficial microorganisms. Simultaneously, the Gentle Filtration Module employs a passive, multi-stage filter—mimicking a riverbank's natural process with layers of mesh and activated carbon—to remove harmful micro-pollutants without using any chemicals. For larger debris, a Gentle Debris Collection system uses a retractable net to gather surface garbage like plastic bottles and bags. The drone’s Harmony Navigation System then guides it to designated shoreline points to offload this waste for proper disposal. All the real-time data collected by its sensors is transmitted to the cloud and displayed on the public-facing Eco-Wellness Dashboard, which uses intuitive graphs and heatmaps to communicate the waterway's health to the community. This entire process is guided by the Harmony Navigation System, an advanced autonomous algorithm that plots the quietest and most energy-efficient paths, ensuring the drone is always a peaceful and effective presence in the water.
column30: We apply a carefully integrated stack of modern technology with a deep and abiding respect for the natural world, ensuring our solution is both powerfully effective and fundamentally environmentally responsible. The drone's intelligence is driven by adaptive AI and machine learning; we use advanced convolutional neural networks (CNNs) for the Eco-Vision system and employ reinforcement learning for the Harmony Navigation System, allowing the drone to learn the unique rhythms of its environment and improve its care strategies over time. The platform is a showcase of sustainable and green technology. It relies entirely on high-efficiency solar panels coupled with an intelligent battery management system to ensure 24/7 operation with zero carbon footprint. Its energy-conserving motors and hydrodynamic design are testaments to our commitment to green engineering principles. Each drone functions as a mobile node in a sophisticated environmental Internet of Things (IoT) sensing network. It uses an array of low-power, scientific-grade sensors to continuously "feel" the pulse of the water, gathering high-fidelity data that is transmitted via a LoRaWAN gateway to a secure, time-series cloud database. This rich dataset becomes an invaluable resource for data science and conservation. By providing this longitudinal data to the scientific community, we allow researchers to analyze long-term trends, model complex ecosystem dynamics, correlate pollution events with external factors, and gain the deep insights needed to create effective, evidence-based conservation policies for the future.

column25: null
column26:
The team consists of two members. They are—

2. Mahbuba Rahman
column27: The system is a blockchain-only fake-news verification solution that relies on a decentralized, transparent, and algorithmic approach without using any artificial intelligence or machine learning (AI/ML). Its core functionality is to determine the truthfulness of a claim using weighted validator consensus, with built-in incentives and disincentives.
column28:
The system's uniqueness lies in its purely algorithmic, on-chain implementation of reputation, trust, and truth scoring, designed for stability, fairness, and feasibility; all these are going to be calculated through a formula. Key features that distinguish it are
1) No AI/ML Reliance
2) Reputation-Weighted Voting
3) Diminishing Returns on Stake
4) Continuous, Fine-Grained Slashing
5) Hyperbolic Decay for ATS
column29:
1) Author Trust Score (ATS)
*Quantifies an author’s credibility based on verified true/false submissions.
*Incorporates Laplace smoothing, a decay function for inactivity, and a minimum trust floor to prevent unfair extremes.

2) Validator Reputation (Rep)
*Builds gradually from how often a validator agrees with the final consensus.
*Ensures fair influence distribution, especially for new participants.

3) Claim Truth Score (Score_claim)
*Combines validator reputation and stake size with a sqrt(stake) mechanism to limit whales.
*Threshold-based decision: ≥0.70 = True, ≤0.30 = False, otherwise escalated for review.


4) Slashing and Rewards
*Incorrect validators are penalized proportionally to how wrong they were.
*Correct validators share a reward pool funded by submission fees and slashed stakes.

5) Smart Contract Implementation
*Written in Solidity, using commit–reveal voting, fixed-point math, and on-chain slashing/reward logic.
*Fully executable as a prototype for pilot testing or thesis demonstration.

column27: Shongothon is a financial coordination app designed for groups in Bangladesh, such as families, student batches, office colleagues, and community samiti groups. The solution is not meant to replace money transfer services like bKash and Nagad, but to provide a necessary layer of transparency, accountability, and trust for managing collective funds. The app allows groups to create shared financial pots, track all contributions, and make collaborative decisions about how the money is spent. It works by digitizing the informal systems that people already use, like welfare funds and bill-splitting, thereby removing the friction and mistrust associated with paper ledgers and word-of-mouth accounting. This approach directly addresses the cultural nuances of community financing in Bangladesh, where collective saving and spending are deeply ingrained social habits. For instance, office colleagues frequently pool money for daily lunches or social events, families manage shared household budgets, and student groups split costs for projects and trips. Currently, these activities are managed through cumbersome and unreliable methods like WhatsApp groups cluttered with screenshots of transactions, or paper notebooks that can be easily lost or altered. Shongothon provides a centralized, digital ledger that is accessible to all members, ensuring that every transaction is recorded and visible. By formalizing these informal financial activities, the app not only enhances efficiency and reduces the potential for disputes but also builds a foundation of trust. It transforms ambiguous, memory-based accounting into a concrete, auditable record, allowing social and familial relationships to thrive without the underlying strain of financial uncertainty. Ultimately, Shongothon aims to be the indispensable organizational tool that empowers communities to manage their collective wealth with confidence and clarity, strengthening the very fabric of these social networks.
column28: The uniqueness of Shongothon lies in its focus on solving the coordination and trust issues in group finance, a gap not addressed by existing money transfer apps like bKash and Nagad. It tackles the primary reasons informal groups collapse, such as lack of transparency, suspicion of treasurers, and poor record-keeping. Its distinctive features directly create trust and accountability. The app's Auto-Tracking from Transaction SMS automatically parses bKash/Nagad transaction SMS to update the ledger, a unique feature that reduces manual effort and errors. This is fundamentally different from simply sending money; it’s about creating an intelligent, self-updating record book that requires minimal user intervention, thereby lowering the barrier to accurate bookkeeping. The Trust Meter™ provides a reliability score for each member based on their payment history, offering a novel way to quantify dependability within a group. This gamified approach to financial responsibility is a powerful social motivator, creating a transparent reputation system that encourages timely contributions more effectively than social pressure alone. Additionally, holding funds in an Escrow for Groups wallet until specific conditions are met directly solves the core trust issue with a single treasurer. This feature acts as a neutral third party, safeguarding funds for a specific purpose—like a group trip or a large purchase—and only releasing them when the agreed-upon conditions, such as full funding, are met. This single feature can eliminate the most common point of failure in informal group finance. Finally, unlike informal discussions on WhatsApp, the Poll & Vote on Spending feature creates a transparent and logged decision-making process, ensuring accountability. It provides a structured forum for debate and resolution, ensuring that every member has a voice and that the final decision is a matter of public record within the group, preventing future arguments about how or why a decision was made.
column29: The app's core functionality is delivered through a set of specific features designed for seamless and transparent group financial management. The user journey begins with Auto-Tracking from Transaction SMS, where members can simply forward their bKash/Nagad transaction confirmation SMS to a designated number, or use a share function within the app. The system then intelligently parses the message, extracts key information like sender, amount, and transaction ID, and automatically updates the group ledger in real-time. This eliminates the tedious and error-prone process of manual data entry. Central to the app's trust-building mechanism is the Trust Meter™, a dynamic score assigned to each member. This score is prominently displayed on user profiles and is calculated using an algorithm that considers the timeliness of contributions, participation in polls, and overall consistency. This feature provides an at-a-glance measure of reliability for all members. To facilitate collaborative and democratic decision-making, the Poll & Vote on Spending feature allows any member to propose an expense and create a poll. Other members receive a notification and can cast their vote within a set timeframe. The results are displayed transparently with a clear breakdown, and the final decision is automatically recorded in the group’s history, creating an immutable audit trail. For high-value goals and to mitigate risk, the Escrow for Groups functionality allows a group to set up a dedicated pot where contributions are held securely. Funds are locked and cannot be withdrawn by any single member; they are only released automatically once predefined rules, such as reaching a funding target by a certain date, are met. Lastly, the Emergency Help Button serves as a community safety net. When a member faces a crisis, they can activate this feature, which instantly sends a push notification to all group members with a clear call for help and a direct link to contribute, streamlining the process of mobilizing urgent support.
column30: Shongothon applies modern technology to digitize and secure these informal financial interactions, focusing on reliability, security, and user experience. The backbone of its automation is a sophisticated SMS Parsing Technology. This involves developing and maintaining a robust engine, likely using advanced regular expressions and potentially lightweight machine learning models, to accurately read and interpret the varied and evolving SMS templates from different mobile financial services like bKash and Nagad. This ensures high accuracy in data entry, which is critical for user trust. The "Trust Meter™" is powered by an algorithm-driven trust score, which is a practical application of data science. This algorithm will analyze behavioral data—such as payment punctuality against deadlines, frequency of participation in votes, and consistency in contributions—to generate a fair and dynamic reliability metric. This requires a carefully designed data model to weigh different positive and negative actions appropriately. A cornerstone of the app's security model is the secure digital escrow service. This is a complex financial technology integration that requires partnering with a licensed financial institution to hold funds. The entire process will be secured with bank-grade encryption, two-factor authentication, and will need to adhere strictly to the regulatory frameworks for financial services in Bangladesh, ensuring that users' funds are always safe. To keep users engaged and informed, the app also leverages real-time push notifications. This system is built on a reliable backend infrastructure, ensuring that critical alerts for voting deadlines, payment reminders, and especially the Emergency Help Button, are delivered instantly and reliably across different devices and network conditions. Finally, the long-term vision includes using ethical data analytics. This involves implementing strong data anonymization and aggregation techniques to study community-level financial behaviors without compromising user privacy. The resulting insights could be invaluable for NGOs, researchers, and policymakers, all while adhering to a strict, opt-in-based data governance framework.

column27: Our project introduces an innovative three-layer verification framework for indoor fire detection designed to significantly reduce false alarms and enhance safety. This multi-modal system integrates smoke sensors, computer vision, and temperature monitoring to ensure accurate and timely responses. The process initiates with an MQ2 smoke sensor that continuously monitors for potential fire incidents. Upon detecting smoke, a custom-trained YOLOv11n computer vision model is activated to visually confirm the presence of fire using existing CCTV infrastructure. If the visual confirmation is positive, an alarm is triggered immediately. However, if the model does not detect a fire, a third layer of validation is initiated, where an LM35 temperature sensor checks for a significant rise in ambient temperature. This layered approach ensures a comprehensive and reliable fire detection system that balances accuracy, speed, and resource efficiency, making it a practical solution for residential, commercial, and industrial settings.
column28: The uniqueness of our solution lies in its hierarchical, multi-sensor validation approach, which addresses the critical flaws of conventional fire detection systems. Unlike standalone smoke detectors prone to false alarms from non-fire sources like dust or steam, or computationally expensive continuous video analysis systems, our framework activates its more resource-intensive components only when necessary. The "always-on, first-alert" smoke sensor acts as a low-power trigger for the AI-powered visual verification. This sequential activation of sensors, from smoke to computer vision and finally to temperature, creates a fail-safe mechanism that drastically minimizes false positives. Furthermore, the system is designed to be hardware-agnostic and can be integrated with existing CCTV networks, making it a cost-effective and scalable solution that can be adapted to various indoor environments without requiring expensive infrastructure overhauls. The use of a lightweight YOLOv11n model ensures that the system can run on standard surveillance hardware, eliminating the need for high-end computational resources.
column29:
Our fire detection system is built on a three-layer validation process to ensure high accuracy and reliability. Key functionalities and features include:
Primary Smoke Detection: An MQ-2 gas sensor continuously monitors the environment for smoke particles, serving as the primary trigger for the system. This component is highly energy-efficient as it is the only part of the system that is always active.
AI-Powered Visual Verification: Upon smoke detection, a custom-trained YOLOv11n AI model analyzes the live feed from a connected camera to visually confirm the presence of flames. This model can accurately detect various types of fires, including those from cooking oil, electrical sources, gas, liquids, metals, and solids.
Temperature Cross-Validation: If the AI model does not detect a fire despite the presence of smoke, an LM35 temperature sensor is activated as a fail-safe. A sharp increase in temperature will trigger an alarm, ensuring that fires are detected even if they are visually obstructed.
False Alarm Mitigation: The multi-layer validation process ensures that alarms are only triggered when there is corroborating evidence from at least two different sources, significantly reducing false positives from common environmental factors.
Seamless Integration: The system is designed to integrate with existing CCTV surveillance networks, making it a cost-effective and easily deployable solution.
column30:
The technological foundation of our project is a robust integration of Internet of Things (IoT) sensors and advanced Artificial Intelligence. The custom-trained YOLOv11n model demonstrates exceptional performance, achieving a high precision of 97.9% and a recall of 97.1%. This high level of accuracy is critical for a life-saving application such as fire detection. The model has been trained on a diverse dataset of 9,128 images, enabling it to accurately identify six different classes of fire. The system's modular architecture, controlled by an ESP32 microcontroller, allows for wireless communication and easy scalability.
This technology is highly applicable in a wide range of indoor environments. In residential buildings, it can provide early and reliable warnings, protecting lives and property. In commercial spaces like offices and warehouses, it can prevent catastrophic financial losses and ensure business continuity. For industrial settings, where the risk of fire can be higher, this system offers a more reliable and cost-effective safety solution than traditional systems. By leveraging existing infrastructure and low-cost, efficient components, our system provides a high-quality, accessible, and adaptable solution for enhancing fire safety in smart buildings and industrial applications.

column25: We are a student team working together on this project rather than a registered company.

column27: Alpha Verifier is an AI and blockchain-powered judicial platform designed to modernize Bangladesh’s justice system. It tackles corruption, case backlogs, and manipulation by introducing tamper-proof records, AI-based fraud detection, decentralized storage (IPFS), and smart contracts for automating legal workflows. The system ensures faster, fairer, and more transparent judicial processes while empowering citizens with multilingual access, real-time case updates, and a public transparency porta
column28: Unlike existing e-judiciary solutions, Alpha Verifier integrates blockchain + AI + IPFS + smart contracts in one platform. This unique combination guarantees immutability, fraud detection, automated summons/judgment workflows, and citizen-facing transparency. It directly addresses corruption, metadata manipulation, and case tampering — challenges that conventional digitization alone cannot solve. Its alignment with SDGs 16, 10, and 17 also makes it globally relevant
column29:
Immutable Record-Keeping: Blockchain-based case lifecycle tracking (complaint → evidence → trial → judgment).

Decentralized Evidence Storage: All FIRs, charge sheets, and evidence stored on IPFS with blockchain hashes.

AI-Powered Validation: Detects fake complaints, tampered evidence, and metadata manipulation.

Smart Contract Automation: Handles summons delivery, hearing notifications, appeal triggers, and workflow automation.

Transparency Portal: Public dashboards with case trends, resolution times, and policy insights.

Multilingual & Mobile Access: Inclusive participation for all citizens, regardless of language or digital literacy
column30:
Alpha Verifier is built with a scalable, modular architecture:

Frontend: React.js, Wagmi, Ethers.js for user-friendly, secure interactions.

Backend: Node.js (Express.js) for APIs and system integration.

Smart Contracts: Solidity + Hardhat for case lifecycle automation.

Blockchain Layer: Polygon (L2) ensures scalability, low cost, and high throughput.

Storage: IPFS for decentralized file storage, MongoDB for metadata, Firebase for real-time updates.

This cutting-edge stack ensures tamper-proof evidence, transparent case management, and rapid judicial workflows, making the solution robust, scalable, and globally adaptable

column7: Cross Categories - R & D Project of the Year (CC-RD)
column8: Technology - AI Technology of the Year (CT-AI)
column25:
Threadsense is a technology venture dedicated to solving one of the most persistent challenges in Bangladesh’s ready-made garment (RMG) sector: ensuring consistent fabric quality at the cutting stage.
The RMG industry contributes around 81% of the country’s exports, valued at approximately $38.5 billion in 2024, and employs over 4 million workers. Yet, even with these massive contributions, the industry struggles with quality control. A defect rate of just 3% in a factory producing one million garments annually results in 30,000 faulty panels, leading to costly rework, wasted material, buyer penalties, and reputational risks.
Threadsense was created to reduce these losses by providing a practical, reliable, and factory-ready solution. Its mission is to make quality checks faster, more consistent, and auditable, while saving manufacturers money and strengthening long-term buyer relationships.
column26:
Iftehaz Yeasir Iftee -Team Lead
Baki Billah Siddiki- Member
Ishmam Tasdik Zihad-Member
column27:
Threadsense is an AI-powered quality control system designed for garment factories. It combines cameras, sensors, and intelligent software to automatically inspect cut fabric panels and verify that they meet specifications.
How the solution works:
Capture: Cameras scan each panel, a GSM station measures fabric weight, a colorimeter detects shade variations, and barcodes track order details.
Analyze: AI models process these inputs to detect visual defects such as holes, stains, and yarn breaks, as well as more subtle issues like shade mismatches or potential shrinkage.
Decide: Based on combined results, operators receive clear instructions on whether to accept, hold, or rework a panel, supported with photographic evidence.
Trace: Every check is recorded in a digital log for factory records and buyer audits, making quality management more transparent.
This approach ensures that problems are caught early, production delays are reduced, and overall efficiency is improved without disrupting existing workflows.
column28:
Threadsense is not a generic industrial tool but one designed specifically for the textile industry. Its uniqueness lies in:
Textile-trained AI models that recognize fabric-specific defects and textures.
Beyond visual inspection, addressing GSM, shrinkage, and shade mismatches alongside surface flaws.
Factory practicality, with features like offline functionality, tolerance for poor lighting, and seamless integration with operator workflows.
Flexible investment options, allowing manufacturers to start with a low-cost setup and scale up as needed.
This combination of affordability, accuracy, and adaptability makes Threadsense a solution that factories can realistically adopt and expand.
column29:
Threadsense brings together several critical inspection functions under one system, creating a complete quality control platform.
Key functions include:
Automated defect detection: holes, stains, needle marks, yarn breaks.
Shade and color consistency checks across multiple plies.
Specification verification for GSM, shrinkage behavior, and style/order accuracy.
Decision support with simple accept/hold/rework instructions and image evidence.
Digital traceability for internal reporting and buyer audits.
Scalable architecture, enabling deployment on a single line and expansion across entire factories.
With these features, factories can expect to cut defect rates significantly—from an average of 3% down to 1–2%—resulting in annual savings of up to $160,000 per factory while also improving buyer trust.
column30:
Threadsense integrates artificial intelligence with IoT devices to create a dependable, high-speed quality inspection system.
AI Models Used
Computer vision models for defect detection and segmentation.
Color analysis models (ΔE) for identifying subtle shade mismatches.
Predictive machine learning for anticipating shrinkage or GSM issues.
Rule-based decision logic to combine camera, sensor, and metadata inputs into final quality decisions.
IoT Hardware Components
Fixed or line-scan cameras for detailed panel imaging.
GSM testing stations for fabric weight verification.
Colorimeters or spectrophotometers for shade detection.
Barcode/RFID readers for order and style verification.
Edge computing devices (e.g., NVIDIA Jetson) to process results instantly on the factory floor.
Strengths of the Approach
Fast: inspection results are delivered within 200–500 milliseconds.
Reliable: continues functioning offline during network outages.
Adaptive: learns continuously from operator feedback to improve accuracy.
Cost-effective: return on investment typically achieved within 6–12 months.
Threadsense, in simple terms, works like a smart digital inspector placed directly in the factory. It identifies defects earlier, reduces waste, increases efficiency, and builds stronger trust with buyers—all while fitting seamlessly into the existing production environment.
