   - Department-wise fine-tuned AI models that evolve with factory data to improve accuracy and decision-making.

 - A modular structure with BRM, PI, WFM, and Compliance solutions that scale from small to large factories.
column28:
Unlike generic ERP or CRM platforms, fabricXai is purpose-built for the Bangladesh RMG ecosystem. Its uniqueness lies in:

Garment-specific workflows fine-tuned to industry needs.

AI-first approach, where agents learn and adapt continuously from factory data.

End-to-end integration—buyer communication, production tracking, inventory, workforce, and compliance—on a single platform.

This makes fabricXai the first “Garments Intelligent Platform” capable of transforming the sector holistically.
column29:
Features of fabricXai :

- Buyer Relationship Management (BRM): Smart handling of buyer communication, personalized emails, and order intake.

- Production Intelligence (PI): Real-time order progress, efficiency analysis, and predictive delay alerts.

- Workforce Management (WFM): Attendance, line efficiency, and performance analytics.

- Inventory & Supply Chain: Raw material tracking, stock optimization, and cost reduction.

- AI Assistant (Chatbot): Natural language interface for employees to query production and compliance data instantly.
column30:
fabricXai leverages multi-agent AI orchestration, vector databases, and custom fine-tuned models for factory operations. The system ensures:

- Scalability: Will be able to support 5,000+ factories and 9,000+ buying houses in Bangladesh.

- Security: Enterprise-grade encryption and data protection protocols.

- Adaptability: AI Agents continuously improve using factory-specific data.

- Usability: Simple, conversational AI interface that reduces dependency on manual report generation.

By embedding AI at the core, fabricXai transforms traditional operations into data-driven, globally compliant, and future-proof garment manufacturing workflows.

column7: Cross Categories - R & D Project of the Year (CC-RD)
column25: XBee is a pioneering greentech startup dedicated to tackling Bangladesh's plastic pollution crisis through innovative, technology-driven solutions. Our core mission is to empower individuals and communities by transforming harmful plastic waste into a valuable resource. We are developing an integrated Plastic Recycling Unit that converts used plastics, such as PET bottles, into high-quality 3D printing filament. This groundbreaking approach makes recycling accessible and economically viable, fostering a circular economy at the grassroots level and turning a critical environmental problem into an opportunity for sustainable development.
column26: Total Team: 5-8 members, including researchers from Bangladesh universities.
column27: Our solution is an integrated, IoT-enabled Plastic Recycling Unit designed for personal and community-level use. The system takes common plastic waste (like PET bottles), shreds and cleans it, and then melts and extrudes it into a standardized 1.75mm filament for 3D printers. This filament can then be used with standard CAD software and 3D printers to create new, useful, and marketable products. By decentralizing the recycling process, our solution provides a complete, end-to-end ecosystem for turning local plastic waste into valuable goods, democratizing manufacturing and putting the power of recycling directly into the hands of the community.
column28: The uniqueness of XBee's solution lies in its integration of IoT technology with personal-scale recycling. Unlike large, centralized industrial recycling plants, our model is decentralized, accessible, and affordable. It uniquely empowers individuals to participate directly in the circular economy by creating their own raw materials from waste found in their immediate environment. By connecting the act of recycling directly to the creative potential of 3D printing, we are not just managing waste; we are creating a novel platform for local innovation, entrepreneurship, and environmental stewardship that is currently absent in the market.
column29:
The XBee Recycling Unit is designed with user-centric functionality and powerful features:

Automated Waste Processing: A compact, integrated module that efficiently shreds and prepares plastic waste for extrusion.

Precision Filament Extrusion: A microcontroller-governed extrusion system that melts processed plastic and produces a consistent, high-quality 1.75mm 3D printer filament, ensuring reliability for printing.

IoT-Enabled Monitoring: The system is IoT-enabled, allowing for remote monitoring of the unit's performance, tracking the amount of plastic recycled, and managing operational efficiency via a simple digital interface.

Seamless Digital Creation: Our recycled filament is compatible with all standard 3D printers and CAD software, allowing users to seamlessly move from digital design to physical creation.
column30: Technology is the cornerstone of our solution, applied to ensure quality, efficiency, and accessibility. We utilize IoT (Internet of Things) to provide smart monitoring and data collection, allowing users to track their environmental impact and optimize the unit's performance. A microcontroller precisely regulates the extrusion process—controlling temperature and speed—to guarantee the production of a standardized, high-quality filament crucial for successful 3D printing. Finally, by leveraging widely available CAD software and 3D printing technology, our system empowers users to apply this recycled material in countless practical applications, from creating educational models and household goods to prototyping new inventions and generating income.

column27: The Automated Medication Management and Assistive Unit (AMMAU) is a modular smart dispenser designed to help elderly patients manage complex medication schedules. It features guided setup through a touchscreen and provides both on-screen and voice prompts for scheduled doses. Using IR sensors, it detects when a hand approaches a slot, announces the medication and dosage, and, after a simple Yes/No confirmation, logs intake and updates inventory. Caregivers receive real-time alerts for low stock. For insulin users, an embedded ML module predicts basal doses based on fasting glucose and body weight, offering a cross-check against the physician’s plan to flag unusual deviations. This ensures timely dosing, reduces errors, maintains accurate records, and eases the burden on families and caregivers.
column28: Most solutions separate tasks: pill dispensers manage medications while apps handle insulin calculations. AMMAU brings both together, integrating multi-medication dispensing with AI-driven basal insulin guidance in a single device and interface. Each insulin dose is paired with simple health inputs, such as fasting glucose and weight, providing safer, context-aware prompts now and valuable trend tracking over time. Designed for real homes and low-resource settings, it combines a touch interface, IR sensing, voice alerts, caregiver notifications, and offline-first functionality, ensuring reliable dosing even without internet access. A key differentiator is its power resilience: a 9V DC primary supply with automatic failover to a 10,000 mAh internal battery and a low-power mode that extends runtime during outages. The insulin prediction model, trained on a 9,672-record clinically validated dataset, achieves an R² of ~0.96 and runs fully on-device for fast, private recommendations. One unit. One seamless workflow.
column29:
●	Modular capacity: The unit can be built with 4 to 20 slots in a compact 46 × 37 × 6.5 cm box that is small enough for a bedside table, big enough for a full regimen.
●	Simple setup on touch screen: Use Set Box to name each slot and enter the starting quantity. Use Set Schedule to add medicine names, doses, and times. The system groups meds taken at the same time, so nothing is missed.
●	Reminders: At the right time, the screen shows exactly what to take, and the speaker reads it out. If a dose is missed, caregivers get a notification. The device asks, “Taken?”. A quick Yes/No confirms the dose.
●	Automatic adherence log: Every confirmed and missed dose is time-stamped and saved. You can export reports for a doctor visit or share with family.
●	Live inventory tracking: The system counts pills as you go and sends early low-stock alerts so you can refill before you run out.
●	AI help for insulin (basal): Enter fasting glucose (mg/dL or mmol/L) and body weight (kg). The on-device model suggests a basal insulin dose (units) and flags unusual differences from your usual plan so you can double-check with your doctor.
●	Made for elders: Large text, high contrast, and Bangla/English on both screen and voice prompts keep it accessible.
●	Clear roles and records: Separate patient and caregiver profiles, complete with timestamps and an audit trail for accountability.
●	Built-in safety: Optional lockout windows can prevent accidental extra doses. Each slot has tamper detection.
●	Connected, but works offline: You get email/app alerts when connected. If the internet goes down, core dosing still works.
●	Power: Normally runs on 9 V DC. During a power cut, it automatically switches to the 10,000 mAh internal battery and enters low-power mode (dimmed screen, batched alerts) to stretch runtime.
column30:
●	Hardware: Runs a Linux system on Raspberry Pi 4, with a 7” touchscreen, IR sensors on every slot, and a speaker for clear prompts, inside a compact, wipe-clean tabletop enclosure.
●	Software: The Django app handles the UI, schedules, logs, and inventory. A separate Flask service runs the ML model. Data lives in a local database, and caregiver notifications are sent securely.
●	AI module: Basal-insulin prediction was tested with KNN, MLR, and LightGBM. Models were trained on a 9,672-record, medically benchmarked synthetic dataset. The top model achieved R² ≥ 0.96 with low MAE and runs on-device with guardrails and human-in-the-loop checks.
●	Reliability engineering: Debounced sensor reads prevent false triggers. Structured med/dose records, startup self-tests, and a watchdog with safe defaults help the system recover from glitches. If the network is down, the notifications queue is sent later.
●	Data & safety: Time-stamped adherence logs, configurable thresholds, and exportable reports support clinician review.
●	Power architecture: Power-path management switches to the 10,000 mAh internal battery in <10 ms. The 9 V input is protected (reverse/over-voltage) and smart-charged.
●	Battery optimization: On battery, a low-power governor, adaptive backlight, sensor duty-cycling, and batched/quieter audio extend runtime. Coulomb counting reports state of charge/health with on-screen runtime estimates.

column27: QRARG Eye Motion Tracker revolutionizes communication for paralyzed and Locked-In Syndrome patients with the AI powered eye movement tracking system. Unlike the utilization of expensive specialized hardware worth more than $6,000, the product runs on standard Android devices. Custom machine learning technologies and MediaPipe framework detect the movements of the eyes. This enables the patients to communicate by simply looking at the screen and blinking for confirmation. It is revolutionary because it uses numerical data instead of image data to train the model. Patients can convey simple needs, emotions and profound thoughts through easy eye movements with 100ms response time and 99.9% accuracy. The technology combines real-time pupil tracking, gaze estimation and emotion detection on a one-stop communication platform. By using consumer devices that are already available, we've reduced costs by 80-90%. This innovation revolutionizes lives by empowering patients globally who were not able to afford assistive communication technology before.
column28: Our innovation is special because it eliminates the necessity for any specialized hardware at all. While other systems require expensive infrared cameras, head-mounted gear, and complex calibration processes that run $6,000+, we have improved performance using simple device cameras. The seconds-long automatic calibration replaces hours-long manual setup and installation and it does not require technical knowledge. Our use of numerical data addresses heterogeneous populations as different ethnicities has different eye shapes which could not be addressed without an extremely large dataset if image was used to train the model. Again the system is very light weight for the same reason.
column29:
Core Communication Features:
●	Real-time eye tracking with 100ms response time
●	Screen pointing with 99.9% accuracy
●	Blink-based interpretation of commands for action realization and confirmation of selection
●	Multi-language support to provide availability in populations with varied languages

Advanced Features:
●	Emotion recognition and analysis providing caregivers with a sense of patient well-being
●	24/7 real-time monitoring
●	Personalizable interface for being customized to the unique needs and preferences of a single patient

Technical Implementation:
1.	MediaPipe framework for enabling robust pupil detection even in varied lighting conditions
2.	Custom machine learning models optimized for gaze prediction accuracy using numerical dataset
3.	OpenCV computer vision processing for precise interpretation of eye movement

Healthcare Integration:
1.	Caregiver patient monitoring dashboard with complete caregiver communications history
2.	Medical system compatibility for seamless integration with hospital infrastructure
3.	Analytics and reporting tools aiding healthcare workers in tracking patient recovery
column30:
The system delivers clinical grade accuracy with 99.9% reliability in screen pointing functions, meeting the high demands of healthcare solutions. A response time of 100ms ensures real-time interaction comparable to natural communication rates.
Technical Excellence: The architecture combines proven frameworks like OpenCV and MediaPipe with custom machine learning software designed specifically for faster and accurate results. Our in house models excel at predicting gaze under different conditions such as lighting, patient head positions, and physical capabilities of patients.

Medical Applications: The technology improves basic needs for communication and emotional analysis. The technology seamlessly integrates with existing hospital systems, enabling workflow adoption without disrupting ongoing care processes.

Quality Assurance: Comprehensive testing processes offer security in high-stakes health care settings. The system functions consistently across various patient populations and varying physical states. Quality factors include response time consistency, accuracy and successful emergency alert features.
Future-Ready Architecture:
Scalable architecture supports continuous improvement via machine learning updates and expanding feature sets. Future advancements encompass keyboard typing modes, sophisticated predictive features and deeper health care system integration.

• ⁠Department: Urban and Regional Planning

Team observer and advisor:
Niaz Mahmud Zafri
PhD Student , Department of Urban Studies and Planning, MIT
Assistant professor, URP, BUET

Our team consists of multidisciplinary background team members from EEE and Urban Planning with domain expertise in traffic engineering and urban planning, with strong technical capacity in AI, machine learning, and real-time traffic data analysis. Supported by simulation management expertise and user-friendly design skills, we bridge policy, technology, and city dynamics to create a practical, scalable solution tailored for urban challenges.
column27: Our Park2Go is an AI-driven smart parking platform built to simplify urban journeys. It helps to find the safest, nearest legal parking spot based on the destination. Park2Go app will integrate between drivers and unused parking spaces. It will have real-time slot matching, with traffic congestion, weather, location, and hourly-based dynamic pricing. Digital map integration with the geological information system and real-time traffic prediction will regulate and minimize traffic congestion. With AI-powered parking assistant, users will have the best decision-making advice. The variations and comparisons between different parking spaces will help to make perfect preferences. With real-time slot matching, user-friendly AI assistance, and vehicle security, Park2Go makes parking faster, safer, and smarter—right when and where it is needed.
column28:
Park2Go is different because it shows real-time availability using CCTV feeds processed on the device (edge AI), not guesses or user check-ins. 

It also uses a dynamic pricing model led by live traffic flow rate and surrounding land use characteristics: prices go higher in crowded areas or peak times to move some drivers to nearby streets or later times, and lower in underused areas to pull drivers away from congested zones. Short stays near busy spots are encouraged to keep fast turnover, and prices can adjust before big events to spread demand. 

This guides where and when people choose to park, which reduces circling, cuts illegal parking, and eases congestion.The platform connects drivers and space owners so unused private or commercial spots can be rented easily—an end-to-end approach that makes parking faster, safer, and smarter for the city.
column29:
Features:

* Real-time nearby slot matching
* CCTV based vacancy detection
* Congestion led multi factor dynamic pricing model
* Comparison of slots by cost, distance, security
* AI assistant guidance
* Space-owner rental platform
* Automatic pricing, booking, payments


Park2Go delivers end-to-end smart parking for drivers and space owners. The app instantly shows nearby legal and safe parking spots, matched in real time with the user’s destination, traffic congestion, and weather conditions. A multi-factor dynamic pricing model (traffic congestion,demand, duration, time of day, events, history) automatically sets fair rates—while comparisons across available slots help users choose by cost, distance, and security.

Edge-based computer vision from CCTV feeds confirms whether a slot is occupied, keeping availability data accurate. An AI assistant offers quick, context-aware guidance to help drivers avoid stress and wasted time. Digital maps with live traffic rerouting guide drivers smoothly to their selected spot.

For space owners, Park2Go provides a digital platform to list and rent unused parking. The platform handles pricing automatically, manages bookings and secure payments, and provides transparent reporting. The result is faster, safer parking with reduced road congestion and improved urban mobility.
column30:
Map Integration & Routing
The system uses OpenStreetMap for base maps and Nominatim for geocoding. Live
congestion is tracked through Mapbox Traffic API (with alternative providers configurable).
Routing and travel time estimation are powered by OpenRouteService, while spatial
queries run on PostgreSQL with PostGIS for proximity search and zone-based processing.
Dynamic Pricing Engine
At the core is a high-performance service built on Python FastAPI with
PostgreSQL/PostGIS. It ingests live traffic, parking supply–demand ratios, and time-of-day
patterns to compute dynamic prices. Redis accelerates frequent lookups, while Celery
manages scheduled recalculations. For demand forecasting, LightGBM is used, with
scalability toward PyTorch as historical data grows.
Mobile Application
Drivers interact through a Flutter app deployed to Android and iOS. Maps are rendered with
Mapbox SDK, and real-time updates arrive via WebSockets, showing instantly which slots
are free and what they cost.
AI-Powered Assistant
An in-app assistant built on Rasa (self-hosted) helps with bookings, FAQs, and support.
Hugging Face transformer models enable sentiment detection in Bengali and English,
allowing the chatbot to respond empathetically and guide users smoothly.
Computer Vision for Vacancy Detection
Where CCTV infrastructure is available, video streams are processed on edge devices
running YOLOv8 through OpenCV + ONNX Runtime. Deployed on NVIDIA Jetson, these
detect occupancy locally and feed results directly into the availability API—providing
accurate, automated updates without burdening networks.
Payments & Security
The app integrates with bKash and Nagad via SSLCOMMERZ, alongside support for
international cards. Authentication uses Firebase Auth with phone/OAuth logins. Security
features include JWT authorization, TLS encryption, and AES-256 for sensitive data
storage.
Cloud Infrastructure & Monitoring
Services are containerized with Docker and deployed on Google Cloud Run for
auto-scaling. Databases run on Cloud SQL (Postgres), while static assets are stored in
Google Cloud Storage with CDN distribution. Monitoring and analytics rely on Firebase
Analytics, Metabase dashboards, and Google Cloud Monitoring for performance and
reliabilit

column25:
Team Name:
Team CARE 

Nature of the Team:
A student-based innovation team consisting of 5 members from Notre Dame College, Adamjee Cantonment College and Saint Joseph Higher Secondary School,Dhaka.

Focus Area:
Our team primarily works on designing and developing innovative solutions that merge robotics, IoT, and AI to address real-world challenges. Over the past few years, we have explored multiple domains of robotics and automation, aiming to create impactful projects for education, healthcare, and community service. Our major focus areas include:

1.Assistive Robotics & Healthcare Technology: Smart wheelchairs, IoT-based health monitoring, and AI-driven accessibility solutions for differently-abled and elderly individuals.

2.Human–Machine Interaction: Gesture control, voice interfaces, and intelligent automation to make technology more intuitive and inclusive.

3.IoT & Smart Systems: Integrating sensors, data monitoring, and connected devices for healthcare, home automation, and community safety.

4.Educational & Experimental Robotics: Developing prototypes and robotics projects that inspire learning, innovation, and future research opportunities.

Vision:
Our team aim is to become a leading student-driven innovation team in Bangladesh that creates affordable, practical, and socially impactful robotics and IoT solutions. We aim to transform assistive technology and healthcare support systems through creativity, research, and engineering excellence;making technology more inclusive, accessible, and human-centered.

Previous Participation & Achievements:

1.District Champion at 45th National Science and Technology Week, 2025
2.Special 3rd position in 45th National Science and Technolgy Fest, 2025
3.Champion at 16th DRMC National Science Carnival 2025
4.Champion at Technovation 2025

column27:
The CARE Wheelchair is an innovative, student-developed assistive mobility solution that integrates robotics, IoT, and AI to improve the lives of differently-abled and elderly individuals. Traditional wheelchairs often lack accessibility, independence, and real-time safety features, which limit users’ mobility and quality of life. Our project addresses these challenges by combining multiple advanced technologies into one affordable and practical system.

The wheelchair can be controlled through gesture recognition (head and hand movements), voice commands via an offline AI assistant (Orion)-ensuring flexible control for users with varying physical abilities. To enhance safety, it is equipped with obstacle detection sensors and an emergency alert system that can automatically send SMS notifications to caregivers during critical situations.

In addition, the system integrates IoT-based health monitoring, including vital signs such as heart rate, blood pressure, and temperature. This data is transmitted to a mobile application in real time, allowing caregivers and family members to remotely track the user’s health. The wheelchair also supports home automation functions, enabling users to control lights, fans, and other devices directly from their wheelchair, thus promoting independence in daily activities.
By combining robotics, AI, and IoT in a single platform, this solution not only enhances mobility but also ensures safety, healthcare monitoring, and inclusive accessibility. Our vision is to scale this prototype into a cost-effective product that can serve thousands of physically challenged individuals across Bangladesh and beyond.
column28: Our CARE Wheelchair stands out due to its multi-modal control and intelligent integration. Unlike conventional wheelchairs, it combines hand and head gesture control with an offline AI-based voice assistant, allowing users to navigate independently without reliance on external devices. Additionally, it features IoT-based health monitoring, home automation integration, and safety enhancements such as obstacle detection and emergency alert systems. The design emphasizes user convenience, accessibility, and adaptability, making it suitable for a wide range of mobility challenges. This combination of technologies in a single, low-cost platform makes CARE Wheelchair a unique, innovative solution in assistive mobility devices.
column29:
1. Advanced Head Gesture Control 
CARE Wheelchair prioritizes head gesture control for seamless mobility, making it accessible even for users with very limited hand movement:

Head Tilts and Nods: Movements of the head are translated into directional commands—forward, backward, left, and right—allowing intuitive, hands-free navigation.

Hand Gesture and Voice Support: Hand gestures and voice commands via Orion serve as optional controls for added flexibility.

2. Orion: Personalized AI Companion

Emotional Support: Orion acts as a human-like companion, engaging in conversations and keeping the patient socially connected.

Alleviating Loneliness: By interacting naturally, Orion helps the patient feel accompanied, reducing feelings of isolation and enhancing mental well-being.

Task Assistance: Orion reminds the user of daily routines, appointments, and safety measures, combining companionship with practical support.

Adaptive Interaction: Learns user habits, moods, and preferences, providing a personalized experience that grows smarter over time.

3. Health Monitoring and Safety

Heart rate and temperature monitoring for real-time health tracking.

Emergency Alert System: Orion can alert caregivers in case of unusual readings or incidents.

Manual and Voice-Controlled Stop: Immediate stop functionality via button or voice command ensures safety.

4. Home Automation Integration
Through the wheelchair,patient can seamlessly interact with smart home devices:

Control lights, fans, appliances, and doors with simple voice commands.

Trigger customized home routines for daily convenience.

5. User-Centric and Reliable Design

Ergonomic Seating: Comfortable for prolonged use.

Compact and Modular Frame: Easy maintenance and upgrades.

Offline Functionality: All features, including Orion, operate without internet, ensuring uninterrupted service.

Summary:
CARE Wheelchair is a next-generation mobility solution that emphasizes head gesture control for primary navigation and integrates Orion, a human-like AI companion to reduce loneliness and enhance mental well-being. By combining advanced mobility, health monitoring, smart home integration, and social companionship, it provides a holistic, user-centered approach to independent living.
column30:
1. Quality
The CARE Wheelchair demonstrates precision, reliability, and user-focused design on a small scale:

Responsive Control: Head gesture navigation works smoothly, accurately translating user movements into wheelchair motion.

Ergonomic and Compact Design: The prototype is built for demonstration purposes, yet emphasizes comfort and ease of use.

Demonstrated Reliability: All features, including gesture control and Orion AI assistant, have been tested and shown to function effectively in the small-scale model.

Offline Operation: Orion and all control systems work without internet, showing consistent performance even in prototype form.

2. Application of Technology
The prototype integrates advanced technologies in a miniature, functional model:

Head and Hand Gesture Recognition: Sensors detect subtle movements and convert them into accurate directional commands.

Orion AI Assistant: Provides navigation guidance, companionship, and interaction with smart home devices, demonstrating how the system can reduce loneliness.

Health Monitoring (Prototype Scale): Heart rate and temperature sensors provide real-time readings, showing potential for full-scale health monitoring.

Home Automation Interaction: Demonstrated ability to control appliances and devices through Orion, illustrating smart home integration.

Adaptive Intelligence: Even in the small prototype, Orion responds to commands and adapts to simple user preferences.

Summary:
The CARE Wheelchair prototype successfully demonstrates the core functionalities—head gesture control, multi-modal navigation, AI companionship, health monitoring, and smart home integration—in a small, working model. While compact, it proves the feasibility and effectiveness of the technology, showing potential for scaling into a fully functional assistive device that addresses both mobility and emotional support for users.

column25:
MediRide is a startup initiative developed by students of Rajshahi University of Engineering & Technology (RUET). The venture was conceived with the objective of addressing critical challenges in the healthcare transportation sector.

The platform is designed to provide both emergency and non-emergency medical transportation services, ensuring that patients can access timely and reliable rides to hospitals or healthcare facilities. By leveraging technology, MediRide aims to minimize delays often associated with traditional ambulance services, particularly in areas where such services are limited or inefficient.

This innovative solution reflects the entrepreneurial spirit and problem-solving mindset of RUET students. It also highlights the growing role of student-led startups in tackling pressing societal issues and contributing to the broader startup ecosystem in Bangladesh.
column26:
The MediRide team is composed of five committed members, all pursuing their studies in the Department of Industrial and Production Engineering at Rajshahi University of Engineering & Technology (RUET).

Talha Jubayer serves as the Chief Executive Officer (CEO). He is currently in his third year, even semester.

Maisha Fariha Mithila, also in her third year even semester, holds the role of Manager.

Hasin Abrar Shoumik, a second-year even semester student, is the Chief Operating Officer (COO).

Arnab Acharjee, studying in the same semester, serves as the Chief Technology Officer (CTO).

Samia Bourni, also a second-year even semester student, is the Head of Research and Development (R&D).
column27: MediRide functions as a technology-driven healthcare transportation network that bridges the gap between patients in need and available ambulances. When a user requests a ride, the system automatically identifies the closest ambulance within the network and assigns it to the patient, ensuring the fastest possible response. Both patients and drivers are equipped with dedicated mobile applications that streamline communication, navigation, and payment processes. The platform manages everything from ride allocation and route optimization to cost calculation and feedback collection, creating a seamless end-to-end service. In addition, MediRide integrates with a web interface for administrative control, enabling continuous monitoring, data management, and service improvement.
column28:
MediRide distinguishes itself by addressing the critical gaps in conventional ambulance services through a seamless, technology-driven platform. At its core, the service ensures real-time tracking, allowing patients and families to monitor ambulance location and arrival with full transparency. This directly eliminates the uncertainty and delays often experienced in emergencies.

Unlike traditional systems where there are no structured pickup points and drivers often exploit situations with unfair pricing, MediRide introduces one-click SOS emergency requests, fair and transparent fare calculation, and secure online payment options. This creates trust and reliability in moments of urgency.

The platform also delivers a dual benefit: for patients, it guarantees availability, safety, and efficiency, while for drivers, it simplifies navigation, ensures automatic payments, and offers a rating system that builds accountability.

Beyond emergency transport, MediRide extends its uniqueness with community awareness services, post-emergency follow-up, and event coverage, making it not just an ambulance-hailing app but a comprehensive healthcare mobility solution available anytime, anywhere
column29:
MediRide is designed as a comprehensive digital platform that connects patients with ambulances quickly and reliably. Its functionality ensures smooth coordination between patients, drivers, and the overall system, while its features enhance both emergency response and user experience.

Core Functionalities:

Instant Ambulance Allocation – Automatically assigns the nearest available ambulance to the patient’s request.

Dual Mobile Applications – Separate apps for patients and drivers, ensuring seamless communication and efficient ride management.

Web Interface – Centralized control for administration, monitoring, and service improvement.

Integrated Payment System – Supports secure online and card payments, automatic fare calculation, and instant settlements.

Navigation & Tracking – Enables real-time location sharing and optimized route guidance.

Key Features:

Real-Time Tracking – Patients can monitor the ambulance’s movement live.

One-Click SOS Emergency Request – Immediate dispatch in critical situations.

24/7 Availability – Reliable access to ambulance services anytime, anywhere.

Fair & Transparent Pricing – Eliminates overcharging and ensures trust.

Language Accessibility – Makes the platform usable for a wider population.

Rating & Review System – Builds accountability and service quality among drivers.

Community Awareness Service – Promotes healthcare awareness in society.

Post-Emergency Follow-Up – Ensures continuity of patient support.

Event Coverage Service – Provides on-site medical readiness for gatherings.

Together, these functionalities and features make MediRide not just an ambulance-hailing solution, but a complete healthcare mobility ecosystem
column30:
MediRide leverages modern technology to ensure speed, reliability, and transparency in emergency healthcare transportation. The platform integrates a dual mobile application system—one for patients and one for drivers—supported by a web-based interface for centralized management and monitoring.

The use of real-time GPS tracking guarantees precise ambulance location updates and optimized routing, significantly reducing response times. An automated SOS system enables instant emergency alerts, while digital payment integration ensures secure transactions with fair and transparent pricing.

MediRide also incorporates data-driven insights for service improvement, including performance ratings, usage statistics, and feedback analysis. Features like language accessibility and 24/7 availability make the platform inclusive and dependable across diverse user groups.

By combining user-friendly design, robust backend systems, and continuous technological updates, MediRide ensures not only the quality of service delivery but also the scalability and adaptability of the solution in addressing healthcare mobility challenges nationwide

column7: Cross Categories - Start- Up of the Year (CC-SU)
column8: Technology - AI Technology of the Year (CT-AI)
column25:
AquiVira is a sustainable water-tech startup dedicated to solving Bangladesh’s unsafe drinking water crisis through plastic-free, energy-free, clay-based water purifiers. We combine natural filtration materials—such as biosand, activated carbon, granite, alumina, and chitosan—with innovative design to deliver safe, clean, and affordable drinking water without harming the environment.
Our mission is to provide healthy, plastic-free, and eco-friendly drinking water solutions to households, schools, clinics, and rural communities, ensuring that every drop of water is safe for both people and the planet.
column26: AquiVira is led by a passionate and multidisciplinary team, anchored by Ashraf Islam Ashfaq, Co-Founder & CEO, who serves as the face and driving force of the company. Ashraf provides overall vision, business strategy, and leadership, building partnerships and guiding AquiVira’s journey from idea to execution. Alongside him, Most. Mobassara Jannat, Founder & COO, ensures operational excellence, managing supply chains and coordinating day-to-day execution to turn strategy into action. The technical leadership is carried forward by Md. Tauhidul Islam Chowdhury, CTO, specializing in web development and system integration to support AquiVira’s digital infrastructure, and Meherin Zarin Oranti, CTO (Materials), who applies her expertise in ceramic and filtration system design to develop sustainable product technology. The company’s market presence is driven by Mohammad Sarfaraz Hussain, CMO, who brings expertise in digital marketing and brand strategy to expand AquiVira’s reach, while Deepro Ruhul Wahab and Farhan Muntasir Haider contribute technical integration and engineering support. Together, this dynamic team combines vision, innovation, and execution, but it is Ashraf’s leadership and presence that embody the company’s mission to revolutionize safe and sustainable drinking water in Bangladesh.
column27: AquiVira is Bangladesh’s first 100% plastic-free, clay-based water purifier that delivers safe, affordable, and sustainable drinking water without electricity. Using natural filtration materials like biosand, activated carbon, granite, alumina, and chitosan, it removes up to 80% of heavy metals and 90% of microbes while ensuring 2–3x longer cartridge life than conventional filters. With zero plastic housing, no microplastic leaching, and eco-cartridges that can be repurposed as fertilizer, AquiVira provides not just clean water but a truly circular, eco-friendly solution for households, schools, and communities.
column28: AquiVira is unique because it is the first water purifier in Bangladesh that is completely plastic-free, electricity-free, and truly sustainable. Unlike conventional filters that rely on plastic housing and short-lived cartridges, AquiVira’s eco-cartridges last 2–3 times longer, eliminate microplastic risks, and even turn into fertilizer after use—making it a solution that protects health, reduces cost, and benefits the environment at the same time.
column29: AquiVira purifies water through a completely natural and sustainable process. Its 100% plastic-free housing ensures there is no BPA or microplastic leaching, while the gravity-based, energy-free design makes it both eco-friendly and cost-saving. The purifier uses advanced natural materials such as biosand, activated carbon, alumina, granite, and chitosan to remove up to 80% of heavy metals and 90% of microbes, delivering safe and healthy drinking water. Each biodegradable eco-cartridge lasts two to three times longer than conventional filters, reducing recurring expenses, and after use, the byproducts can be repurposed as fertilizer, making the system truly circular. Designed with modern aesthetics, AquiVira not only safeguards health but also enhances the beauty of households, offering a complete blend of functionality, sustainability, and elegance.
column30: AquiVira ensures the highest quality in water purification by combining traditional clay craftsmanship with advanced material science. The purifier integrates natural filtration media such as biosand, activated carbon, granite, alumina, and chitosan, which together achieve up to 80% removal of heavy metals and 90% removal of microbes. Its eco-cartridge technology extends lifespan by 2–3 times compared to conventional filters, ensuring cost-effectiveness and reliability for households. The plastic-free housing eliminates the risk of BPA and microplastic contamination, while the gravity-based design removes the need for electricity, making it both accessible and sustainable. By merging locally available natural resources with innovative engineering, AquiVira applies technology not only to deliver safe drinking water but also to minimize environmental impact and create a circular, eco-friendly system that turns waste into fertilizer.

column27: CoastalConnect IoT is a smart telecom solution bringing reliable internet to Bangladesh’s coastal communities, like Khulna, even during floods or cyclones. Solar-powered 4G stations and Wi-Fi routers keep villages connected, while IoT sensors watch for storms to switch networks seamlessly. A user-friendly Bangla app lets farmers check crop prices, families access telehealth, and communities stay online with affordable data plans through bKash. Starting with a low-cost pilot in Khulna using existing telecom towers and solar tech, it grows easily to support millions, empowering coastal life with resilience.
column28: CoastalConnect IoT stands out as a pioneering telecommunications solution uniquely tailored for Bangladesh’s coastal communities, blending solar-powered 4G stations, IoT-driven mesh Wi-Fi, and a Bangla mobile app to deliver resilient connectivity during floods and cyclones while enhancing daily life through farming and telehealth access. Unlike traditional telecom systems, it uses low-cost IoT sensors to predict and adapt to climate disruptions, ensuring uninterrupted internet in vulnerable areas. Its solar-powered mesh network is a novel approach, providing backup connectivity where conventional networks fail. The app’s offline capabilities and voice-driven interface in Bangla make it uniquely inclusive for low-literacy users, while seamless bKash integration offers affordable data plans, empowering coastal farmers and families. Built on Bangladesh’s existing 60,000 4G towers and 20 million solar users, its scalable, cost-effective design sets it apart as a transformative, climate-resilient solution
column29:
Functionality:
CoastalConnect IoT provides reliable internet to Bangladesh’s coastal communities, ensuring connectivity during floods and cyclones while supporting daily activities like farming and telehealth. It uses solar-powered 4G micro base stations and Wi-Fi mesh routers to maintain network access, with IoT sensors monitoring weather and signal conditions to prevent outages. A Bangla mobile app offers affordable data plans via bKash, offline farming and health tips, and real-time alerts, designed for low-literacy users in areas like Khulna.
Features:
Solar-Powered 4G Stations: 20 compact stations (360,000 BDT each) with solar panels (24,000 BDT) ensure connectivity during power outages, covering 5km per station.
Wi-Fi Mesh Network: 200 low-cost routers (3,600 BDT each) create a 2km-range backup Wi-Fi network, activated during disruptions.
IoT Sensors: Five sensors per station (18,000 BDT total): two water level (2,400 BDT each), two wind speed (6,000 BDT each), one temperature (1,200 BDT), enabling real-time storm detection.
Edge Processing: Raspberry Pi (6,000 BDT) processes sensor data locally for fast, low-bandwidth decisions in patchy networks.
Bangla Mobile App: User-friendly app with signal maps, 36 BDT/500MB data plans, offline content (farming/health), and voice-based feedback for 30% low-literacy users.
bKash Integration: Seamless payments for affordable data, leveraging 50M users.
Blockchain Logging: Hyperledger Indy ensures transparent network uptime records for operators and regulators.
Offline Mode: 50MB cache for critical content, ensuring access without internet.
SMS Alerts: Bangla alerts for outages, crop prices, and health tips, reaching 90% of mobile users.
This IoT-driven system aligns with Digital Bangladesh, delivering resilient, inclusive connectivity.
column30:
Application of Technology:
Disaster Resilience: IoT sensors detect flood/cyclone risks, switching to mesh Wi-Fi to keep 200,000 users connected, saving 2,400M BDT in losses yearly.
Agricultural Productivity: Provides stable 4G for farmers to access market prices and weather tips via the app, boosting yields by 10% (6,000M BDT/year) for 50,000 farmers.
Telehealth Access: Ensures reliable connectivity for video consultations, connecting 100,000 patients and saving 1,200M BDT in travel costs.
Daily Connectivity: Supports SMEs with affordable data, enhancing economic activity in coastal areas with limited 5G (200 sites in 2025).
Inclusivity: Voice-driven app in Bangla reaches low-literacy users, aligning with Digital Bangladesh and NDX goals for universal access.
This high-quality, practical technology suite drives resilient, inclusive connectivity.

column7: Cross Categories - R & D Project of the Year (CC-RD)
column8: Technology - AI Technology of the Year (CT-AI)
column25: Student Project
column26:
Member 1: Sajid Shahriar Islam (RUET)
Member 2: Mahjabin Mahi Prapty (Varendra University)
Member 3: Arman Hossain (UIU)
column27:
In many rural areas, farmers still rely on traditional methods passed down through generations. They often cannot read or write, and many do not own smartphones. When pests spread, soil becomes weak, or sudden weather changes occur, they have no reliable way of knowing what action to take. A single wrong decision can destroy their entire harvest, leaving families in debt and communities struggling with food shortages.
AgriSense was born to solve this problem. It is a low-cost system that uses small sensors placed in the farmland to track soil moisture, pH, temperature, crop health and other data. This information is sent to a server without internet, where AI analyzes the data and generates simple, practical advice. It suggests both natural remedies and professional solutions considering all the factors for the farmland and crops.  Farmers then receive SMS messages or automated phone calls in their local language telling them what to do—whether it’s to irrigate, add nutrients, or prepare for heavy rain. It also has web-app support for a more detailed dashboard and features in case someone needs to use it. 
But AgriSense goes further. Farmers without smartphones can call a number and speak directly with an AI assistant in their local language, asking about crop problems and receiving instant solutions. The system also integrates weather forecasts and market prices, so farmers not only protect their crops but also know the best time to sell them.
Beyond individual support, AgriSense enables farmer-to-farmer knowledge sharing. A farmer can record their problem by voice, which the system translates and shares with experts or other farmers who have faced similar issues. Meanwhile, policymakers and NGOs can monitor the dashboard, gaining real-time insights into pest outbreaks, drought-prone zones, or communities needing urgent help. Also they get realtime market price update to be protected from low price. Also they can sell their project. All available by calling.
With AgriSense, farmers no longer have to farm in the dark. They get timely guidance, their yields increase, losses decrease, and rural communities grow stronger. By bridging modern technology with local culture, this project gives every farmer—whether literate or not—the power to farm smarter, feed more people, and secure a better future.
column28: AgriSense is unique because it makes modern agricultural intelligence accessible without requiring internet, literacy, or smartphones. Unlike most smart farming systems that target large commercial farms, AgriSense is designed for rural smallholder farmers with minimal resources. It combines low-cost IoT sensors, AI analysis, and voice/SMS delivery in local languages, ensuring even illiterate farmers can receive and act on scientific advice. Its farmer-to-farmer voice knowledge sharing and policy dashboard also create a full ecosystem where individuals, communities, and governments all benefit together.
column29:
IoT Sensors: Soil moisture, pH, temperature, crop health monitoring.

AI-Powered Analysis: Converts raw data into simple, practical recommendations.

Offline Data Transfer: Works without internet; server collects and processes locally.

Multi-Channel Guidance: Farmers receive advice via SMS, automated calls, or live voice assistant in their local language.

Weather & Market Integration: Forecast alerts and real-time market price updates.

Farmer Knowledge Sharing: Farmers record problems by voice; the system translates and connects them to experts or peers.

Dashboard for Policymakers/NGOs: Real-time insights into pest outbreaks, drought-prone areas, and community needs.
column30:
AgriSense applies a hybrid of IoT, AI, and telecommunication technologies in an innovative way:

IoT ensures accurate field data collection.

AI transforms data into actionable, context-aware advice tailored for each crop and condition.

Telecom Integration (SMS & IVR) breaks the literacy and smartphone barrier, delivering guidance to every farmer.

Scalable Architecture allows future integration with satellite imagery, advanced analytics, and e-commerce platforms.


The result is a robust, low-cost, and highly inclusive solution that bridges modern technology with rural cultural realities, ensuring maximum adoption and long-term impact.

column7: Cross Categories - Start- Up of the Year (CC-SU)
column25:
Company Name: Healthlink

About Us:
Healthlink is a B2B digital platform dedicated to transforming procurement in Bangladesh’s healthcare sector. We connect hospitals and clinics with verified medical equipment suppliers, enabling them to compare products, access transparent pricing, and communicate directly through integrated chat.

Our Unique Value:
Suppliers can create online stores to showcase their products, while hospitals gain a one-stop platform to source equipment efficiently. To add more value, we also feature a Tender Hub, where suppliers can access the latest healthcare-related tender notices, helping them explore more opportunities.

Mission:
To simplify healthcare procurement by reducing costs, improving transparency, and empowering both hospitals and suppliers with smarter digital tools.

Vision:
A Bangladesh where healthcare procurement is transparent, affordable, and accessible—benefiting both suppliers and hospitals, and ultimately improving patient care.

Current Focus:

Healthcare B2B procurement

Supplier online stores with product listings

Tender Hub for centralized tender information

Real-time chat for seamless supplier–hospital communication

Future Expansion:
Extend the platform beyond healthcare to organize and digitize the broader B2B ecosystem in Bangladesh.
column27: Healthlink is a B2B platform that connects hospitals with verified medical equipment suppliers, enabling transparent product comparison, tender access, and direct communication. By reducing middlemen and costs, it makes healthcare procurement faster, simpler, and more affordable.
column28: First dedicated B2B platform for healthcare procurement in Bangladesh. Combines verified supplier stores, a Tender Hub for opportunities, and integrated chat for direct negotiation—features not offered together by any existing platform.
column29: Supplier online stores with product listings, centralized Tender Hub for new opportunities, real-time chat for negotiation, product comparison with transparent pricing, and PDF tender access
column30: Built on a secure web platform using Firebase for authentication, database, and storage. Ensures real-time updates, reliable PDF tender access, and seamless chat, providing a transparent and efficient procurement experience.

column27: TrueMedic is a secure healthcare verification platform designed to combat medical fraud in Bangladesh by ensuring only licensed professionals provide care. The app empowers patients to verify doctor credentials instantly through BMDC integration, promoting trust, transparency, and safety in healthcare. Doctors can create verified profiles, upload credentials, and manage appointments, while patients can search for practitioners, check authenticity, leave reviews, and book consultations. Administrators oversee verification, user management, and platform analytics, ensuring a reliable ecosystem. By bridging the gap between patients and authentic doctors, TrueMedic strengthens credibility, prevents fraud, and enhances confidence in the healthcare system.
column28: The uniqueness of TrueMedic lies in its direct integration with the BMDC database to validate doctor credentials in real time, something that is not commonly available in healthcare apps in Bangladesh. Unlike generic doctor directories or appointment platforms, TrueMedic’s core value is fraud prevention—ensuring patients interact only with verified, licensed practitioners. It combines doctor verification, patient trust-building, and healthcare transparency into one system, offering features like smart search with instant validation, cached results for faster performance, and secure verification via CAPTCHA. Additionally, its three-tiered approach—for doctors, patients, and administrators—creates a holistic ecosystem that not only safeguards patient safety but also enhances doctor credibility and ensures accountability in the healthcare sector, setting it apart from traditional appointment or review-based medical apps.
column29:
Functionality
•	Doctor Verification System: Validates doctors’ BMDC registration numbers directly with the BMDC database to prevent fraud.
•	Profile Management: Doctors can register, upload documents, and manage their professional profiles.
•	Search & Verification: Patients can search doctors by BMDC number or name and instantly check authenticity.
•	Appointment System: Patients can book appointments with verified doctors.
•	Review & Rating: Patients can leave feedback and ratings to ensure quality healthcare experiences.
•	Admin Oversight: Administrators handle verification approvals, monitor activities, and manage users.

Features
For Doctors
•	Secure sign-up with BMDC validation
•	Profile setup with credentials and certificates

•	Dashboard to manage patients and appointments
•	Real-time verification status tracking
For Patients

•	Instant doctor credential verification
•	Review and rating system with proof uploads

Smart Search

•	Cached search results for faster repeat lookups

For Administrators

•	Analytics dashboard with usage insights

column30:

Secure Infrastructure: Built on Supabase for authentication, database, and scalable backend services.

column27: Knee joint rehabilitation is crucial for patients with mobility loss after paralysis or stroke, but traditional therapy risks secondary injury from uncontrolled reflexes and uneven muscle loading, and is often too costly for most patients to afford. The solution a robot-assisted knee-joint rehabilitation system that establishes correlation between impedance data and limb motions to solve this problem. The knee joint impedances are estimated based on the internal feedback of the system dynamics, that lead to design the torque compensator to improve the overall control signals in real time. The system is made to assist patients recover safely and effectively by adjusting to their motions in real time, allowing for controlled and smooth motion while avoiding secondary injuries, enabling accurate, smooth, and safe rehabilitation. Additionally, the system is cost-effective built using locally available components at a cost of less than 30,000 TK, ensuring affordability, ease of repair, and accessibility for Bangladeshi hospitals and even home-based care.
column28: The system focuses on a 1DoF system dedicated only to the knee joint that incorporates body-index-based inertia modeling, allowing the therapy to be personalized for each patient’s characteristics, a novel torque parallel-compensator integrates real-time feedback from limb dynamics, ensuring smooth and adaptive rehabilitation movements. Moreover, the system comprises of three-compensator control strategy (position, velocity, and torque) working in parallel for smooth switching between motion and hold phases also consisting impedance-based adaptation that reacts to patient involuntary limb actions in real time, avoiding sudden jerks. Additionally, the robotic arm has had high precision with low errors (±0.14° in motion, ±0.02° in hold; velocity error within ±0.17 rad/s), when tested on human subjects. It offers an appropriate replacement for heavy and costly exoskeletons, opening up advanced robotic rehabilitation for broader clinical and domestic use.
column29:
•	1-DoF robotic arm for knee joint RoM (0°–25° extension)
•	Adaptive impedance estimation (stiffness, damping, inertia) via internal feedback
•	PID parallel-compensator for torque, position, and velocity control
•	Real time reflex response compensation to prevent secondary injury
•	Body-index-based inertia modeling for personalized therapy
•	Switching control (position in hold phase, velocity in motion phase)
•	Real-time torque and trajectory monitoring with low tracking error
•	Arduino Mega microcontroller-based embedded system
•	Portable design with shank holder and safety mechanisms
column30:
•	Control Architecture: PID parallel-compensator designed with Ziegler-Nichols methods; real-time torque correction via impedance feedback.
•	Modeling: Knee joint dynamics captured as mass-spring-damper system; leg inertia computed using body height/weight indices.
•	Sensing & Actuation: DC motor with torque sensor, encoder, and potentiometer ensures accurate motion feedback.
•	Hardware: 1-DoF robotic arm with DC motor (SPG S8D40-24A S8KA10B1), torque sensor (KMS-40), rotary encoder, potentiometer, pulleys, and shank holder on a compact seated platform; Arduino Mega microcontroller for real-time control.
•	Software: Embedded firmware implementing PID compensators with switching logic; real-time impedance estimation through Least Square Estimation (LSE); trajectory generator and safety watchdogs.
•	Modeling: Knee joint dynamics represented as torsional mass-spring-damper; body-index-based inertia modeling for personalized adaptation; dynamic leg parameters fed into control loop.
•	Performance: Experimental trials showed ±0.02° error during hold phase and ±0.14° during motion phase, with torque matching theoretical predictions.
•	Application: Provides safe, repeatable, and personalized therapy for paraplegic/monoplegic patients, reducing clinician workload and enabling home-based rehabilitation.
•	Reliability: Reflex-response disturbances compensated by torque parallel-compensator; low position/velocity tracking errors (±0.14° and ±0.17 rad/s); startup self-tests and saturation model for safe torque limits.
•	Data & safety: Continuous torque, stiffness, and damping estimation; logs of joint responses for clinical analysis; safe shutdown and compliance under unexpected reflex or voluntary motion.
•	Implementation: Control program embedded on low-cost microcontroller; portable tabletop setup with lightweight mechanical arm; experimental validation with human subjects demonstrated clinical viability.

column27: QRARG Eye Motion Tracker revolutionizes communication for paralyzed and Locked-In Syndrome patients with the AI powered eye movement tracking system. Unlike the utilization of expensive specialized hardware worth more than $6,000, the product runs on standard Android devices. Custom machine learning technologies and MediaPipe framework detect the movements of the eyes. This enables the patients to communicate by simply looking at the screen and blinking for confirmation. It is revolutionary because it uses numerical data instead of image data to train the model. Patients can convey simple needs, emotions and profound thoughts through easy eye movements with 100ms response time and 99.9% accuracy. The technology combines real-time pupil tracking, gaze estimation and emotion detection on a one-stop communication platform. By using consumer devices that are already available, we've reduced costs by 80-90%. This innovation revolutionizes lives by empowering patients globally who were not able to afford assistive communication technology before.
column28: Our innovation is special because it eliminates the necessity for any specialized hardware at all. While other systems require expensive infrared cameras, head-mounted gear, and complex calibration processes that run $6,000+, we have improved performance using simple device cameras. The seconds-long automatic calibration replaces hours-long manual setup and installation and it does not require technical knowledge. Our use of numerical data addresses heterogeneous populations as different ethnicities have different eye shapes which could not be addressed without an extremely large dataset if image was used to train the model. Again the system is very light weight for the same reason.
column29:
Core Communication Features:
1. Real-time eye tracking with 100ms response time
2. Screen pointing with 99.9% accuracy
3. Blink-based interpretation of commands for action realization and confirmation of selection
4. Multi-language support to provide availability in populations with varied languages

Advanced Features:
1. Emotion recognition and analysis providing caregivers with a sense of patient well-being
2. 24/7 real-time monitoring
3. Personalizable interface for being customized to the unique needs and preferences of a single patient

Technical Implementation:
1. MediaPipe framework for enabling robust pupil detection even in varied lighting conditions
2. Custom machine learning models optimized for gaze prediction accuracy using numerical dataset
3. OpenCV computer vision processing for precise interpretation of eye movement

Healthcare Integration:
1. Caregiver patient monitoring dashboard with complete history
2. Analytics and reporting tools aiding healthcare workers in tracking patient recovery
column30:
The system delivers clinical grade accuracy with 99.9% reliability in screen pointing functions, meeting the high demands of healthcare solutions. A response time of 100ms ensures real-time interaction comparable to natural communication rates.

Technical Excellence
The architecture combines proven frameworks like OpenCV and MediaPipe with custom machine learning software designed specifically for faster and accurate results. Our in house models excel at predicting gaze under different conditions such as lighting, patient head positions, and physical capabilities of patients.

Medical Applications
The technology improves basic needs for communication and emotional analysis. The technology seamlessly integrates with existing hospital systems, enabling workflow adoption without disrupting ongoing care processes.

Quality Assurance
Comprehensive testing processes offer security in high-stakes health care settings. The system functions consistently across various patient populations and varying physical states. Quality factors include response time consistency, accuracy and successful emergency alert features.

Future Ready Architecture
Scalable architecture supports continuous improvement via machine learning updates and expanding feature sets. Future advancements encompass keyboard typing modes, sophisticated predictive features and deeper health care system integration.

Roots of Rise is a dynamic, youth-led non-profit organization founded and driven by passionate young changemakers in Bangladesh. Established with the vision of empowering communities through education, social welfare, and environmental sustainability, the organization embodies the spirit of youth leadership, innovation, and social responsibility.

Our Core Focus Areas

Education – Providing access to learning opportunities, mentorship, and resources for underprivileged students to break cycles of inequality.

Social Welfare – Engaging in community-driven initiatives to uplift marginalized groups and promote equity and inclusion.

Environmental Sustainability – Advocating for eco-friendly practices, organizing clean-up campaigns, tree plantation drives, and climate action projects inspired by Dr. Muhammad Yunus’s Three Zero Theory (Zero Poverty, Zero Unemployment, Zero Net Carbon Emissions).

Why Youth-Led?
Roots of Rise is powered by young volunteers, students, and emerging leaders who believe in shaping a sustainable and equitable future. As a youth-led organization, we:

Prioritize innovative, locally grounded solutions to global challenges.

Create platforms for young voices to influence policy, advocacy, and action.

Nurture the next generation of socially responsible leaders.

Achievements & Engagements

Mobilized volunteers for education and sustainability projects.

Conducted awareness campaigns on climate change and community development.

Engaged in collaborations with local and international youth networks, NGOs, and competitions to scale impact.

Vision
To create a generation of young changemakers who lead with purpose, foster resilience in communities, and contribute to a sustainable and equitable world.

Mission
Harnessing the power of youth to build sustainable solutions in education, social welfare, and climate action—planting the roots for a brighter tomorrow.

Motto
"Empowering Youth, Transforming Communities, Sustaining the Future."
