column26:
Abrar Fairuj Raiyan - CSE'24, CUET
Hasan Md Arik - CSE'24, CUET
column27:
Silicon Bengal is Bangladesh’s first initiative to build a vertically integrated electronics manufacturing ecosystem. We begin by designing and producing Arduino-like microcomputers and commonly used electronic modules in Bangladesh, thus lowering costs, reducing import dependency, and ensuring faster access for students, startups, and industries.

Our roadmap extends beyond board design and assembly: in later phases, Silicon Bengal will move toward fabricating raw electronic components locally, creating a truly homegrown supply chain. This approach supports industrial self-reliance, creates high-skilled jobs, and accelerates the country’s transition from an electronics importer to a technology producer and exporter.

By making microcontrollers, modules, and eventually core components within Bangladesh, Silicon Bengal empowers makers, innovators, and industries, strengthens our industrial base, and positions Bangladesh as a regional leader in affordable, high-quality electronics manufacturing.
column28: Silicon Bengal is the first initiative in Bangladesh to establish a complete electronics manufacturing pipeline: starting from microcontroller boards and modules to raw electronic components. Unlike current import-dependent solutions, it focuses on local R&D, localized production, and a phased approach to vertical integration, ensuring affordable, high-quality products tailored to Bangladesh’s market and beyond.
column29:
Locally designed and manufactured Arduino-style microcomputers and modules.

Interoperable with global standards (Arduino/Raspberry Pi ecosystem).

Scalable production with modular assembly lines to expand product categories.

Affordable pricing to make electronics accessible for students, startups, and industries.

Technical support and documentation in Bangla and English to promote widespread adoption.

Eco-friendly manufacturing practices (where possible, lead-free soldering, reduced e-waste).
column30:
Design & tooling: We will use modern EDA tools for board design and DFx (design for manufacturability) principles from day one.

Prototyping & pilot: We plan to validate designs through prototype runs and functional test rigs before scaling. Initial assembly will leverage local EMS/contract partners while building in-house capabilities over time.

Manufacturing tech (planned): Initially PCB fabrication and eventually SMT assembly workflows, with automated testing (functional test jigs and AOI where affordable) to ensure consistent performance.

Firmware & Dev Toolchain: For microcomputers, we will provide firmware-ready boards with example code and debugging support to lower the barrier for adopters.

Quality assurance & compliance: target industry-standard QA processes and plan for certification/compliance (RoHS, safety/EMC checks) as products mature.

Roadmap to vertical integration: a staged plan to localize key supply elements (components, subassemblies) based on feasibility studies, supplier development, and investments.

column26:
I am Abid Hasan Mahin; Founder & CEO
Abdullah Rahi; Chief Technology Officer
Mahir Iffat; Chief Marketing Officer
column27: Our solution is the early disease detection kit, which detects any kind of disease early using a pre-set DNA marker of the disease and is connected with AI for 100% accuracy. It's working like a diabetes kit, but it's a more advanced kit than a diabetes kit. Cancer, heart disease, HIV & other deadly diseases are detected early within 2 minutes. You don't need to go to the hospital; you can check at home
column28:
Our kit highlights what differentiates it from existing solutions and how it provides value in terms of innovation, accuracy, usability, and impact. The uniqueness can be analyzed across several dimensions:
1. Technological Innovation:
Uses previously unexplored or highly specific biomarkers (for example, microRNA and circulating tumor DNA) for earlier and more accurate detection.
Multi-Disease Screening: Capable of detecting multiple diseases with a single sample
Integration with AI/ML: Employs advanced algorithms to improve diagnostic accuracy and predict disease risk, or  false positives/negatives.
Detects diseases before symptoms appear or at the molecular stage rather than anatomical/clinical stages.
High Accuracy: Reduces diagnostic errors through better detection limits and precision analysis.
At-home Testing: Allows individuals to test themselves easily and privately.
Low-cost and Scalable: Affordable for large-scale screening programs in low-resource settings.
column29:
Sample Collection & Processing: Collects biological samples (blood, saliva, urine, or breath) quickly.
Biomarker Detection: Identifies disease-specific biomarkers like proteins, DNA/RNA fragments, or metabolites.
Early Diagnosis: Detects diseases at their earliest molecular stages before symptoms appear.
Risk Prediction & Monitoring: Predicts the disease progression and enables continuous health monitoring.
Real-time Data Analysis: Processes test results on the spot or via connected devices for instant decision-making.
Integration with Healthcare Systems: Sends results to doctors or health platforms for professional analysis and recommendations and is also connected with a nearby blood bank during emergency situations.
column30:
Core Technology:
1. Artificial Intelligence (AI) & Machine Learning (ML): 
Pattern Recognition: Detects disease patterns from complex biological data like genomics or imaging.
Risk Prediction Models: Predicts future disease risk based on user history and lifestyle factors.
Automated Analysis: Reduces human error and speeds up the diagnostic process.
Personalized Diagnosis: Provides recommendations tailored to the individual’s health profile.
2. Internet of Things (IoT) & Cloud Computing:
Connected Devices: Wearable sensors continuously monitor biomarkers and send data to healthcare providers.
Real-time Alerts: IoT-based kits can notify patients and doctors instantly if diseases are detected.
Cloud Integration: Securely stores and shares test results for telemedicine consultations and big data analytics.
3. Biosensor Technology:
Nanotechnology: Nanoparticles enhance sensitivity, allowing detection of biomarkers at the molecular level.

column27: Synthora is a breakthrough platform that transforms the way we interact with video. Instead of passively watching hours of footage, Synthora allows users to search inside videos with precision. Whether it’s scanning a mango farm from drone footage to detect diseased trees, or combing through days of CCTV footage to find a single vehicle, Synthora makes the invisible instantly visible. By turning video streams into searchable data, it saves time, reduces cost, and empowers decision-making across industries like agriculture, security, retail, and infrastructure.
column28: Unlike conventional video analytics, Synthora is not limited to pre-set rules or generic object detection. It is powered by custom-trained machine learning models that can adapt to specialized needs—such as identifying a very specific insect infestation in a farm, or distinguishing a rare vehicle type in crowded city streets. This flexibility, combined with a Google-like search experience for video, makes Synthora stand apart. It doesn’t just watch videos; it understands them.
column29:
Searchable Video Streams – Find exactly what you’re looking for, instantly, without manual review.
Domain-Specific AI Models – Tailored for agriculture, security, industrial inspections, and beyond.
Real-Time & Historical Analysis – Works both on live video feeds and archived footage.
Scalable Deployment – From drones to CCTV networks, Synthora handles varied video sources seamlessly.
Actionable Insights – Generates reports, visual highlights, and heatmaps for rapid decision-making.
column30: Synthora leverages the latest in computer vision, deep learning, and edge AI deployment. Our custom neural networks are trained on domain-specific datasets, ensuring unmatched accuracy. The platform is built for scalability and reliability, capable of handling high-volume video streams without performance loss. By combining cloud-based processing with on-device intelligence, Synthora delivers both speed and security, ensuring that businesses can rely on it for mission-critical operations.

column10: E-Vo: A secure Digital voting application for Bangladesh
column25: Not have a company
column26:
One man one team.
1) Aminul Islam
column27:
E-Vo: AI-Powered Digital Voting App
E-Vo is a next-generation voting platform designed to bring transparency security, and convenience to the democratic process. Powered by advanced AI technology, the app allows citizens to cast their votes digitally using their NID verification and fingerprint authentication, ensuring each vote is secure, unique, and tamper-proof.

With real-time monitoring, fraud detection, and encrypted data storage, E-Vo guarantees fairness and accuracy while making voting more accessible than ever before. Whether on mobile or other devices, E-Vo empowers people to participate in elections safely, quickly, and confidently.
column28:
It supports the Digital Bangladesh and Smart Bangladesh vision.

Increases voter turnout by making the process more accessible and efficient.

Reduces electoral expenses by minimizing reliance on paper ballots and manual counting.

Enhances public trust by ensuring transparency and reducing opportunities for manipulation.
column29:
Key Features of E-Vo:

1. Voter Verification: Integration with NID database and fingerprint/biometric authentication.


2. Data Security: End-to-end encryption and blockchain-inspired architecture to ensure vote integrity.


3. Transparency: Real-time, tamper-proof vote counting and reporting dashboard for Election Commission officials.


4. Accessibility: Mobile and web-based interfaces allowing citizens, especially those in remote areas, to cast votes securely.


5. Scalability: Can be piloted in smaller elections (student councils, union parishads, or municipal polls) before nationwide implementation.
column30:
Application of E-Vo (Electronic Voting)

1. Modernizing Democratic Processes
E-Vo serves as a digital bridge between citizens and governance by replacing traditional paper-based voting with a secure, fully automated electronic platform. It streamlines every stage of an election—voter registration, identity verification, ballot casting, and results tabulation—into a seamless, real-time digital workflow. This modernization dramatically reduces the time and cost of organizing elections and minimizes human error.

2. Accessibility and Inclusion
A core application of E-Vo is to ensure that every eligible citizen can vote with ease, regardless of location or physical ability. Remote or absentee voters, citizens living abroad, persons with disabilities, and those in rural areas can securely cast their ballots through internet-enabled devices or designated electronic kiosks. This fosters a more inclusive democracy by reducing logistical barriers to participation.

3. Enhanced Security and Trust
E-Vo systems leverage advanced technologies such as end-to-end encryption, multi-factor authentication, and—where appropriate—blockchain-based audit trails. These safeguards ensure vote integrity, prevent tampering, and create a transparent record that can be independently verified. The application of cryptographic verification not only secures each individual ballot but also strengthens public confidence in the electoral outcome.

4. Real-Time Data and Rapid Results
Unlike manual vote counting, E-Vo provides instant, accurate tallies. Election commissions and observers can monitor live participation metrics and preliminary results with robust analytics dashboards. This accelerates the announcement of outcomes, reduces disputes, and allows governments to transition swiftly to post-election processes.

5. Cost Efficiency and Environmental Impact
By digitizing ballots and reducing the need for printing, transportation, and large physical polling stations, E-Vo significantly cuts the financial and environmental costs of elections. Fewer paper ballots mean less waste, and automated counting minimizes the need for large human teams and extended counting periods.

6. Policy and Governance Applications
Beyond national or regional elections, E-Vo can be applied in corporate shareholder voting, university student government elections, professional association ballots, and local civic decision-making such as participatory budgeting or community referendums. Its adaptability makes it a versatile tool for any decision-making process that requires secure, large-scale consensus.

7. Crisis-Resilient Voting
During pandemics, natural disasters, or other emergencies, E-Vo ensures that democratic participation remains uninterrupted. Its ability to support remote and contactless voting protects both public health and the continuity of governance.

column10: AI-Powered Smart Industrial Water & Sustainability Intelligence Platform
column14: 1st Floor, House 139, Road 22, Mohakhali DOHS, Dhaka.
column25:
Company Overview

Smart Build is a Dhaka-based climate-tech and smart-infrastructure innovator focused on sustainable urban and industrial transformation. Our 40-member multidisciplinary team—experts in AI, IoT, civil engineering, and environmental science—designs solutions that merge advanced technology with real-world sustainability needs.

Since 2024, Smart Build has represented Bangladesh on global stages such as the Smart Cities Challenge (Fira Barcelona) and the UN High-Level South–South Cooperation Forum, demonstrating leadership in next-generation infrastructure, clean-tech, and ESG-driven industrial automation.

Flagship Solution

AI-Powered Smart Industrial Water & Sustainability Intelligence Platform
(featuring the AI-Enabled Smart ETP Data Module)

This platform transforms industrial water management by integrating artificial intelligence, IoT sensors, and predictive analytics to deliver real-time compliance, automated ESG reporting, and water-reuse optimization.

Key Capabilities:

Real-Time Monitoring & Prediction
• Continuous measurement of COD, BOD, TDS, pH, and flow via AI-enabled sensors.
• Predictive alerts to prevent environmental breaches.

Smart ETP Optimization
• AI algorithms recommend chemical dosing and flow adjustments to cut costs and improve treatment efficiency.

Automated ESG & Regulatory Reporting
• One-click generation of compliance reports aligned with SDG 6 (Clean Water), SDG 12 (Responsible Consumption), and SDG 13 (Climate Action).

Advanced Water Reuse
• Pathways from aquaculture-grade to drinkable-grade water, supporting circular-economy goals.

Innovation & IP

Proprietary AI Models developed and trained in Bangladesh by Smart Build’s data-science team.

IoT Sensor Integration designed for local industrial environments (high humidity, variable pH).

51% of R&D, design, and software engineering completed in Dhaka, ensuring full eligibility for national and international ICT awards.

Market & Impact

Target Sectors: Ready-Made Garments (RMG), textiles, leather, food & beverage, and other water-intensive industries.

Pilot Success: Early deployment with leading RMG groups shows up to 20% chemical cost savings and 30% improvement in compliance reporting speed.

Scalability: SaaS subscription model for industrial clients and white-label options for development partners enable regional expansion across South Asia and the Middle East.

Why It Matters

Bangladesh is among the world’s most water-stressed manufacturing hubs. International buyers increasingly demand verified ESG data from suppliers.
Smart Build’s platform delivers a nationally built, globally scalable answer—turning regulatory compliance into a competitive advantage while protecting vital water resources.
column26:
Team Overview

Smart Build is a Bangladesh-based climate-tech and smart infrastructure company driving next-generation solutions for sustainable industrial operations. Our AI-Powered Industrial Water & Sustainability Intelligence Platform is designed to help water-intensive industries—especially the RMG and textile sectors—achieve real-time environmental compliance, predictive water treatment, and automated ESG reporting.

The team brings together AI, IoT, software engineering, civil/environmental engineering, and urban sustainability expertise to ensure that the platform delivers measurable impact in energy efficiency, water reuse, and decarbonization.
column27:
The AI-Powered Smart Industrial Water & Sustainability Intelligence Platform is a next-generation climate-tech solution designed to help industries achieve real-time environmental compliance, cost efficiency, and ESG transparency. Built and developed in Bangladesh by Smart Build, this platform integrates artificial intelligence, Internet of Things (IoT) sensors, and predictive analytics to transform industrial water management from reactive treatment to data-driven, proactive decision-making.

Targeting water-intensive sectors such as Ready-Made Garments (RMG), textiles, leather, and food processing, the platform provides live monitoring of Effluent Treatment Plants (ETPs), automates regulatory reporting, and optimizes chemical dosing—significantly reducing costs, freshwater intake, and carbon footprint.
column28:
The AI-Powered Smart Industrial Water & Sustainability Intelligence Platform stands apart as a first-of-its-kind Bangladeshi innovation that transforms industrial water management from basic monitoring into predictive, ESG-driven intelligence. Its uniqueness lies in four key dimensions:

1️⃣ End-to-End ESG & Compliance Intelligence

Unlike conventional water-treatment software or standalone IoT sensors, the platform provides a single, AI-driven control tower for:

Real-time ETP (Effluent Treatment Plant) compliance with automated alerts.

Predictive analytics that forecast chemical dosing, discharge risks, and cost impacts before a violation occurs.

Automated ESG reporting aligned with global buyer and UN SDG requirements.

Result: Industries move from reactive reporting to proactive compliance and transparency—critical for export-oriented sectors like RMG and textiles.

2️⃣ Bangladesh-First, Globally Scalable

100% locally developed AI models, data pipelines, and IoT architecture, meeting the APICTA requirement of 51% R&D in Bangladesh.

Addresses national challenges—water scarcity, industrial pollution, and buyer compliance—while offering a cloud-ready SaaS model adaptable to other emerging markets.

Result: Positions Bangladesh as an exporter of high-impact climate-tech, not just a user.

3️⃣ Multi-Layered Innovation

AI + IoT Convergence: Proprietary algorithms integrate sensor data, satellite inputs, and historical plant performance for high-accuracy predictions.

Advanced Water Reuse Pathways: Enables grading from aquaculture-grade to potable-grade water reuse, unlocking circular-economy value.

Dynamic Optimization: Continuous learning reduces chemical cost, energy usage, and freshwater intake.

Result: Cuts operational cost while exceeding environmental benchmarks.

4️⃣ Proven Market Traction

Pilot with leading RMG manufacturer shows measurable ROI:
Reduced chemical cost, improved buyer compliance, and faster regulatory reporting.

Backed by Smart Build’s multidisciplinary team (AI, IoT, civil engineering, sustainability) ensuring rapid commercialization.

Result: Not just a concept—already delivering impact and ready to scale.
column29:
Functionality & Features

1. Real-Time Compliance Monitoring

Tracks all critical water parameters (pH, DO, COD, BOD, TSS, TDS, Temperature) across multiple industrial facilities.

Displays live dashboards for management, ETP operators, and sustainability teams.

Provides automated alerts when any parameter exceeds regulatory limits.

2. Predictive & Prescriptive AI Analytics

Predictive Analytics: Anticipates next-day or next-shift compliance risks for industrial water treatment.

Prescriptive Recommendations: Suggests optimal chemical dosing, aeration rates, and flow adjustments to minimize costs while ensuring compliance.

Scenario Modeling: Simulates advanced water reuse pathways such as aquaculture-grade and drinkable-grade water.

3. Operational & Process Optimization

Tracks COD/BOD/TSS removal efficiency, treatment volumes, and operational stability.

Identifies performance deviations with a Stability Index for early detection of inefficiencies.

Benchmarks plant performance across multiple sites to identify best practices.

4. Financial & Resource Management

Monitors chemical consumption per plant and per m³ treated.

Provides cost-per-m³ dashboards integrating chemicals, energy, and sludge management costs.

Recommends cost-saving strategies using AI-driven insights.

5. ESG & Sustainability Reporting

Generates buyer-ready ESG reports aligned with ZDHC, Higg FEM, LEED, and UN SDG 6, 12, and 13.

Tracks impact KPIs such as total water treated, COD/BOD removed, and year-on-year improvement.

Supports transparency for regulators, investors, and sustainability auditors.

6. Multi-Stakeholder Platform

Tailored dashboards for management, ETP operators, sustainability teams, and regulators.

Centralized data-driven control plane for multi-facility industrial groups.

Exportable reports in PDF/CSV for audits and board-level review.

7. Future-Ready Design

Modular and scalable architecture to support future expansions in smart industrial water, energy, and waste management.

Integrates with IoT sensors, SCADA systems, and industrial automation tools.

Ready for national and regional deployment, enabling Bangladesh’s RMG and industrial sectors to lead in sustainable water management.
column30:
The AI-Powered Smart Industrial Water & Sustainability Intelligence Platform, featuring the AI-Enabled Smart ETP Data Platform, represents a state-of-the-art solution for industrial water management, ESG compliance, and sustainability monitoring. It leverages cutting-edge Artificial Intelligence (AI), Internet of Things (IoT), and advanced data analytics to deliver actionable insights, operational efficiency, and measurable environmental impact.

Key Features & Technological Quality:

Real-Time Monitoring & Compliance:

Integrates IoT-enabled sensors with AI-driven analytics to continuously monitor water quality parameters such as COD, BOD, TSS, pH, DO, and TDS.

Provides automated compliance dashboards aligned with regulatory standards (DoE) and global ESG frameworks (ZDHC, Higg FEM, LEED, UN SDG 6).

AI models anticipate compliance breaches and operational inefficiencies before they occur.

Prescriptive recommendations optimize chemical dosing, aeration rates, and flow management, reducing operational costs and environmental impact.

Scenario Modeling for Advanced Water Reuse:

Simulates aquaculture-grade and drinkable-grade water pathways to support strategic decision-making and corporate sustainability initiatives.

Facilitates long-term planning for water reuse, resource efficiency, and ESG reporting.

Scalability & Multi-Facility Integration:

Unified platform dashboards support multiple industrial facilities, allowing benchmarking and comparative analytics.

Modular architecture enables expansion to additional sectors and geographies.

ESG & Sustainability Reporting:

Auto-generates evidence-ready reports for regulators, buyers, and stakeholders.

Supports transparent, data-driven corporate sustainability practices and strengthens ESG credibility.

Application in Industrial Sectors:

Designed primarily for RMG (Ready-Made Garments), textiles, leather, and water-intensive industries, the platform enables industries to:

Ensure regulatory compliance and avoid penalties.

Reduce chemical usage and operational costs.

Demonstrate measurable ESG impact to buyers, investors, and global stakeholders.

Technological Significance:

Combines AI, IoT, and advanced data analytics in a first-of-its-kind industrial water intelligence platform in Bangladesh.

Enables digital transformation of environmental management within industrial operations.

Provides a replicable and scalable model for industrial sustainability across South Asia and emerging markets.

Impact:

Optimizes water treatment performance and reduces environmental pollution.

Enhances operational efficiency, cost-effectiveness, and sustainability leadership.

Positions Bangladesh as a regional leader in AI-enabled industrial ESG solutions.

column25:
🌐 About ICT Olympiad Bangladesh

ICT Olympiad Bangladesh is the nation’s largest ICT talent discovery and development platform, designed to inspire and empower the next generation of digital leaders. It unites students, teachers, institutions, and industry partners in a nationwide movement to create a future-ready ICT ecosystem.


---

🎯 Our Mission

To bridge the gap between education and industry, equipping students with practical ICT skills, mentorship, and opportunities to thrive in the digital age and drive Bangladesh’s transformation into a knowledge-based economy.


---

🏆 What We Do

Nationwide ICT Competition: Multi-stage contest (Selection → District → Division → Quarterfinal → Semifinal → Grand Gala) for students from schools, colleges, and universities across 64 districts.

Skill Development: Practical learning in coding, robotics, cybersecurity, AI/ML, IoT, and digital creativity through structured courses, workshops, and mentorship.

Ambassador & Teacher Programs: 3,000+ campus ambassadors and 1,000+ trained teachers work together to promote ICT education.

Diversity & Inclusion: Glory Girls Tech Fest and rural outreach programs encourage female participation and bridge the urban–rural digital divide.



---

🚀 Future Plan

Reach 1 Million Students by 2028 through aggressive nationwide expansion.

Launch National EduTech Portal: Integrated platform for courses, mock tests, assignments, recorded classes, books, and AI-powered learning paths.

Create ICT Talent Pipeline: Connect students to scholarships, internships, and jobs in top ICT companies.

Introduce Global Competitions: Prepare students to participate in international Olympiads, hackathons, and innovation challenges.

Build Innovation Hubs: Regional innovation labs for robotics, AI, and IoT projects.



---

📊 Impact

🎓 On Bangladesh’s Education System

Drives 21st-century curriculum adoption (coding, robotics, digital literacy).

Creates a structured national platform for identifying and nurturing ICT talent.

Encourages teachers to upgrade their skills through dedicated training.


👩‍🎓 On a Student

Builds confidence, problem-solving ability, and teamwork skills.

Provides mentorship and career direction early in life.

Offers recognition, certificates, and exposure to industry experts.


💹 On the Economy

Produces job-ready graduates for Bangladesh’s ICT export sector.

Supports the Digital Bangladesh & Smart Bangladesh vision with a skilled workforce.

Attracts local and foreign investment by showcasing ICT talent.


🛠️ On বেকারত্ব (Unemployment)

Reduces unemployment by connecting students to internships, freelancing opportunities, and jobs.

Encourages entrepreneurship and startup culture, creating new job creators rather than job seekers.

Equips youth with skills for remote work and global gig economy participation.

column27:
📌 Solution Description of ICT Olympiad Bangladesh

🎯 Overview

ICT Olympiad Bangladesh is a nationwide technology education movement designed to bridge the gap between academic learning and industry skills. The program identifies, trains, and showcases the next generation of digital leaders through a series of competitive, engaging, and skill-oriented events. It is the first large-scale ICT talent pipeline initiative in Bangladesh, combining competitions, mentorship, workshops, and industry partnerships.


---

🧠 Core Problem We Solve

Skill Gap – Students graduate with theoretical knowledge but lack hands-on exposure to real-world ICT tools, coding, robotics, and AI.

Awareness Gap – Parents, teachers, and institutions often lack guidance about 21st-century tech careers.

Industry–Academia Disconnect – Companies struggle to find job-ready talent with the right mix of technical and soft skills.

Gender Participation Gap – Female students have fewer opportunities and encouragement to join the ICT ecosystem.



---

💡 Our Solution

ICT Olympiad Bangladesh provides an end-to-end ecosystem where students learn, compete, and get connected to opportunities:

1. National ICT Competition

Multi-stage contest (Selection → District → Division → Quarterfinal → Semifinal → National Gala)

Tracks: Coding, Robotics, Cybersecurity, Digital Creativity, AI/ML, and more.

Covers school, college, and university students nationwide.



2. Capacity Building

Campus Ambassador Program (3,000+ trained ambassadors)

Teacher & Mentor Development Program (specialized training on ICT tools)

Awareness campaigns for safe internet use and future tech skills.



3. Industry Partnership

Collaboration with 100+ ICT companies and 30+ ICT clubs

Internship & job placement opportunities for top participants

Knowledge partnerships with training institutes and universities.



4. Inclusion & Diversity

Glory Girls Initiative – Dedicated tech events for female students.

Accessibility programs for rural schools and underprivileged children.



5. Community Engagement

2M+ Social Media Engagements

32,000+ Participants, 2,000+ Campus Ambassadors, 1,000+ Teachers, 1,000+ Institutions

Nationwide media coverage and collaborations with leading news agencies.





---

🚀 Outcomes & Impact

Talent Discovery: Identifying thousands of future programmers, innovators, and entrepreneurs.

Practical Skills: Teaching coding, robotics, and digital safety at an early stage.

Career Pathways: Direct exposure to ICT companies, mentors, and internship pipelines.

National Branding: Positioning Bangladesh as a future-ready ICT nation.



---

🔑 Why It Works

Scalable Framework: A nationwide multi-round competition model.

Collaborative Network: Industry, academia, and government participation.

Proven Success: Season 1 completed with strong participation; Season 2 is scaling with even larger reach.

Sustainable Model: Supported by sponsorships, partnerships, and a growing volunteer network.
column28:
🌟 Uniqueness of ICT Olympiad Bangladesh

Nationwide Reach: Covers all 64 districts, engaging students from school to university.

Largest Talent Hunt: 32,000+ students, 2,000+ ambassadors, 1,000+ teachers & institutions.

Skill-Building Focus: Training, mentorship & workshops beyond competition.

Industry Link: 100+ ICT companies & 30+ ICT clubs connect students to jobs & internships.

Glory Girls Initiative: Special platform for female participation & inclusion.

Community Powered: 2M+ social media engagements & strong ambassador network.

Multi-Stage Competition: District → Division → Quarterfinal → Semifinal → Grand Gala.

Recognition & Motivation: National awards for students, mentors, and institutions.

Scalable Model: Goal to reach 1M+ students by 2028.

Holistic Ecosystem: Bridges students, teachers, institutions, industry & government.
column29:
⚙️ Functionality & Features of ICT Olympiad Bangladesh

🖥️ 1. Own Developed Edu Portal System

A fully integrated learning & competition platform with:

Student Dashboard: Personalized profile, progress tracker & leaderboard.

Courses & Classes: Interactive video lessons, live classes & recorded sessions.

Mock Tests & Round Tests: Practice quizzes, chapter-wise tests & real round simulation.

Assignments & Projects: Students can submit tasks online and get mentor feedback.

Resource Library: E-books, handouts, notes, coding examples & project templates.

Content Access: Safe and structured learning content (ICT, Robotics, AI, Cybersecurity).

Support System: Ticket-based helpdesk, chat support & FAQ section.

Gamification: Points, badges, ranking to motivate continuous participation.

Parental Access: Parents can monitor child’s progress and achievements.

Teacher Panel: Teachers can create tasks, track student performance & mentor them.

Institution Panel: Schools/colleges can register participants & view collective results.



---

🏆 2. Competition Management System

Registration & Payment: Easy online registration, MFS/Bank payment gateway integration.

Automated Round Management: Selection → District → Division → Quarterfinal → Semi-final → Gala.

AI-Based Evaluation: Automatic scoring for quizzes and coding tasks.

Result Publication: Real-time results & certificates downloadable from portal.

Merit List & Analytics: Institution-wise, district-wise, and national ranking dashboard.



---

🎓 3. Learning & Skill Development Ecosystem

Career-Oriented Tracks: Coding, Robotics, Cybersecurity, AI/ML, Digital Creativity, IoT.

Mentor Sessions: Weekly mentorship from industry experts & alumni.

Teacher Training: Specialized ICT skill development courses for teachers.

Recorded Masterclasses: National & international experts' sessions on demand.



---

🌐 4. Community & Engagement Features

Campus Ambassador Program: 3,000+ ambassadors across the country.

Discussion Forums: Peer-to-peer knowledge sharing and collaboration.

Events & Summits: CyberTech & Robotics Summit, Glory Girls Tech Fest, Mentor Awards.

Social Media Integration: Achievements, leaderboards, and event highlights shared online.



---

📊 5. Reporting & Analytics

Performance Insights: Student-wise, institution-wise & district-wise reports.

Progress Tracking: Weekly, monthly, and round-wise performance charts.

Feedback System: Rating for courses, teachers, and overall event experience.



---

🔒 6. Security & Reliability

Secure Login: OTP-based and email verification for all users.

Data Privacy: GDPR-compliant data storage & protection of student records.

Scalable Infrastructure: Cloud-based platform supporting thousands of concurrent users.



---

🏅 7. Recognition & Certification

Digital Certificates: Auto-generated for each round and participation.

Badges & Achievements: Visible on student profile & shareable on social media.

Scholarship Opportunities: For top performers & rural participants.

column27: My solution is a mobile based Sign Language Learning App designed to make Bengali Sign Language accessible to everyone. The app will provide interactive lessons, video tutorials, flashcards and quizzes to help users learn and practice sign language effectively. By combining ICT with inclusive education, the solution will aim to bridge the communication gap between the hearing impaired community and the wider society. It will empower students, teachers, healthcare workers, and service providers to learn essential signs and foster a more inclusive Bangladesh.
column28: Unlike existing language learning apps, my solution will locally focused on Bengali Sign Language only, which is often neglected in global platforms. It will offer offline access for low data users, gamified learning to keep students engaged and potential AI-powered gesture recognition for real yime practice feedback. By integrating both technology and cultural relevance, it will not only teach signs but will also promotes awareness and empathy for the hearing impaired community  which will be something unique and much needed in Bangladesh.
column29:
Video Library: Step by step tutorials for letters, numbers, words and everyday phrases of the app.

Interactive Flashcards and Quizzes: Fun practice tools to test learning progress.

Gamification: Points, badges and progress tracking to motivate users.

Voice to Sign Converter: Will convert spoken Bengali/English into sign animations.

Community Space: A safe platform for learners and hearing impaired users to connect and share experiences.

Offline Mode: Access key lessons without internet, making it suitable for rural areas.
column30: The app will be built using Flutter for cross platform support (Android and iOS) with Firebase/Firestore for secure authentication, user progress tracking and content management. Video lessons and sign resources will be lightweight for smooth use on lowcost devices. The modular design will allow future integration of AI gesture recognition and AR based interactive learning. This will ensure scalability, adaptability and long term sustainability. By leveraging accessible ICT tools, the solution can reach millions of users in Bangladesh and beyond, shaping an inclusive digital future.

column25: Founded with a mission to drive technological excellence and social impact, our organisation blends innovation with purpose. Based in Rajshahi, we specialise in engineering solutions that empower communities and elevate national capabilities.

column10: BlinkTalk enables paralyzed patients to communicate using simple eye blinks. The system converts blinks into speech and caregiver alerts through an affordable, accessible camera-based solution.
column25:
BlinkTalk is a healthcare technology startup founded by students of ZNRF University of Management Sciences. We are developing an affordable, accessible eye-blink based communication system that gives a voice to millions of paralyzed and disabled patients.

Our mission is to bridge the gap for communication by offering low-cost assistive technology, localized in Bangla, that can be easily adopted in hospitals, rehabilitation centers, and households. Unlike existing expensive solutions, BlinkTalk works with just a webcam, making it practical and scalable for South Asian markets.

The founding team consists of young innovators with expertise in Computer Science, IT Management, and Healthcare-focused software development. With experience in web and app development, product design, and management, our team is committed to bringing life-changing solutions to patients and caregivers.
Currently, we have developed a working prototype and are preparing for clinical testing and pilot programs with hospitals and NGOs. We aim to expand our solution across South Asia and beyond, improving the quality of life for millions of patients while reducing caregiver stress.

column27:
BlinkTalk is an innovative eye-blink based communication system designed for paralyzed and speech-impaired patients. Using only a simple webcam, the system detects eye blinks and converts them into speech and instant caregiver alerts. This affordable and accessible solution enables patients to express their basic needs, send emergency notifications, and communicate in Bangla or English without requiring expensive equipment.

Unlike existing tools that cost more than $5,000 and are inaccessible in developing countries, BlinkTalk is practical, scalable, and tailored for South Asian patients. It empowers users with independence, reduces caregiver stress, and significantly improves quality of life.
column28:
Affordable Solution – Existing eye-tracking devices cost $5,000+, but BlinkTalk is available for only ৳25,000 (~$227).
Bangla Language Support – Most global tools don’t support Bangla; BlinkTalk is localized for South Asian patients.
Webcam-Based System – Works with any standard webcam; no need for expensive special hardware.
Blink-Only Input – Fully paralyzed or locked-in patients can use it easily with just eye blinks.
Scalable & Practical – Can be used at home, hospitals, or rehabilitation centers without complex setup.
Caregiver Alerts – Sends instant emergency notifications, reducing caregiver stress.
column29:
Functionality
BlinkTalk uses a webcam to detect a patient’s eye blinks.
The system translates blinks into predefined commands (e.g., “water,” “help,” “yes/no”).
Commands are then converted into speech output and emergency caregiver alerts.
Works in Bangla and English, ensuring accessibility for local patients.

Features
Blink-to-Speech Conversion – Patients can communicate basic needs without speaking.
Emergency Alerts – Instant notifications sent to caregivers in critical situations.
Affordable Price – Only ৳25,000 (~$227), far cheaper than global alternatives.
Bangla Language Support – First localized communication tool for South Asian patients.
Easy Setup – Works with a regular webcam; no expensive hardware required.
Accessibility – Suitable for elderly and disabled patients with limited mobility.
Scalable Use – Can be used at home, hospitals, and rehabilitation centers.
Improved Quality of Life – Increases independence and reduces caregiver stress.
column30:
Quality of Technology
BlinkTalk uses AI-powered blink detection with a standard webcam, ensuring accurate and reliable communication.
The system is low-cost yet effective, designed for real-world use in developing countries.
Supports Bangla & English, making it culturally and linguistically accessible.
Prototype tested for stability and user-friendliness, with plans for clinical trials to ensure medical reliability.

Application of Technology
Hospitals & Rehabilitation Centers – For patients with paralysis, stroke, ALS, spinal injury, or cerebral palsy.
Home Care – Families can use it to support bedridden or speech-impaired patients.
NGOs & Disability Support Organizations – To reach underprivileged communities.
Elderly Care – Useful for aged patients who struggle to speak or move.
Emergency Situations – Provides instant caregiver alerts to save lives.

column10: Nirapotta.AI - An Integrated AI Platform for Flood & Cyclone Resilience in Bangladesh
column25: N/A
column26:
1. Md. Baker Hossen (IoT and Team Coordinator)
2. Robi Roy (AI, ML specialist)
3. Ananna Rayhan (frontend developer and Researcher)
4. Sanzida Tazin Arafa (DevOps)
5. Raziur Alam (GIS specialist and Graphics designer)
column27:
Project Nirapotta-AI is an end-to-end disaster management platform designed to save lives and enhance community resilience in the face of escalating climate threats in Bangladesh. The project's primary goal is to bridge the critical gaps in both pre-disaster warning and post-disaster response through a unified, AI-powered system.
The platform integrates two core components.
•	First, a Proactive Early Warning System (EWS) that fuses macro-level satellite data (from sources like NASA) with a novel network of low-cost, ground-based IoT sensors. Our AI model will process this data to generate hyper-local, real-time flood and storm surge predictions. Crucially, these warnings will be disseminated not via complex apps, but through accessible, low-tech channels like automated voice calls (IVR), SMS, and community-based sirens, ensuring they reach the most vulnerable populations.
•	Second, a Reactive Damage Assessment System that activates post-disaster. Using AI-driven computer vision to rapidly analyze satellite and real-time imagery, the system will automatically map the extent of damage to buildings, infrastructure, and agricultural lands.
This integrated approach provides disaster management authorities with a seamless "single pane of glass" view, from predictive risk mapping before a disaster to an actionable damage map for targeted response afterward. The purpose of Nirapotta.AI is to transform disaster management from a siloed, reactive process into a data-driven, proactive cycle of resilience, ultimately minimizing human suffering and economic loss.
column28:
Project Nirapotta.AI is a two-pronged, integrated solution built on a foundation of AI, IoT, and Earth Observation data.
Component 1: The Proactive Early Warning System (EWS)
Our strategy moves beyond generic regional forecasts to deliver actionable, hyper-local warnings.
a)	Three-Tier Data Fusion: The system's AI prediction engine will be fueled by three layers of data for unparalleled accuracy.
•	Macro-Level: Satellite data from NASA (GPM for precipitation) and ESA (Sentinel for soil moisture).
•	Meso-Level: National and regional meteorological forecasts from BMD.
•	Micro-Level (Our Key Innovation): Real-time ground-truth data from our custom-built, rugged IoT sensors placed in rivers, canals, and coastal estuaries. This data corrects biases in satellite models and captures localized phenomena that are otherwise missed.

b)	AI-Powered Prediction: A deep learning model (e.g., a Graph Neural Network) will analyze these fused data streams to generate dynamic risk maps, predicting not just if a flood will occur, but where, when, and at what likely depth.

c)	Inclusive Dissemination: The system's output is translated into simple, clear warnings and delivered via technologies that bridge the digital divide. An alert trigger automatically initiates SMS blasts, pre-recorded voice calls in Bengali to basic feature phones, and activates physical sirens in community centers.
Component 2: The Reactive Damage Assessment System
This component activates once a disaster has passed to enable a rapid, data-driven response.
•	AI-Powered Computer Vision: We will train a semantic segmentation model (e.g., U-Net) on pre-disaster imagery and open datasets of disaster damage. After an event, the model will process fresh satellite, drone or other real-time captured imagery to perform change detection, automatically creating a detailed damage map.

•	Actionable Intelligence: The output is not raw data, but a clear, color-coded map classifying areas into categories like "Severe Structural Damage," "Major flooding," and "Roads Obstructed." This allows first responders to immediately identify the most critical zones and plan the safest and fastest access routes.
These two components are unified in a single .NET-based web dashboard, providing authorities a continuous operational picture from preparedness to recovery.
column29:
Proactive Early Warning System (EWS)

Three-Tier Data Fusion: Combines satellite data (NASA, ESA), national meteorological forecasts, and real-time IoT sensor inputs.

AI-Powered Flood Prediction: Uses deep learning (e.g., Graph Neural Network) to generate hyper-local flood forecasts with sub-kilometer resolution.

Inclusive Alert Dissemination: Multi-channel alerts through SMS, IVR voice calls in Bengali, and physical sirens for last-mile coverage.

Community Registration System: Allows households to register for personalized alerts.

2. IoT Sensor Network

Low-Cost, Rugged Sensors: Solar-powered devices to monitor water level, flow, and salinity.

Real-Time Data Collection: Continuous streaming to the central AI platform.

Self-Calibrating Mechanism: Localized adjustments to correct satellite and forecast biases.

3. Reactive Damage Assessment System

AI-Based Computer Vision: Automated analysis of satellite and drone imagery post-disaster.

Change Detection & Mapping: Identifies structural damage, flooded zones, and blocked routes.

Actionable Outputs: Color-coded damage maps showing severity levels and accessibility routes.

4. Integrated Web Dashboard

Single Pane of Glass View: Combines early warnings and post-disaster assessment in one platform.

User-Friendly Interface: Designed for local disaster management authorities and volunteers.

Customizable Layers: Users can filter by water depth, risk zones, infrastructure, and population density.

Historical Data Repository: Stores flood patterns and damage records for planning and research.

5. Community-Centric Features

Local Language Accessibility: Alerts and instructions in Bengali.

Low-Tech Communication: Designed for use with basic feature phones (not just smartphones).

Volunteer Engagement Tools: Enables Cyclone Preparedness Programme (CPP) volunteers to coordinate better.

6. Scalability & Extensibility

Modular Architecture: Additional sensors or regions can be integrated easily.

National Replication Ready: Proven pilot model can be scaled to other coastal and flood-prone districts.

Data for Policy & Planning: Supports long-term infrastructure resilience and resource allocation.

column8: Technology - IOT of the Year (CT-IOT)
column25: For The Light is a youth-led social enterprise dedicated to building climate resilience in coastal Bangladesh through the integration of gender-focused technology and sustainable, women-led entrepreneurship. Founded in early 2024, our mission is to empower women and youth in climate-vulnerable communities by providing innovative, life-saving ICT solutions and sustainable economic opportunities. Our work is driven by core values of human-centered innovation, community empowerment, and strategic collaboration. We have already validated our model through a successful pilot with over 500 beneficiaries and have secured two rounds of competitive seed funding from programs supported by the British High Commission, The Asia Foundation, and the Embassy of the Netherlands.
column26:
For The Light is driven by a multidisciplinary core team of young professionals. Our structure integrates strategic leadership with deep technical expertise:

An Executive Leadership team guides the overall strategy, business development, and partnerships.

A Strategic Communications & Climate Policy unit manages our brand narrative, community engagement, and alignment with sustainability frameworks.

A robust Technology & Engineering Team, including a Chief Technology Officer, a Sensor Firmware Engineer, and a Chief Software Architect, leads the development of our IoT hardware and digital platforms.
column27: The 'Guardian' is an intelligent energy and safety platform designed for off-grid, climate-vulnerable communities. It is a smart solar lantern (an IoT device) that provides clean, reliable light and emergency USB charging. Its core function is a life-saving communication system featuring a one-touch SOS button that transmits a precise GPS location to emergency contacts via GSM/LoRaWAN, ensuring functionality even when cellular networks fail. The platform is supported by a women-led "last-mile" enterprise model for local assembly, sales, and service, creating a holistic ecosystem for resilience.
column28: Our uniqueness lies in our integrated, human-centered ecosystem. While competitors offer standalone solar lights or safety alarms, our 'Guardian' device is an all-in-one IoT platform integrating clean energy with a life-saving communication lifeline. Crucially, our core innovation is our women-led 'last-mile' enterprise model. We train local women to manage the device's assembly and service, creating a sustainable solution to economic exclusion that builds deep community trust. This fusion of smart IoT technology with a community-owned social business is our unique advantage.
column29:
Resilient Energy: 5-10W monocrystalline solar panel charging a long-life (2,000+ cycle) LiFePO4 battery, providing over 8 hours of light and USB power.

IoT-Powered Safety: Integrated one-touch SOS button with a u-blox M9N GNSS module for fast, accurate GPS location tracking.

Redundant Communication: Uses a 4G LTE / LoRaWAN module to send alerts, ensuring connectivity in diverse network conditions.

Information Integrity: An integrated FM radio provides access to verified weather alerts and news during disasters.

User-Centric Design: IP68 waterproof and shockproof casing, modular components for easy local repair, and a Bengali-language interface.
column30: Our technology is developed through a rigorous, user-centric process. The hardware is built with high-quality, certified components (CE/RoHS) to ensure durability in harsh coastal environments. Our firmware is developed in-house by our specialized engineer. We have a formal R&D partnership with the IoT Innovation Lab at Islamic University, Kushtia, to ensure our technology meets the highest standards of innovation and reliability. Our future V3 prototype will integrate on-device AI (TinyML) for autonomous emergency detection, positioning us at the cutting edge of ICT for disaster risk reduction.

column7: Cross Categories - R & D Project of the Year (CC-RD)
column10: Path Towards Resilience: A flood-resilient community hub for seasonally isolated villages of Haor region, Kishoreganj
column25: I am a recent graduate from the Department of Architecture at AIUB, focusing on community-centred solutions that integrate vernacular knowledge, sustainable strategies and technology to address social and environmental challenges in Bangladesh. My work emphasizes participatory design processes to empower communities, creating scalable, context-sensitive solutions for climate adaptation and disaster resilience. I prioritize low-tech, low-maintenance, and easily implementable approaches for underprivileged communities while exploring the integration of vernacular architectural techniques in modern practice.
column26: The project was entirely led and designed by me as the sole author and designer, as a recent graduate of the Department of Architecture, AIUB. I am responsible for all research, design development and implementation, under the supervision of Farzana Siddiqua (Assistant Professors, AIUB) and Mehedi Amin (Assistant Professors, AIUB) and with guidance from Saiful Hasan Tariq (Assistant Professors, AIUB).
column27:
Every monsoon, the ‘Haor(seasonal wet-lands)’ region in north-eastern Bangladesh isolates thousands, cutting off villages like Gora-Digha in Kishoreganj from essential services. The idea of this project begins with a question: “How can architecture ensure dignity, access and resilience in a place where even basic human rights become seasonal?”

The project proposes a flood-resilient, multifunctional community hub for seasonally isolated and underprivileged villages in the ‘Haor’ region. It addresses the recurring challenge of isolation caused by flooding, which limits access to healthcare, education, markets and social infrastructure. The hub integrates e-health services, online training and education platforms, ensuring continuous access to essential knowledge and healthcare during floods. Designed through a co-creative, participatory process, the project actively involved the community to foster ownership, encourage responsible use and ensure sustainable maintenance.

Combining vernacular knowledge with modern, low-tech solutions, the hub employs modular, flood-adaptive architecture informed by flood mapping and local insights. By empowering communities to remain connected, healthy and educated even during floods, the project strengthens resilience and social cohesion. It’s scalable and replicable design offers a blueprint for other flood-prone regions of Bangladesh.
column28:
Integrated Technology in Low-Resource Contexts: Unlike typical community centres, this hub not only provides architectural solutions but also suggests policy-level interventions, while introducing e-health services and online education platforms through architecture, offering a low-tech, low-maintenance solution tailored for underprivileged, flood-prone communities.

Participatory, Co-Creative Design: The design process actively involves the community, fostering ownership, responsible use and long-term sustainability. 

Vernacular-Informed, Flood-Adaptive Architecture: The project merges local building traditions with modern, modular, flood-resilient strategies, creating a solution that is both culturally sensitive and technologically informed.

Scalable and Replicable Model: The hub provides a blueprint and framework for other flood-prone regions, offering a flexible model that can be adapted to different communities, geographies and contexts.
column29:
Flood-Resilient Design: Modular, elevated and adaptable structures that withstand seasonal flooding, ensuring uninterrupted access to essential services.

Multi-Functional Spaces: Integration of a school, healthcare centre, community hall, marketplace and cultural forum within a single hub to serve diverse community needs.

E-Health Services: Remote healthcare access through telemedicine facilities, enabling consultations and medical support during floods.

Online Training & Education: Digital classrooms and skill-development platforms to maintain educational continuity and promote lifelong learning.

Participatory Design & Co-Creation: Active community involvement in design, fostering ownership, responsible use and sustainable maintenance.

Vernacular & Sustainable Strategies: Use of local materials, traditional construction techniques, and low-tech solutions to ensure cost-effectiveness and cultural sensitivity.

Scalable & Replicable: Designed as a model that can be adapted to other flood-prone regions, flexible for different community sizes, geographies and contexts.
column30:
E-Health Integration: Telemedicine facilities allow remote healthcare access during floods, ensuring timely medical support for underprivileged communities.

Online Training & Education Platforms: Digital classrooms and skill-building modules provide continuous learning opportunities despite seasonal isolation.

Flood Mapping & Site Analysis: GIS and basic hydrological data inform the placement and modular design of the hub, optimizing resilience and safety.

Low-Tech, Low-Maintenance Solutions: Technology is applied thoughtfully to complement vernacular construction methods, ensuring ease of use, durability and sustainability in resource-constrained contexts.

Scalable Framework: The hub’s architectural solutions and digital systems create a replicable model that can be adapted for other flood-prone regions, combining technology with participatory design for unprivileged communities.

column7: Cross Categories - Start- Up of the Year (CC-SU)
column8: Technology - AI Technology of the Year (CT-AI)
column14: Level 4, House 5, Road 1, Block C, Banasree 1219 Dhaka, Bangladesh.
column25:
StylOn is Bangladesh’s first AI-powered beauty & salon ecosystem a unified platform combining a consumer booking & e-commerce app, Salon SaaS tools, and a B2B marketplace built to digitize an otherwise fragmented BDT 25,000 crore beauty & personal-care market.

What we do :
• Consumer App: AI-driven salon discovery, instant booking, reviews, and integrated e-commerce for beauty, grooming and fashion products.

• Salon SaaS Dashboard: Cloud tools for appointment management, inventory, staff scheduling, sales analytics and customer retention.

• B2B Marketplace: Verified supplier network to serve Bangladesh’s ~850,000 salons with bulk procurement, logistics support and credit options.

• StylOn Academy : Vocational training that supplies skilled stylists to our salon network and reduces CAC for the platform.

Market & impact snapshot 

• Addressable market: Beauty & personal care ≈ BDT 25,000 crore annually (Bangladesh).

• Target subsector: ~850,000 salons & parlours (estimated), employing over 1M people across the value chain.

• Social impact: Digitization + training expected to create thousands of formalized jobs, uplift incomes (especially for women), and professionalize service standards.

Traction & validation

• AWS Startup Day Award: USD 10,000 cloud credits (technology validation & scaling support).

• Sheikh Jamal Innovation Grant: BDT 100,000.

• ICT Innovation Grant: BDT 200,000. (These recognitions validate the product-market fit and the technology direction.)


Team & capacity

Core leadership: Founder & CEO (Mahfujur Rahman Sagor), CTO (Kishon Kumar Pashi), CDO / Head of UX (Pranto Kumar Pashi).

Planned operational team: Leadership + ~20 hires across tech, product, marketing, sales, operations and customer success for Year-1 execution.

Academy staffing: 8 trainers (4 barber + 4 beauty) planned for the Uttara campus in the first 6 months.


Business model in short

Revenue streams include B2C e-commerce, B2B wholesale margins, SaaS subscriptions for salons, booking commissions (phased from Year-2) and platform advertising/promotions.
column26:
Core leadership: Founder & CEO (Mahfujur Rahman Sagor), CTO (Kishon Kumar Pashi), CDO / Head of UX (Pranto Kumar Pashi).

Planned operational team: Leadership + ~20 hires across tech, product, marketing, sales, operations and customer success for Year-1 execution.

Academy staffing: 8 trainers (4 barber + 4 beauty) planned for the Uttara campus in the first 6 months.
column27:
StylOn solves the deep-rooted problems of fragmentation, lack of digitalization, and shortage of skilled professionals in Bangladesh’s beauty sector.

For Consumers: StylOn App enables easy booking of beauty services, product discovery, and personalized recommendations.

For Businesses: Provides SaaS tools for salons, beautician freelancers, and beauty entrepreneurs to manage bookings, payments, inventory, and customer relationships.

For Workforce: StylOn Academy offers structured, industry-recognized training programs to upskill youth, especially women, and create a pipeline of certified professionals.

By merging technology with skill development, StylOn is building a complete ecosystem that addresses supply, demand, and quality simultaneously.
column28:
StylOn is the first and only startup in Bangladesh that is reimagining the beauty industry as a complete ecosystem. not just a booking app, not just a training center, but a fusion of technology, skills, and empowerment.
While others focus on one side of the market, StylOn addresses all three dimensions:

Demand: A digital platform that gives consumers access to trusted services and products.

Supply: SaaS tools that digitize and scale beauty businesses.

Workforce: A professional academy that trains and certifies the next generation of experts.

StylOn is uniquely committed to inclusive economic empowerment supporting youth, freelancers, and entrepreneurs of all genders with the digital tools, training, and market access they need to thrive.
This ecosystem model ensures StylOn is not just another startup, but a category-defining innovation with the power to transform an entire industry and position Bangladesh as a global leader in beauty-tech.
column29:
StylOn App Features :

  • Service booking (salons, freelancers, on-demand beauty services)
  • Integrated marketplace for beauty products
  • SaaS tools for salons (CRM, POS, digital payments, inventory)
  • AI-based personalization & recommendation engine
  • Secure digital payments


StylOn Academy Features : 

  • Industry-certified training programs (basic to advanced)
  • Hybrid learning model (offline + digital modules)
  • Job placement and freelancing opportunities for graduates
  • Continuous skill upgradation aligned with global beauty-tech trends

Together, these features create a seamless user experience for customers, businesses, and trainees.
column30:
At StylOn, technology is not an add-on, it is the core engine of transformation. Our platform is designed with scalability, intelligence, and impact at its heart:

Artificial Intelligence (AI): Powers personalization, matching users with the right services, and predicting demand to help businesses optimize resources.

Big Data Analytics: Generates deep insights into consumer behavior, market trends, and product performance, making StylOn a knowledge hub for the beauty industry.

SaaS Cloud Infrastructure: Empowers small salons and freelancers to digitize operations bookings, payments, CRM, inventory without heavy costs.

Mobile-First UX: Optimized for Bangladesh’s rapidly growing smartphone base, ensuring accessibility across all income levels.

Security & Reliability: Built on cloud-based architecture to ensure data protection, uptime, and smooth user experience at scale.

This integration of advanced technology makes StylOn more than a service, it is a data-driven innovation platform that can uplift an entire industry, expand globally, and ensure Bangladesh’s competitive edge in the Asia-Pacific ICT landscape.

column25: Youth Planet একটি উদীয়মান স্টার্টআপ, যার লক্ষ্য হলো পরিবেশবান্ধব উদ্ভাবন তৈরি করা। আমাদের মূল কাজ হলো প্লাস্টিকের বিকল্প সমাধান খুঁজে বের করা এবং তা স্থানীয় ও বৈশ্বিক বাজারে সহজলভ্য করা। বর্তমানে আমরা জীবাণুবিয়োজ্য স্টার্চ ব্যাগ তৈরি করছি, যা ১০০% পরিবেশবান্ধব, সাশ্রয়ী এবং সহজে বাজারজাত করা যায়। আমাদের ভিশন হলো টেকসই প্রযুক্তির মাধ্যমে দূষণমুক্ত বাংলাদেশ গড়া এবং ভবিষ্যৎ প্রজন্মের জন্য একটি সবুজ পৃথিবী রেখে যাওয়া।

column27:
আমাদের সমাধান হলো Biodegradable Starch Bag – প্লাস্টিক ব্যাগের পরিবেশবান্ধব বিকল্প। প্রতিদিন বাংলাদেশে লক্ষ লক্ষ পলিথিন ব্যবহৃত হয়, যা নদী, মাটি ও পরিবেশে মারাত্মক প্রভাব ফেলে। আমাদের তৈরি ব্যাগটি আলু ও ক্যাসাভা স্টার্চ, প্রাকৃতিক উপাদান এবং PLA দিয়ে তৈরি, যা ব্যবহারের পর স্বাভাবিকভাবে মাটিতে মিশে যায় এবং পরিবেশ দূষণ করে না।


🔹 মূল বৈশিষ্ট্য:

1.পরিবেশবান্ধব ও জীবাণুবিয়োজ্য

2.সাশ্রয়ী ও বাজারে প্রতিযোগিতামূলক মূল্য

3.টেকসই ও দৈনন্দিন ব্যবহারের উপযোগী

4.সহজে উৎপাদনযোগ্য এবং স্কেল-আপ সম্ভব

আমাদের লক্ষ্য হলো এই ব্যাগকে পলিথিনের বিকল্প হিসেবে মূলধারার বাজারে আনা এবং স্থানীয় পর্যায়ে একটি সবুজ ব্যবসায়িক ইকোসিস্টেম তৈরি করা।
column28: বাংলাদেশে এরকম ব্যাগ তৈরি শুরু করেছে মাত্র দুটি প্রতিষ্ঠান, যারা ভুট্টা বা পাটের আঁশ স্টার্চ বানায় যেটি অনেক ব্যয়বহুল । PLA(বায়োপ্লাস্টিক) দেশের বাহির থেকে আমদানী করতে হয় কিন্তু স্থানীয়ভাবে PLA তৈরি করবো , আর স্টার্চ উৎপাদন করবো আলো দিয়ে যেটি সল্পব্যয়ী আবার ভুট্টাএ স্টার্চ ব্যাগের মতোই মজবুত । যেহেতু আমরা সব নিজেরাই করব তাই প্রকৃত অর্থে টেকসই এবং স্বনির্ভর হবে ।
column29:
স্টার্চ ব্যাগ বানানোর জন্য কয়েক ধরণের মেশিনারি দরকার হয়। এগুলো সাধারণত প্লাস্টিক ব্যাগ তৈরির মেশিনের মতো হলেও কিছুটা আলাদা, কারণ এখানে স্টার্চ/PLA মিশ্রণ ব্যবহার হয়। প্রয়োজনীয় মেশিনারিজ ধাপে ধাপে নিচে দিলাম:

🔹 ১. Raw Material Processing

Starch Dryer / Dehydrator → কাঁচা স্টার্চ শুকানোর জন্য।

High-speed Mixer / Blender → স্টার্চ, PLA, CaCO₃, Plasticizer ইত্যাদি ভালোভাবে মিশানোর জন্য।

🔹 ২. Granule / Pellet Making

Twin Screw Extruder (Starch + PLA Compounding Machine)

স্টার্চ ও PLA মিশ্রণকে হিটিং ও প্রেসার দিয়ে গ্রানুল (pellet) বানানো হয়।

Cooling Conveyor → গরম গ্রানুল ঠান্ডা করার জন্য।

Pellet Cutter / Granulator → গ্রানুল কাটার জন্য।

🔹 ৩. Film Making (Bag Sheet তৈরির ধাপ)

Film Blowing Machine (Biodegradable Film Blowing Line)

গ্রানুল গলিয়ে ফিল্ম শীট আকারে তৈরি হয়।

এখানেই ব্যাগের micron thickness (20–25 micron ইত্যাদি) নির্ধারণ হয়।

Air Cooling System → ফিল্ম ঠান্ডা ও শক্ত করার জন্য।

🔹 ৪. Bag Making (Final Shape)

Bag Cutting & Sealing Machine

ফিল্ম শীট কেটে ব্যাগের আকার দেয়া হয়।

তাপ (Heat sealing) বা ultrasonics ব্যবহার করে মুখ সিল করা হয়।

Printing Machine (Optional) → লোগো বা ব্র্যান্ড প্রিন্ট করার জন্য।

🔹 ৫. Quality & Packing

Quality Testing Machines → টেনসাইল স্ট্রেন্থ, বায়োডিগ্রেডেবিলিটি টেস্ট।

Packing Machine → ব্যাগ প্যাক করার জন্য।




এই ব্যাগটি দেখতে ও ব্যবহারযোগ্যতার দিক থেকে সাধারণ পলিথিন ব্যাগের মতো হলেও, এটি সম্পূর্ণরূপে পরিবেশবান্ধব। প্রধান বৈশিষ্ট্যসমূহ:

১।জল ও আর্দ্রতার সহনশীলতা

২।নির্দিষ্ট সময় পরে মাটিতে মিশে যাওয়ার ক্ষমতা

৩।পুনর্ব্যবহারযোগ্য এবং খাদ্য-নিরাপদ

৪।পরিবেশের কোনো ক্ষতি না করে নষ্ট হয়ে যাওয়ার ক্ষমতা

স্থানীয়ভাবে উৎপাদিত উপকরণে তৈরি হওয়ায় সাশ্রয়ী মূল্যে উৎপাদন সম্ভব
আমাদের ব্যাগের বড় সুবিধা হচ্ছে এটি আমদানি নির্ভর নয়
column30:
এই ব্যাগ তৈরিতে ব্যবহার করা হয়েছে PLA (Polylactic Acid), যা একটি বায়ো-বেজড পলিমার, এবং এটি আলু ও ক্যাসাভা স্টার্চের সঙ্গে সংমিশ্রণে প্রক্রিয়াজাত করা হয়। এই প্রযুক্তি উচ্চমানের এবং আন্তর্জাতিক মানদণ্ড অনুসরণ করে। এর ফলে ব্যাগটি পরিবেশে দ্রুত ক্ষয়প্রাপ্ত হয় এবং প্লাস্টিক দূষণের টেকসই সমাধান দেয়। 
বর্তমানে PLA বাংলাদেশে আমদানি করতে হয়, তবে আমরা PLA  উৎপাদন করবো যার মাধ্যমে সম্পূর্ণ দেশীয় প্রযুক্তির ব্যাগ তৈরি হবে। এটি প্রযুক্তিগতভাবে একটি বড় অগ্রগতি ও উদ্ভাবনী দৃষ্টান্ত।

column25: BookCycle is a student–led platform that keeps books in circulation through borrow, exchanges and giveaways. Our mission is to make reading more affordable while reducing waste and promoting recycling on campus and in local communities.
column26:
Team Size: 1 (Student Founder)
Role: Full-stack developer, product & operations
University: Ahsanullah University of Science and Technology, [C.S.E. 4th year]
column27: BookCycle is a community driven platform just for books, not a general buy and sell app, so it fits campus life better. If you cannot afford a new book, you can find free giveaways first or swap with others. People post a book, someone requests it, and they meet at safe campus drop points to hand it over. It has textbook friendly details like title, author, edition, and condition, plus smart alerts that notify you when a book you need appears so you do not miss it. Search and filters are clear and fast, there is chat option to plan meetups, and there is an AI chatbot to answer common questions and guide new users. The project also counts community reuse over time to highlight less waste and more sharing.
column28: BookCycle is only for books, not a general buy and sell site. It puts free first so students with low cash can get books easily. It recycles books through exchange and giveaway, so books are not wasted and keep moving to new readers. Students can read the real paper copy, not just on a phone or laptop, which keeps the true feel of reading. This also reduces paper waste and supports a sharing culture on campus. An AI chatbot helps new users with quick answers.
column29:
Home shows the goal, quick search, and a “Book Genie” chatbot button for quick help.
Explore lets you find books by title, author, genre, edition, and condition.
Profile shows your shelves like gave away, exchanged, and want lists.
Chat lets users talk and fix a safe campus meeting point.
Activity shows your requests, handoffs, and updates in one place.
Settings lets you manage login, alerts, and basic privacy.
column30:
Built with React and Tailwind for a clean, fast web app.
Node and Express with MongoDB power the API and data.
Images are stored and served with Cloudinary for easy upload and fast delivery.
Code is version controlled with GitHub and deployed from the main branch.
Login uses JWT for safe sessions.
Chatbot uses Google Gemini to answer common questions and guide new users.

column7: Cross Categories - R & D Project of the Year (CC-RD)
column10: An Intelligent SCADA System for Power Distribution Network Cable Fault Detection with Real-Time Monitoring and Autonomous Maintenance
column14: Apartment: 1/C/1, Area: Barontack, Dhaka Cantonment, Pallabi, Dhaka 1206
column25: I am a B.Sc. Electrical and Electronic Engineering graduate from American International University-Bangladesh (AIUB). My research interests include SCADA systems, power system automation, and IoT-based monitoring. The submitted project, “An Intelligent SCADA System for Power Distribution Network Cable Fault Detection with Real-Time Monitoring and Autonomous Maintenance”, is designed to enhance fault management and reliability in modern power distribution networks by integrating IoT-based monitoring, autonomous fault detection, and maintenance features.
column26:
Project Lead :
Name: S M Nahidul Islam
Role: Main researcher and project developer
Affiliation: B.Sc. in Electrical and Electronic Engineering, American International University-Bangladesh (AIUB)

Supervisors / Mentors:
Shameem Ahmad
Assistant Professor
Department of EEE, AIUB
Role: Academic guidance and technical supervision

Md. Rifat Hazari
Assistant Professor
Department of EEE, AIUB
Role: Academic guidance and review support
column27: Supervisory Control and Data Acquisition (SCADA) systems are significant for boosting industrial operations, but established systems often struggle with fault management and real-time monitoring. To address these issues, this paper proposes an advanced SCADA system that integrates IoT technologies, multi-agent systems, and predictive maintenance for seamless data collection, analysis, and decision-making. Machine learning enhances fault detection and cybersecurity, while a modular hardware design allows scalability and flexibility to various industrial environments. The system is highly sensitive to detecting faults, including open circuit faults, line-to-ground faults, line-to-line faults, double line to ground faults and three-phase faults. It improves operational safety and efficiency by accurately locating faults and notifying professionals in real time. Extensive simulations and hardware tests were conducted to validate its performance in different fault scenarios. The results show that the proposed SCADA system has successfully detected different types of faults, offering a unified approach for fault management, maintenance, and real-time monitoring.
column28: The proposed system uniquely integrates IoT technologies with multi-agent systems and predictive maintenance within a SCADA framework, offering a holistic solution for power distribution fault management. Unlike conventional SCADA systems that rely on manual supervision, this solution employs machine learning to enhance fault classification, fault location accuracy, and cybersecurity protection. The modular hardware design ensures scalability, making the system adaptable to diverse industrial environments, from small-scale distribution grids to large smart grid networks. This comprehensive approach combines real-time monitoring, intelligent decision-making, and autonomous maintenance, which is rarely available in existing SCADA implementations.
column29:
1. Real-time monitoring of distribution cables using IoT-enabled sensors
2. Automatic detection and classification of multiple fault types (open circuit, line-to-ground, line-to-line, double line-to-ground, and three-phase faults)
3. Accurate fault localization to identify the affected cable or pole
4.Machine learning integration for predictive analysis and enhanced cybersecurity
4. Autonomous maintenance alerts to minimize downtime and operational losses
5. Modular hardware and software architecture ensuring scalability and flexibility
6.User-friendly SCADA interface with instant fault notifications and visual data analytics
column30: The system demonstrates high-quality engineering by combining advanced IoT modules, modular hardware design, and intelligent fault detection algorithms within a SCADA environment. Through extensive simulation and hardware validation, the solution has proven to be robust, accurate, and responsive in real-world fault scenarios. The use of machine learning enhances detection accuracy and provides predictive capabilities, ensuring proactive maintenance. Moreover, the modular design allows seamless scalability, while the integration of secure IoT communication protocols ensures data integrity and system resilience against cyber threats. This makes the solution highly applicable to modern industrial power distribution networks seeking efficiency, safety, and sustainability.
